materials: Peaches & Creme™ (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m OR Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Main Color (MC) Colour of your choice 1 ball
Contrast A Colour of your choice 1 ball
Size U.S.J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Chain (ch) 5 at beginning (beg) of each round (rnd) counts as 1 dc and ch-2 space (sp).
With MC, ch 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st).
Base round (rnd): Ch 5. (3 dc. Ch 2) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Fasten off A.
1st rnd: Join A with sl st in ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp (corner made). Repeat (Rep) from * twice more. Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Fasten off A.
2nd rnd: Join MC with sl st in corner ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp (corner made).* Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Fasten off MC.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st in ch-1 sp. Ch 5. *Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner ch-2 sp.* Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Fasten off A.
4th to 11th rnds: As 3rd rnd, alternating MC with A as illustrated.

materials: Peaches & Créme™ Stripey™ (2 oz/56.7 g; 102 yds/93 m)
Color of your choice 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sts and 7 rows = 4"  [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 44. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 43 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc. Rep from * across to last sc, pushing tr to RS of work. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * across to last sc, pushing tr to RS of work. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
5th row: As 3rd row. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm], ending on a RS row. 
Hanging Loop: Ch 10. Join with sl st in last sc worked. 
Fasten oﬀ.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds)
1 ball each of: Dk Blue, Lt Blue or White.
Size 4 mm (U.S. 6 or G) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 17 sts and 18 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 42.  
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from  hook. *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 
1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. 41 sts. Ch 1. T urn.  
2nd row: 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep
from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Ch 1. T urn. 
3rd row:1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep
from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Ch 1. T urn. 
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 9 ins [23 cm] . 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7230 Peachy A, 7775 Tulip B
RED HEART® Scrubby™: small amount 12 Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, stitch marker, ecru sewing thread, sewing needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 8 dc = 1½" (4 cm); 3 rows = 1½" (4 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY HEAD: With A, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc,* dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 dc.
First Ear: Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 6 dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each remaining st across, turn—5 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc3tog; working down side edge, slip st in end of each row to first unworked dc of Round 6, *sc in next 4 dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * twice, sc in next 7 dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn.
2nd Ear: Note: Last 7 sts of Row 7 of first ear are Row 1 of 2nd ear.
Rows 2–6: Repeat Rows 2–6 of first ear.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc3tog, turn; working down side edge, slip st in end of each row to unworked sts of Round 6, *sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * twice, slip st in slip st in Row 1 of first ear. Fasten off.
Snout: With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around —18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around —24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
FINISHING: Refer to photograph as a guide for placement of all pieces. With C, embroider a French knot for each nostril and couched stitches for smile. With sewing needle and thread, sew snout to head.
Eye (make 2): With C, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Tie beginning and end tails together and trim. With sewing needle and thread, sew eye in place, holding knot behind eye as sewing progresses. Trim 'eyelash' strands from all facial pieces. Weave in end.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Psychedelic Ombre (02600) or Mod Green (01223) or Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 47.5 yds/43 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
instructions:
Foundation Piece
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in ring. Place marker in first sc. 9 sc in ring. 10 sc. Note: Sts in following rnds are worked through back loops only. Foundation Piece is worked in spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 50 sc. Join with sl st to next st. Fasten off. 
Texture Layer
Join yarn with sl st in first unworked front loop at center of Foundation Piece. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st into same st.
*Sl st in unworked front loop of next st. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st into same st. Rep from * until all unworked front loops have been worked around Foundation Piece.
Ch 12 for hanging loop. Join with sl st to 12th ch from hook.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton Blend™”: 1 skein each 749 Tangerine A, 802 Rose B and 436 Currant C
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm (US I-9)
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, etc = color A, B, etc
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
instructions:
With C, ch 32.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across – 31 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, *sc in ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from *, end sc in beginning ch-1.
Rows 3-29: Repeat Row 2. Do not fasten off.
EDGING
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, 3 sc in first sc, sc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st, turn to work along side edge, sc 29 sts evenly spaced along side edge, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, 3 sc in first st of foundation ch, sc in each st across last st, 3 sc in last st, turn to work along side edge, sc 29 sts evenly spaced along side edge, slip st to first st to join – 128 sc. Fasten off.
Row 2: With right side facing, join A in center st in any corner, ch 1, 3 sc in same st, *sc in each sc across to next corner sc, 3 sc in center sc of corner; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc to join – 136 sc. Fasten off.
Row 3: With right side facing, join B in center st in any corner, *[skip next sc, 3-dc Cluster in next sc, ch 1] across to last sc before center sc of corner, skip last sc, ([3-dc Cluster, ch 2] 3 times) in center sc of corner; repeat from * around, slip st in first st to join. Fasten off. 
Row 4: With right side facing, join A in any ch-space, ch 1, sc in same space, ch 2, [sc in next ch-space, ch 2] around, slip st to first st to join. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends. RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton Blend™”, Art.E749 (3 ounce/145 yard ball).

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Dark Pine (00016) 1 ball or 46.5 yds [42.5 m]
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 6.5 yds [6 m]
Main Color (MC) Bright Navy (00009) 1 ball or 46.5 yds [42.5 m]
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 6.5 yds [6 m]
Size U.S H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
MUG
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
With MC, ch 20.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 19 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each sc to last sc. 2 hdc in last sc. Turn. 21 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 23 hdc.
5th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 25 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece from beg measures approx 7" [18 cm], ending on a WS row.
Marshmallow edging:
Break MC and join A.
1st row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. 4 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Handle
Ch 18.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 5 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in each of next 5 sc. 27 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Handle to Mug as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball 905 Cherry
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses in same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 5½" wide x 6" long (14 x 15 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, picot, dc in same st as join, *dc in next st, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, dc in next st, (dc, picot, ch 2, slip st) in next st, slip st in next 2 sts*, (ch 3, picot, tr) in next st, tr in next st, (tr, picot, tr) in next st, tr in next st, (tr, picot, ch 3, slip st) in next st, slip st in next 2 sts, (ch 2, picot, dc) in next st; repeat from * to * once, (slip st, ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, slip st) in next st (stem made), slip st in last 2 sts; join with slip st in base of beginning ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 1 ball each 9254 Brite Orange A, 9330 Tan B, and 9237 Lime C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm (US K-10½)
Yarn needle
measurements: Scrubby measures about 6" (15.2 cm) in diameter when scrunched.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 3; join with a slip st to 1st ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3, 30 dc in ring; join with a slip st to beginning ch.
Round 2: Ch 3, 6 dc in each dc around; join with slip st to beginning ch. 
Round 3: Ch 3, 5 dc in each dc around; join with slip st to beginning ch.
Fasten off, leaving an 8" (20.3 cm) tail for seaming later. Scrunch Scrubby to form circle.
Loop
With B, ch 30; join with slip st to 1st ch to form a ring.
Fasten off, leaving an 8" (20.3 cm) tail for seaming later.
Leaf
With C, ch 7. 
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next st, hdc in each of next 2 sts, dc in next st, 5 dc in next st; rotate to work down opposite side of ch, dc in next st, hdc in each of next 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, join with slip st to 1st sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using yarn needle, attach Leaf to Scrubby using long tail of A. Attach Loop to Scrubby using long tail of B.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) 00001 (White) 1 ball or 60 g/66 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 73 loosely. (See diagram on page 2).
1st row: 7 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 8 dc). 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. Place marker on last dc. *(Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - dc2tog made. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. Rep from * 7 times more. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in next dc (counts as dc2tog). (1 dc in each of next 5 sts. Dc2tog) 7 times. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in each of next 8 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 8 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc) 8 times. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in next dc (counts as dc2tog). (1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Dc2tog) 7 times. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. (2 dc in next d c. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) 8 times. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc) 8 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) 8 times. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in next dc (counts as dc2tog). (1 dc in next st. Dc2tog) 7 times. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc) 8 times. Turn.
7th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc) 8 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (Dc2tog) 8 times. Turn.
8th row: Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 8 times. Yoh and draw through all 9 loops on hook – dc8tog made. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. (2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc) 8 times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Bring last st and marked st tog (see diagram). Sew from marker to center. Rep for opposite side with first st and marker.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz /57 g; 95 yds/86 m)
White (00001) or Dark Pine (00016) or Mistletoe (00138) or Hot Orange (01628) or Swimmng Pool Ombre (02744) 1 ball or 92 yds/84 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Dcfp (double crochet front post) = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Ch 34.  
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 sts.  
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.  
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 dcfp around post of next st. *1 dc in next st. (1 dcfp around post of next st) twice. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 hdc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 8¾" [25 cm], ending on a WS row.
Final row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Ch 15 (for loop). Sl st back into top of last dc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz; 73 m/80 yds; Ombres: 42.5 g/1.5 oz; 62 m/68 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Terra Firma (23013) 2 balls
Jute (00085) 1 ball
Warm Brown (13130) 1 ball
abbreviations: MB = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
Scbp = Insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Scfp = Insert hook from back to front around post of next stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
instructions:
Arruga Stitch Version (A)
Ch 35.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 33 dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Scbp around next dc. Scfp around next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Scfp around next dc. Scbp around next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm]. Rep 2nd row once more. Do not fasten off. Cont as follows for edging:
Edging: (RS). Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Subtle Bobble Version (B)
Ch 32.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 sc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th and 5th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows.
6th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. *MB. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 5th row. Do not fasten off. Cont as follows for edging:
Edging: (RS). Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
“V” Cluster Version (C)
Ch 33. 
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 5th ch from hook. *Miss next ch. 2 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 29 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *2 dc between next 2 dc cluster. Rep from * across, ending with 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off. Cont as follows for edging:
Edging: Ch 4. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook-picot made. Rep from * around outer edge, working (Picot. 1 sc. Picot) in each corner. Join with sl st to base of ch 4. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Red (00095) 1 ball or 20 m/22 yds
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 14 m/16 yds
Contrast B Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 23 m/26 yds
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With MC, work 3 rows.
*With A, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.*
Rep from * to * 3 times more.
With MC, work 2 rows.
These 17 rows form Stripe Pat.
With MC, ch 6. (See diagrams).
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Turn – 1 block made.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg block made.
(Sl st. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp – block made. Turn – 2 blocks.
3rd row: Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 sp) twice. Break MC. Turn – 3 blocks.
4th row: Join A with sl st in first dc. Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 sp) 3 times. Break A. Turn – 4 blocks.
5th row: Join B with sl st in first dc. Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 sp) 4 times. Break B. Turn – 5 blocks.
6th row: Join MC with sl st in first dc. Beg block. (Block in next ch-3 sp) 5 times. Break MC. Turn – 6 blocks.
Cont in this manner, inc 1 block each row and keeping cont of Stripe Pat until there are 9 blocks (9 rows are complete).
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, beg dec each side as follows:
1st row: (WS). Join A with sl st in first ch-3 sp. Block in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp (do not make a block). Break A. Join B. Turn.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until 1 block remains. Fasten off.

pattern_name: SCRUBBING IN THE ROUND CROCHET DISHCLOTH
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Spring Blue (90016) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Ch 3. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd:  10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc. 
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 dcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first st. 30 sts.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 dcfp in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first st. 40 sts. 
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 dcfp in next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first st. 50 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 dcfp in next st. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first st. 60 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first st. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 dcfp in next st. Rep from * to last 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first st. 70 sts.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Popcorn in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. Popcorn in last st. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8506 Ice Pop A and 8012 Licorice B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
Sewing needle and ecru thread
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 8 dc = 1½" (4 cm); 3 rows = 1½" (4 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Head
With A, ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next 3 dc, 2 sc in next dc, *sc in next 4 dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 sc. Fasten off.
Ear (make 2) 
With A, ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 10 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Snout 
With A, ch 9.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 6 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 6 ch, 2 sc in last ch—18 sc. 
Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in last 2 sc—24 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—36 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—42 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc. 
Round 7: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Eye (make 2) 
With B, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Ears With end tails, sew ears to top of head, leaving 10 sts between ears.
Sew remaining pieces to head with sewing needle and thread.
Eyes Tie beginning and end tails together on wrong side of each eye and trim close to knot. Sew eyes in place. 
Snout With B, embroider straight stitches for each nostril and short backstitches for smile. Draw beginning and end tails to wrong side of snout and tie together. Trim ends. Align lower edge of snout to lower edge of head and sew snout in place, working stitches through base of each reverse sc.
Trim “eyelash” strands from nostrils and eyes to emphasize their shape.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 870 Royal A, 10 Coconut B, and 905 Cherry C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle, sewing needle, white thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 7¾” (19.5 cm) from back to trunk x 6½” (16.5 cm) long.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Upper Body
With A, ch 14.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—13 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st across to last sc, 2 sc in last st, turn—19 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 6–9: Repeat Row 5; change to B at end of Row 9.
Rows 10–12: Repeat Row 5; change to C at end of Row 12.
Rows 13–16: Repeat Row 5.
Trunk
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 sc.
Row 18: Repeat Row 5.
Row 19: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc2tog, turn.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc2tog, 3 sc in last st, turn—4 sc.
Row 21: Ch 1, 3 sc in first st, slip st in last 2 sts. Fasten off.
Lower Body 
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side of upper body facing, skip first st, join C with sc in next st, sc in each remaining st across, turn—15 sc. Do not fasten off.
Back leg
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 4 st, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off.
Front leg 
Row 1: With right side of Row 1 of lower body facing, skip first 7 sts, join C with sc in next st, sc in last 3 sts, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off.
Edging 
With right side facing, join A with slip st in 7th st of Row 1 of upper body, ch 10, slip st in same st (hanging loop made), sc evenly around, working 3 sc in outer corners of legs and trunk; join with slip st in first slip st. 
Fasten off.
Star (make 3) 
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—5 sc.
Round 2: *Slip st in next sc, ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook; repeat from * 4 times, join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
With sewing needle and white thread, sew stars in place on upper body.

materials: YARN
• Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
COLORS
Quantity
VERSION I
• Main Color (MC) Tangerine (01699) 1 ball
VERSION II
• Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball
• Contrast B Rose Pink (00046) 1 ball
• Contrast C Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball
TOOLS
• Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
• Susan Bates® yarn needle.
• Tape measure.
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
Version I:
With MC, make a slip knot and place it on the hook.
Slip knot
Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot.
Chain (ch) 26.
Chain
*Yarn over hook (Yoh), draw through loop – 1 chain made. Repeat (rep) from * 25 times more – 26 chains made.
1st row:  1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
Single crochet
Insert hook into 2nd ch from hook. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook – 1 sc made.
Rep last steps in each ch to end of chain - 25 sc made. Turn.
Note:  There will be 25 sc in 1st row [1st skipped ch does not count as stitch (st)].
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (Rep) last row until work from beginning (beg) measures approx 8" [20.5 cm].
Fasten off
To fasten off the yarn, cut yarn leaving a long tail. Pull end through loop on hook and pull gently to tighten.
Weave in all yarn tails.
Version II: Work as given in Version I in Stripe Pattern (Pat) as follows:
Stripe Pat:
With A:  1 row
With B:  3 rows
With A:  5 rows
With C:  3 rows
With A:  4 rows
These 16 rows form Stripe Pat.
We love seeing your makes! Share your photos using #YARNSPO and tag us @yarnspirations on Instagram or find us on Facebook.
Note:  To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8260 Orange A, 8215 Lemon B, 8690 Avocado C, and 8001 Marshmallow D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 3¾” gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), Fpdc around first dc, *dc in next dc, Fpdc around same dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, Fpdc around same dc, *dc in next 2 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked, *dc in next 3 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked, *dc in next 4 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked, *dc in next 5 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 dc.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 5 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked, *dc in next 6 dc, Fpdc around last dc worked; repeat from * around; change to D; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—84 dc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 6 dc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—96 sc.
Fasten off.
Round 9: Working in back loops only, join first color with sc in back loop of first sc, sc in each sc around, (slip st, ch 10, slip st) in first sc (hanging loop made), turn, slip st in each ch; join with slip st in same sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby: 1 ball 938 Almond
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
gauge: 13 hdc = 4” [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4” [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
Ch 27.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each chain across – 26 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each st across. 
Repeat Row 2 until Dishcloth measures 8” [20.5 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off  ™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Bubble White (90019) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 button.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc throughout.
Ch 16 (multiple of 2 ch + 2) loosely. See Diagram I on page 2.
Foundation row: (RS). 1 dc in 5th ch from hook. Working in front of last dc worked, 1 dc in last skipped ch. *Skip next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Working in front of last dc worked, 1 dc in last skipped ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. 14 dc. Turn.
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. *Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc. Working in front of last dc worked, 1 dc in last skipped sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 10" [25.5 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
With WS facing, ch 10. Join with sl st into first ch to form a ring.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 11½" [29 cm], ending on a 1st row.
Next row: Sl st in each of first 7 sc. Ch 5. Sl st into each of next 7 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With RS tog, fold and sew layers tog at side seams as shown in Diagram II, leaving 1½" [4 cm] flap free. Turn RS out. Sew on button to correspond with button loop.

materials: Lily® sugar ‘n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) main color (mc) Red (00095) (65 m/72 yds) or 1 ball
contrast a Black (00002) (30 m/35 yds) or 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 stitch markers.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] diameter, excluding Head and Legs.
instructions:
note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
With MC, ch 3 (See Diagram 1 on page 2).
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 80 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 90 hdc. Fasten off.
Place markers on 18th, 34th, 56th and 72nd hdc of last rnd for Legs.
head: With A, ch 1. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Turn.
**1st row: 5 sc in same sp as last sl st. Miss next hdc of 9th rnd. Sl st in next hdc. Ch 1. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Turn.
2nd row: 2 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Ch 1. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Turn.
3rd row: 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Ch 1. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Turn.**
4th row: 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Ch 1. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Turn.
5th row: 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 4 times. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Ch 1. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Turn.
6th row: 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 9. 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in each of next 5 ch – antennae made. 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc. Antennae. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Fasten off.
Legs: With RS of Body facing, join A with sl st to next marked hdc. Ch 1.
Sl st in next hdc of 9th rnd. Turn.
Work from ** to ** as given for Head. Fasten off.
Dots: (make 6).
With A, ch 3 (See Diagram 2 on page 2).
10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end to sew on Dot.
Sew Dots to Body, as shown in picture.
With A, work chain st embroidery across Body as shown in diagram.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball or 79 yds/72 m
Contrast B Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 40 yds/37 m
Contrast C Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
instructions:
Notes: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch-3, unless indicated in the pattern.
Base and Filling (make 1 each with A and B) (see diagram on page 2).
Ch 4.
1st rnd: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join. 6 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 12 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 24 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join. 36 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join. 48 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join. 64 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join. 80 dc. Fasten off.
Lattice Strips
Long Strip (make 4).
**With A, ch 2, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in sc. Turn.**
Rep last row until Strip measures 8" [20.5 cm], when slightly stretched.
Fasten off, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
Medium Strip (make 4).
Work from ** to ** as given for Long Strip.
Rep last row until Strip measures 7" [18 cm], when slightly stretched.
Fasten off, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
Short Strip (make 4).
Work from ** to ** as given for Long Strip.
Rep last row until Strip measures 6" [15 cm], when slightly stretched.
Fasten off, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
FINISHING
Place WS of Base and Filling pieces tog. Lay Strips on top and following Assembly Diagram on page 3, weave Strips into ‘crust’ top, taking care to keep Strips flat. Using yarn ends at each end of Strip, sew ends of Strips in position to outer edge (working through all thicknesses to secure all pieces).
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st through all thicknesses in any dc at outer edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 79 sc around outer edge. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next sc. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next sc. Rep from * around to last sc. Skip last sc. Join with sl st at base of ch-3. Ch 13 for hanging loop. Join with sl st in last sl st. Fasten off.
Pi Symbol
Top of Symbol
With C, ch 18.
1st row: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 12 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in next ch. Fasten off.
“Legs” of Symbol (make 2)
With C, ch 16.
1st row: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Stitch Legs of Pi Symbol to pie as shown in photo. Stitch Top of Symbol to pie, ensuring that tops of Legs are covered by Top of Symbol.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 65 yds/60 m
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Sizes U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Flag
With MC and larger hook, ch 24. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 23 sc. 
Turn.  
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
across.  Turn. 
Rep 2nd row for pat with MC until 
from beg measures 3¼" [8.5 cm]. 
Break MC. Join A. 
Cont in pat with A until work from 
beg measures 8¾" [22 cm].  Break 
A. Join MC.
Cont in pat with MC until work 
from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. 
Fasten off.  
Maple Leaf 
See diagram on page 2.
With MC and smaller hook, ch 11.  
1st rnd: 1 sc in 3rd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each of next 7 ch. (1 sc. 
Ch 3. 1 sc) in last ch.  Working into 
opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of 
next 7 ch.  Turn.
Note: Work in back loops only of 
each sc and ch-1 sp throughout.  
2nd row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 7 sc. 1 sc in next ch. 
(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch.  1 sc in 
next ch. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in next ch. 
Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in in each 
of next 8 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in next ch. 
Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of 
next 8 sc. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in next ch. 
Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of 
next 8 sc. Turn
6th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 3rd ch from 
hook.  1 sc in next ch.  1 sc in each 
of next 6 sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 7 sc. Turn. 
8th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 3rd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each 
of next 6 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc of 
6th rnd. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in 
next ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc.  
Turn.
10th row: Ch 2. 1 sc in each of 
next 7 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc 
of 6th row. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp of 
6th row.  1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 
Turn.
11th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 3rd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each 
of next 6 sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc 
in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 
13th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 3rd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each 
of next 6 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc of 
10th row. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc 
in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc.  
Turn.
15th row: Ch 2. 1 sc in each of next 
7 sc. 1 sc in next sc of 10th row. Sl st 
in each st across to last 3 sts.  Turn. 
Leave rem sts unworked.
16th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in next st. 
1 hdc in each st across to last 4 sts. 
3 dc in next st. Fasten off.  
Stem 
With RS facing, and smaller hook, 
join MC with sl st at bottom center 
of Leaf. Ch 6.  1 sc in 4th ch from 
hook.  1 sc in each of next 2 ch.  
Fasten off. 
Block both pieces lightly. Sew 
Maple Leaf onto center of Flag as 
shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Naturals (56.7 g/2 oz) 1 ball of #02046 (Earth Ombre)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). [3 dc. (Ch 2. 4 dc)] 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd to 8th rnds: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each dc to next ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around, having 3 sc in corner ch-2 sps. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays Ombres (100 g / 3.5 oz) Crochet Version: 1 ball of #47706 (Mistletoe Ombre). Size 5 mm (U.S. H / 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Knit Version: 1 ball of #47706 (Mistletoe Ombre). Size 5.5 mm (U.S. 9) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: Crochet version: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]. Knit version: 17 sts and 32 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in garter st.
instructions:
CROCHET VERSION
Ch 37.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch. 36 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for 10 ins [25.5 cm]. Fasten off.

KNIT VERSION
Cast on 37 sts.
Knit every row (garter st) for 10 ins [25.5 cm]. Cast off knitwise.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball 8215 Lemon
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.25mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
FLOWER
Ch 4, sc in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch 3 – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 48 hdc.
Round 4: Sc in same st, hdc in next st, (dc, tr) in next st, (tr, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st, *sc in next st, hdc in next st, (dc, tr) in next st, (tr, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 8 petals.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds) (Ombres: 56.7g/2 oz/86 m/95 yds)
GINGHAM DISHCLOTH Main Color (MC) (01740 Hot Pink) 1 ball
Contrast A (00046 Rose Pink) 1 ball
Contrast B (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball
Contrast C (00144 Strawberry) 1 ball
Contrast D (01712 Hot Green) 1 ball
CROSS STITCH POT HOLDER Main Color (MC) (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball
Contrast A (00046 Rose Pink) 1 ball
Contrast B (01740 Hot Pink) 1 ball
Contrast C (00084 Sage Green) 1 ball
Contrast D (01712 Hot Green) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
10 ins [25.5 cm] square of flame retardant lining and blunt ended tapestry needle for Pot Holder.
measurements: Dishcloth Approx 10 ins [25.5 cm] square. Pot Holder Approx 11 ins [28 cm] square.
instructions:
GINGHAM DISHCLOTH
Note: To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Yoh with new color and complete st. When working with 2 colors within a row, lay unused color along previous row and work over unused color.
With A, ch 37. 
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * to end of ch. 36 sc. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: As 2nd row, joining MC at end of last row.
5th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: As 5th row, joining A at end of last row.
9th row: As 2nd row.
Rep 2nd to 9th rows 3 times more, then 2nd to 8th rows once. Fasten off.
Edging: Join MC with sl st in bottom right corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. Work sc evenly up side of Dish Cloth to next corner. (2 sc. Ch 9 for hanging loop. Sl st back into last sc. 1 sc) all in next corner. Work sc evenly around rem of Dish Cloth, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rose
With C, ch 11.
1st row: 3 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 4 dc). 4 dc in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off. Coil foundation row into rose shape and sew through all thicknesses to secure.
Leaves (make 2): With D, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 5 dc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch into rem loops, 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Sew Rose and Leaves in position as shown in picture.
CROSS STITCH POT HOLDER
FRONT
With MC, ch 41. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 40 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 39 times more. Fasten off.
BACK
With A, work as for Front.
FINISHING
Using cross st, embroider Chart on Front. Trim flame retardant lining to fit Back. With lining between pieces and WS facing each other, place Back and Front tog. 
Edging: 1st rnd: Working through both thicknesses and with Front facing, join MC with sl st in bottom left corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edges to join pieces, working 3 sc in each corner. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break MC.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc around working 3 sc in each corner sc. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break B.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Miss next sc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around to last 3 sc. Miss next sc. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next sc. Miss last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 2. Rep from * around working (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 dc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in each corner ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Fasten off.
Loop: With Back facing, join B with sl st to 2nd rnd of Edging in top right corner. Ch 12. Join with sl st in same sp. Fasten off.
CHART
KEY
D B
E C A
CROSS STITCH

materials: Peaches & Crème® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Stripey: 2 oz/56.7 g; 102 yds/93 m) White (11005) or Gold (11605) or Spring Blue Stripes (17008) 1 ball or 92 yds/84 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Ch 34.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 dcfp around post of next st. *1 dc in next st. (1 dcfp around post of next st) twice. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 hdc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 8¾" [25 cm], ending on a WS row.
Final row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Ch 15 (for loop). Sl st back into top of last dc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) (00002) Black 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amounts of pink and white yarn for embroidery of eyes and mouth
measurements: Approx 13 ins [33 cm] wide x 7 ins [18 cm] high in center.
instructions:
Beg at lower edge of Body, ch 5. 
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn.
6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each
sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. 16 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of
row. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more.
Next row: Ch 22 (for wing). 2 sc in 2nd ch
from hook. *1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Draw
up a loop in each of next 3 ch. Yoh and
draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog
made. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch.* 3 sc in next
ch.  Rep from * to * once more. 2 sc in next
ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 22 (for wing). 2 sc in 2nd ch
from hook. *1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Sc3tog
over next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch.* 
3 sc in next ch. Rep from * to * once more.
2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 
2 sc in next sc. **1 sc in each of next 3 sc.
Sc3tog over next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sc. 3 sc in next sc.** Rep from ** to ** once
more. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each
of next 3 sc. Sc3tog over next 3 sc. 1 sc in
each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc.* Rep from
* to * once more. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each
of next 16 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to
* twice. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more.
Head shaping: Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in
first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog over
next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in
next sc.* Rep from * to * once more. 2 sc in
next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Turn.
Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc.
Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of
row. Turn. 
Rep last row 3 times more.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc
in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc.
Turn. 14 sc rem.
Rep last row twice more. 10 sc rem.
Next row: Ch 4. 1 tr in first sc. Sl st in each
of next 8 sc. Ch 4. 1 tr in last sc. Sl st in same
sp as tr. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
With Pink yarn, embroider mouth with chain
st as shown in picture. With White yarn,
embroider eyes with French knots as shown
in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball Lemon 8215 A
1 ball Avocado 8690 B
Susan Bates Crochet Hook®: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Dishcloth measures: 5" (12.5 cm) wide x 9" (23 cm) long (including Leaves)
gauge: 13 dc = 4" (10 cm) and 13 rows dc = 8" (20 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 12; turn.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (first 3 chs count as dc here and throughout), dc in each ch across; turn—10 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each of next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each of last 2 dc; turn—12 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each of next 6 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each of last 2 dc; turn—14 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each of next 5 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in each of last 7 dc, turn—15 dc.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in each dc across; turn—15 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in each of next 6 dc, dc2tog, dc in each of last 6 dc; turn—14 dc.
Row 7: Ch 3, dc in each of next 5 dc, dc2tog, dc in each of last 6 dc; turn—13 dc.
Row 8: Ch 3, dc in each of next 4 dc, dc3tog, dc in each of last 5 dc—11 dc.
Row 9: Ch 3, dc in each of next 2 dc, dc2tog, dc in each of next 2 sts, dc2tog, dc in each of last 2 dc; turn—9 dc.
Row 10: Ch 3, dc in each st across; turn—9 dc.
EDGE
Ch 1 (does not count as a st), sc in each dc across top edge; 3 sc in corner; turn to work down first side, 2 sc around end of each Row (dc) to next corner; 4 sc in corner; turn to work along bottom edge, sc in each st across to next corner; 4 sc in corner; turn to work up other side, 2 sc around end of each Row to last corner; 3 sc in corner; slip st in top of beginning sc—(73 sc).
Fasten off yarn and weave in ends.
LEAVES
Row 1: Referring to photo for placement, join B with slip knot; hdc in 3rd ch from corner, dc in next sc, tr in next sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next sc; turn—5 sts.
Row 2: Ch 6, slip st in same st, ch 8, slip st in next st, ch 10, slip st in next st, ch 8, slip st in next st, ch 6, slip st in last st—(5 chained loops).
Fasten off yarn and weave in ends.

pattern_name: St. Patrick's Day Celtic Knot Dishcloth
materials: Lily® Sugar n’ Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) (01223) Mod Green 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Inner Rings
First Ring
Ch 20. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 43 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 44 dc. Fasten off.

Second Ring
Ch 20. Loop ch through First Ring. Join with sl st to form ring. Work 1st rnd as for First Ring.

Third Ring
Ch 20. Loop ch through Second Ring. Join with sl st to form ring. Work 1st rnd as for First Ring.

Fourth Ring
Ch 20. Loop ch through both Third and First Rings. Join with sl st to form ring. Work 1st rnd as for First Ring.

Outer Edge
1st rnd: Join yarn with sl st to top of ch-3 of Fourth Ring. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st (corner made). Ch 8. Miss next 9 dc. With First Ring in front of Fourth Ring, 1 sc in 35th dc of First Ring and 10th dc of Fourth Ring.  Ch 8. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in top of ch-3 of First Ring. Ch 8. Miss next 9 dc. With Second Ring in front of First Ring, 1 sc in 10th dc of First Ring and 35th dc of Second Ring. Ch 8. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in top of ch-3 of Second Ring. Ch 8. Miss next 9 dc. With Third Ring in front of Fourth Ring, 1 sc in 10th dc of Third Ring and 35th dc of Fourth Ring. Ch 8. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in top of ch-3 of Fourth Ring. Ch 8. Miss next 9 dc. With First Ring in front of Fourth Ring, 1 sc in 35th dc of First Ring and 10th dc of Fourth Ring. Ch 8. Join with sl st to first sc.

2nd rnd: Sl st to ch-2 sp. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). (1 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in same ch-2 sp. *1 hdc in next sc. 10 hdc in next ch-8 sp. 1 hdc in next sc. 10 hdc in next ch-8 sp. 1 hdc in next sc.** (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first hdc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around, having 3 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to first sc.

4th rnd: Working from left to right instead of from right to left, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Pin to measurements and steam lightly.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream(70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A (00001 White) 1 ball
Contrast B (01530 Country Red) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 8. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (3 dc. Ch 2) in ring.
[(4 dc. Ch 2) in ring] 7 times. Join with sl st to
top of ch-3. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3.
(2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1.
*(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep
from * 6 times more. Join with sl st to top of
ch-3. Break B.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1.
1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 9 dc in next ch-3 sp.
(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 9 dc in next ch-3 sp) 
7 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Break A.
4th rnd: Join B with sl st to 5th dc of any 9-dc
group. Ch 1. 1 sc in same dc. Ch 2. 1 dc in next
sc. Ch 2. 1 sc in 5th dc of next 9-dc group. Ch 2.
*(3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in next sc (corner made). Ch 2.
1 sc in 5th dc of next 9-dc group. Ch 2. 1 dc in
next sc. Ch 2. 1 sc in 5th dc of next 9 dc group.
Ch 2. Rep from * twice more. (3 tr. Ch 3. 3 tr) in
next sc. Ch 2. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in
next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. 2 sc in next 
ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 
1 hdc in each of next 3 tr. * (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in
next ch-3 corner sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 tr.
2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next
ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 
1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in
each of next 3 tr. Rep from * twice more. (3 dc.
Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in each
of next 3 tr. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Join with sl st
to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around, having 
3 sc in each corner sp. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Main Color (MC) Sunshine (00073) 1 ball or 80 m/90 yds
Contrast A Red (00095) 1 ball or 6 m/7 yds
Contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball or 10 m/11 yds
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] in diameter, including rays.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
SUN 
See Diagram on page 3.
With larger hook and MC, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *(2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc) 7 times. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 78 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next ch. (Yoh) 4 times and draw up a loop in next ch. (Yoh and draw up a loop through 2 loops on hook) 5 times – triple tr (tr tr) made. Skip next 5 hdc of 8th rnd.** 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * 11 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
SUNGLASSES
Lenses (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) twice. 5 sts. Do not turn.
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Lens, having 3 sc in each corner. Join A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc around, having 2 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join Lenses: 1st row: Join A with sl st to top left of First Lens. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through tapestry needle. Sew last row to corresponding sc of Second Lens.
FINISHING
Sew Sunglasses to Sun as shown in picture.
With B, embroider smile using back stitch.

Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7625 Fiji A, 7503 Lavender B, and 7962 Calm Print C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 5¾" from side edge to opposite point (14.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 2.
Round 1: Work 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—20 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—30 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—40 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same st as join, dc in next 7 sts, *(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next st, dc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—55 dc and 5 ch-2 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next st, *3 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in each st around to next ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 times, 3 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in each remaining st; join with slip st in first sc—80 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 44 yds/40.5 m
Contrast A Tea Rose (00042) or Teal (01133) or Meadow (01135) or Bright Navy (00009) or Light Blue (00026) or Orchid (01137) or Robin’s Egg (01215) or Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With MC, ch 27.
Work Chart, noting each square of chart is equal to 1 sc and reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right. Carry color not in use across top of entire previous row and work sts around it. This will ensure even gauge as all sts will be worked around an extra strand of yarn held across top of previous row. Carry both colors up side of work.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of Chart are complete.
Rep 2nd row and cont working Chart until 26th row of Chart is complete.
Fasten off.
Border: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Version 1 Main Color (MC) Overcast (01042) 1 ball or 81 yds/74 m
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Version 2 Main Color (MC) Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 81 yds/74 m
Contrast A Overcast (01042) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Version 3 Main Color (MC) Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 81 yds/74 m
Contrast A Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Size U.S H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
With MC, ch 29.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 27 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 hdc. *1 tr in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 tr in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 tr in next st. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
Note: Push tr to RS of work to form ‘bobbles’. 
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm] ending on a 5th row. 
Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 2. Work 5 hdc in same sp. Work hdc evenly around outer edge, working 5 hdc in each corner. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Overcast (01042) 1 ball or 50.5 yds/46.5 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 50.5 yds/46.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Mosaic Dc = Working in front of chain spaces, work 1 dc in skipped sc 3 rows below
instructions:
Notes:
• To change color, work to last loop on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through loop, tighten previous color and proceed with new color.
• Carry color when not in use loosely up side of work.
• Each skipped sc has ch-2 worked above it for 2 rows. This establishes the ‘gap’ where Mosaic Dc will later be worked.
• Mosaic Dc always replaces sc directly behind it on working row.
• WS of your work maintains alternating 2-row striped pattern because you are working in front of chain spaces each time you work Mosaic Dc - you are never working around chain-spaces. The chain-spaces are positioned behind Mosaic Dc.
Mosaic Set Up:
With A, ch 31.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
Begin working Mosaic Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn.
These 8 rows form Mosaic Pat.
Cont in Mosaic Pat until work from beg measures approx 9" [23 cm], ending on a 4th row.
Next row: (RS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Mosaic Dc in each of next 2 skipped sc 3 rows below. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.
Fasten oﬀ.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds) Westport (02012) 1 ball or 80 m/86 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 32 loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Miss next 2 ch. (2 dc. 3 tr. 
2 dc) – shell made in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep 
from * to end of chain. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first sc. 1 sc in back loop 
only of center tr of next shell. *5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in back loop 
only of center tr of next shell. Rep from * across, ending with: 
3 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Shell in next sc. 1 sc in 3rd dc of next 
5-dc group. Rep from * across, ending with: 1 sc in top of ch 3.
Turn. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for Shell Pat until work from beg 
measures 8½" [21.5 cm], ending on a 2nd row. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7365 Tan A, 7501 Caribbean B, and 7100 Cotton C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures about 4" [10 cm] wide and 5" [12.5 cm] long.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 3" [7.5 cm] wide x 4" [10 cm] long. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 2: 1 each with A & C and B & C)
First Pad
With first color, ch 2 loosely.
Round 1 (wrong side): (3 sc, 3 hdc, 3 sc, 3 hdc) in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc, turn—6 sc and 6 hdc.
Round 2 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in first hdc, 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 hdc in each of next 3 hdc, sc in last 3 sc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—6 sc and 12 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sts, *2 dc in each of next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts*, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first sc, turn—6 sc and 20 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in first dc, 2 hdc in next 9 sts, sc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next 10 sts, sc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—6 sc and 40 hdc.
Fasten off.
Second Pad
Work same as first pad; at end of Round 4, change to C, do not turn or fasten off.
Joining Round (right side): Hold both pads with wrong sides together and sts matching, working through both thicknesses, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn. Do not fasten off.
Hand Strap
Row 1: Ch 1, hdc in first 3 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, hdc in each st across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until strap fits snugly but comfortably across back of hand.
Last Row: Match sts in last row of strap to 3 sts of Joining Round on opposite side of pads (these Joining Round sts were worked into sc sts of Round 4 of pads); working through both thicknesses, slip st in the 3 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Black Currant (01318) 1 ball or 43 yds [40 m]
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 9 yds [8 m]
Contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball or 10 yds [9 m]
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc.
HEAD
With MC, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (skipped ch-2 does not count as st). Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: 2 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 10 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 more times. Turn. 15 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 more times. Turn. 20 hdc.
5th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 more times. Turn. 25 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 more times. Turn. 30 hdc.
7th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 more times. Turn. 35 hdc.
8th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 more times. Turn. 40 hdc.
9th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 4 more times. Do not turn. Do not fasten off. 45 hdc.

BODY
Note: Body is worked by crocheting into the bottom of the semi-circle of the Head.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 23 sc evenly across bottom edge of Head. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from top of Head measures approx 7 ½" [19 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (RS). 1 sl st in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. *Skip next sc. 4 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sl st in last sc. Fasten off.

EYEBALL
With A, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each of next 11 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. Fasten off.

PUPIL
With B, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. Fasten off.

HORNS (make 2)
With B, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 6 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 4 sc. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.

MOUTH
With B, ch 15. Fasten off.

TEETH (make 2)
With A, ch 5.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Horns, Eyeball, Pupil, Teeth, and Mouth to Head and Body as shown in picture.

materials: Lily® sugar'n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
contrast A White (00001) (18.5 m/21 yds) or 1 ball
contrast B Black (00002) (18.5 m/21 yds) or 1 ball
contrast C Rose Pink (00046) (7.5 m/8 yds) or 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
notes:
• When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding.
With A, ch 36.
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 12 ch. With B, 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of last 5 ch. 35 sc. Turn. First row of Chart is now complete.
Cont working Chart until row 32 of Chart is complete.
Border
1st rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Dishcloth, working 33 sc along each side edge and having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 144 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 5. 1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc. Ch 5. 1 sc) all in next sc. Ch 4. Miss next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Hot Green (01712) or Robin’s Egg (01215) or Hot Pink (01740) or Hot Orange (01628) or Sunshine (00073) or Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 51 yds/47 m
Contrast A Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
With MC, ch 23. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 22 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Rep 2nd row for pat.
Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 7” [18 cm] ending on a WS row.
Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. (Work 21 sc evenly across to next corner. 5 sc in next corner) 3 times. Work 21 sc evenly across last side. 2 sc same sp as sl st. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in same sp as sl st. [Skip next 2 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Skip next sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 8 dc in next corner sc] 3 times. Skip next 2 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Skip next sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next sc) 5 times. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 4 dc in same sp as sl st. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 7760 Lemony
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
dc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Beginning at center, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 5 sc. Join to work in continuous rounds. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 10 sc.
Round 3: (Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc) around – 15 sc.
