Round 4: (Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc) around – 20 sc.
Round 5: (Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc) around – 25 sc.
Round 6: (Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc) around – 30 sc.
Round 7: (Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc) around – 35 sc. Do not fasten off.
Shape First Leg
Row 1: Sc in next 7 sc, leave remaining sts unworked – 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sc, 2 dc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc – 8 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sc, dc2tog, sc in last 3 sc – 7 sts.
Rows 4-5: Repeat Rows 2-3.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc next sc, 2 dc in next st, sc in next sc, sc2tog – 6 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sc, dc2tog, sc in next 2 sc – 5 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, 2 dc in next st, sc2tog – 4 sts.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, dc2tog, sc in next sc – 3 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, draw up loop in each of 3 sts, yo and pull through all loops. Fasten off.
Shape Remaining Legs
Join yarn with a sc in next unworked sc along Round 7, sc in next 6 sc – 7 sc.
Repeat Rows 2-10 of First Leg four more times. Do not fasten off on last leg.
Edging
Round 1: Sc evenly spaced around Starfish, working 3 sc in tip of each Leg and sc2tog in between each Leg, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Abbreviations
ch = chain; cm = centimeters; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tog = together; yo = yarn over; ( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby Stripes™ (3 oz/85 g; 80 yds/73 m) Calypso (0265) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 5 blocks = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes
Dishcloth is worked diagonally from corner to corner.
Ch 6. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Turn. 1 block made.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg block made. (Sl st. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp – block made. Turn. 2 blocks.
3rd row: Beg block. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 3 blocks. 
Rep last row, inc 1 block each row until there are 10 blocks (10 rows are complete).
Proceed as follows to dec each side:
1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Rep last row until 1 block rem.
Next row: (WS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc. Turn. Ch 14 for hanging loop and sl st into same dc as last sl st worked. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7275 Coral A, 7760 Lemony B, 7586 Jade C, and 7100 Cotton D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
CENTER FLOWER
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc to join – 6 sc. Cut A.
Row 2: Change to B, ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2 (does not count as first dc), dc in each sc around, slip st in first dc – 12 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in each dc around, slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Set aside.
SQUARE
With B, ch 2.
Row 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Row 3: (Ch 3, 2 tr, ch 3, slip st) all in joining st for Petal, sc in next st, [(slip st, ch 3, 2 tr, ch 3, slip st) all in next st for Petal, sc in next st] 5 times, slip st in beginning joining st – 6 Petals. Fasten off.
Row 4: Keeping Petals to front of work, join C in any sc with a slip st, ch 1, 2 sc in same st, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, ch 2, 2 sc in next sc, (sc, ch 2, 2 sc) in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, ch 2, slip st in first sc – 12 sc and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in same joining st, [2 dc in next 2 sc, (dc, ch 2, dc) in ch-2 space, 2 dc in next sc] 3 times, 2 dc in next 2 sc, (dc, ch 2, dc) in ch-2 space, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 32 dc and 4 ch-2 spaces.
Row 6: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in next 6 dc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space, [dc in next 8 dc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space] 3 times, dc in last st, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 48 dc and 4 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
Row 7: Join D in any ch-2 space, ch 1, 3 sc in each ch-2 space and sc in each dc around, slip st in first sc – 60 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With B, sew Center Flower to center of Square.
With C, tack down Petals.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7275 Coral A, 7365 Tan B, and 7960 Blushing Print C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scrubby measures 5½" wide x 6" long (14 x 15 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 8.
Round 1: Work 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc), dc in next 3 ch, 6 dc in last ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, dc in next 3 ch, 3 dc in last ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—18 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in next 2 dc, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next 6 dc, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in last 3 dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—30 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] twice, dc in next 3 dc, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 6 times, dc in next 3 dc, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 3 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—42 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] twice, dc in next 3 dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 6 times, dc in next 3 dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 3 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—54 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] twice, dc in next 3 dc, [dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 6 times, dc in next 3 dc, [dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 3 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—66 dc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g/109 m/120 yds)
(Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g/86 m/95 yds)
Main Color (MC) (01712 Hot Green) 2 balls
Contrast A (00073 Sunshine) 1 ball
Contrast B (00001 White) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Green pipe cleaners.
Hot glue gun.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH A
Motif (make 4). 
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st in back loop of first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4. [(Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice in same sp as last sl st. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – Beg Tr Cluster made. *Ch 5. [(Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times in back loop of next hdc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – Tr Cluster made. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 5. Join with sl st to top of Beg Cluster. Break A. 
3rd rnd: Join MC with sl st to any ch-5 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 6 hdc in same sp as sl st. *(3 hdc. Ch 2. 3 hdc) in next ch-5 sp. 6 hdc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2.* 6 hdc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Join with sl st in first hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. (1 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off. 
Sew 4 Motifs tog into a dishcloth. 
Edging: 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 5 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 11 hdc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Draw up a loop in same ch-2 sp. Draw up a loop in next ch-2 sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 11 hdc.** 5 sc in corner. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st in first sc. Break A. 
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any corner sc. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 14 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in corner sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Break B. 
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. 
*(Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in missed sc 1 row below) 15 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Sl st in corner ch-1 sp. Ch 4. Beg Tr Cluster in same sp as last sl st. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as Cluster. *(1 sc next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as Cluster. Rep from * around, working 3 Clusters in corner ch-1 sps and ending with: (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first ch of ch-4. Fasten off. 
DISHCLOTH B
With MC, ch 58.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 57 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made. 1 sc in each of last 27 sc. Turn. 55 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. Sc3tog over next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 26 sc. Turn. 53 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. Sc3tog over next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 25 sc. Turn. 51 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. Sc3tog over next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 24 sc. Join A. Turn. 49 sc.
6th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Sc3tog over next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 23 sc. Turn. 47 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. Sc3tog over next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 22 sc. Join MC. Turn. 45 sc.
Cont in this manner, working sc3tog at center of each row, working in stripes as follows:
8th to 11th rows: With MC.
12th and 13th rows: With A.
14th to 28th rows: With MC. 3 sc rem.
Last row: Sc3tog over 3 sc. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 5 sc in same sp as sl st. (Work 27 sc evenly across to next corner. 5 sc in next corner) 3 times. Work 27 sc evenly across last side. Join with sl st to first sc. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any corner sc. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 14 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in corner sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Break B. 
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in missed sc 1 row below) 15 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Rainbow Version
Contrast A 00095 (Red) 1 ball
Contrast B 01699 (Tangerine) 1 ball
Contrast C 00073 (Sunshine) 1 ball
Contrast D 01223 (Mod Green) 1 ball
Contrast E 01111 (Mod Blue) 1 ball
Contrast F 01317 (Hot Purple) 1 ball
Solid Color Version
01111 (Mod Blue) or 01223 (Mod Green) or 00073 (Sunshine) or 01699 (Tangerine) or 00095 (Red) or 01317 (Hot Purple) 1 ball
Note: 1 ball will make 2 Solid Color Version dishcloths.
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dtr = Double treble crochet: (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times.
instructions: Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc throughout. Rainbow Version With A, ch 6. Join with sl st to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in ring. Ch 3. *4 dc in ring. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in foundation ring in sp between 4-dc groups of 1st rnd. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in foundation ring in sp between 4-dc groups of 1st rnd. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc. Rep from * around, omitting 2 dc at end of last rep. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3. 3rd rnd: With C, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. 4th rnd: Join D with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in dtr from 2nd rnd. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc. *1 dc in each of next 10 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in dtr from 2nd rnd. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc. Rep from * around, omitting 2 dc at end of last rep. Join E with sl st to top of ch 3. 5th rnd: With E, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. 6th rnd: Join F with sl st to any ch-3 sp (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 16 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in dtr from 4th rnd. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc. *1 dc in each of next 16 dc. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dtr in dtr from 4th rnd. 2 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 2 dc. Rep from * around, omitting 2 dc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. Solid Color Version Make as for Rainbow Version omitting all references to color changes.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Super Size™ (Solids: 4 oz/113 g; 190 yds/174 m; Ombres & Prints: 3 oz/85 g; 143 yds/131 m)
Sonoma (18004) 1 ball or 70 yds/65 m
OR Jade Mist (18813) 1 ball or 70 yds/65 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
instructions:
Ch 27 (multiple of 6 ch + 3). See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sts.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 trfp around 4th sc 3 rows below. Skip next st (behind trfp). 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 1 trfp around next sc 3 rows below (next to the last trfp worked). *Skip next 4 sc 3 rows below. 1 trfp around next sc 3 rows below. Skip next 2 sts (behind 2 trfp). 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 1 trfp around next sc 3 rows below (next to the last trfp worked). Rep from * to last 2 sts. Skip next st (behind last trfp). 1 sc in last st. Turn.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. 1 trfp around 2nd sc 3 rows below (directly above Trfp of prev Trfp row). Skip next 4 sc 3 rows below. 1 trfp around next sc 3 rows below. Skip next 2 sts (behind 2 trfp). *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 1 trfp around next sc 3 rows below (next to last Trfp worked). Skip next 4 sc 3 rows below. 1 trfp around next sc 3 rows below. Skip next 2 sts (behind 2 trfp). Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 9th rows twice more, then 2nd and 3rd rows once more. Do not turn on last row.
Edging: With RS facing, ch 1. Work sc evenly around edges of Dishcloth, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 241 Duckie A, 501 Ocean B, and 620 Lime C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
locking stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (Duckie center)
With A, ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, dc in ring (counts as first 2-dc Cl), [ch 1, 2-dc Cl in ring] 7 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first 2-dc Cl—eight 2-dc Cls, 8 ch-1 spaces. Drop loop from hook and place on marker.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in each ch-1 space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 dc and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in next dc, slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 3, 5 dc in same space, 6 dc in each ch-2 space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc. Fasten off.
Round 4: Place dropped loop on hook, pull up loop to height of current round, ch 1 (counts as first long sc), [sc in next 2 sts, (sc, ch 1, sc) in next st, sc in next 2 sts, long sc in next 2-dc Cl of Round 1] around to beginning ch; join with slip st in beginning ch—44 sc, 8 long sc, and 4 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off. 
Round 5: With right side facing, join C with slip st in any ch-1 space, ch 4 (counts as first tr), [tr, ch 1, 2 tr] in same space, [tr in next 3 sts, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 2 sts, tr in next 3 sts*, (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next ch-1 space] around, ending last repeat at *; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—40 tr, 16 dc, 12 hdc, and 4 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 6: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any ch-1 space, ch 1, 3 sc in same space, sc in next 17 sts, [3 sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next 17 sts] around; join with slip st in first sc—80 sc. Fasten off.
SCRUBBY (Ocean center)
Make same as pattern above using Ocean A, Duckie B and Lime C.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Version i main color (mc) Hot Pink (01740) (23 m/25 yds) or 1 ball
contrast a Rose Pink (00046) (10 m/11 yds) or 1 ball
Version ii main color (mc) Hot Blue (01742) (23 m/25 yds) or 1 ball
contrast a Robin’s Egg (01215) (10 m/11 yds) or 1 ball
Version iii main color (mc) Hot Orange (01628) (23 m/25 yds) or 1 ball
contrast a White (00001) (10 m/11 yds) or 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and insert hook from back to front around post of next st. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcfp = Yoh and insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
scbp = Insert hook from back to front around post of next stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 5" [13 cm] wide x 10" [25 cm] long.
instructions: notes: •  When joining colors, work to last loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last loops and proceed. •  Push picot sts to RS. With A, ch 4. (See Diagram on page 2). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc. Turn. 2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 13 sc at end of 6th row, ending last row with join MC. Break A. 7th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Miss next sc. (2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – picot made. 2 dc) in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. Turn. 8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc) twice. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 9th row: [Ch 6. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 1 dc and picot). 1 dc] in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in last sc. Turn. 10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in last dc. Turn. 11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next sc. *(2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 13th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. [Ch 6. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 1 dc and picot). 1 dc] in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem st unworked. 14th row: As 10th row. 15th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp. Miss next sc. *(2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. PM on 3rd dc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Fasten off. 16th row: With WS facing, join MC with sl st at marker. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc) twice. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 17th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp. *Miss next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. Turn. Leave rem st unworked. 18th row: Sl st to 2nd dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 19th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Miss next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem st unworked. 20th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Ch 1. Miss next picot. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Join A. Break MC. Turn. 21st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn. 7 sc. 22nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (Dcbp. 2 dc in next sc) twice. Dcbp. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 23rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). (Dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) twice. Dcfp. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. (Picot. Scbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc) 3 times. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m) Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 50 yds/45 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] tall (excluding stem) x 11" [28 cm] wide.
instructions:
See Chart on page 2.
Center Section
Ch 15.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to last ch. (1 sc. Ch 4. 1 sc) in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation chain, 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. Turn.
Note: Work in back loops only of each sc and ch-1 sp throughout.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. Skip first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to next ch-4 sp. (2 sc. Ch 4. 2 sc) in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Right Section: 11th row: Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch and each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
**12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
13th row: Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch and each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Skip next sc of 10th row. 1 sc in next sc of 10th row. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
14th and 15th rows: As 12th and 13th rows.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Skip next st of 10th row. 1 sc in next st of 10th row. Turn.
18th and 19th rows: As 16th and 17th rows.
20th row: As 16th row.
21st and 22nd rows: As 11th and 12th rows.
23rd to 30th rows: As 13th to 20th rows, working in skipped sc of 20th row instead of 10th row.
31st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Skip next st of 20th row. 1 sc in next st of 20th row. Fasten off.**
Left Section: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to front loop of first sc of 10th row. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Note: Work in front loops only of each sc and ch-1 sp throughout.
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Section.
FINISHING
Thread yarn through last sc of ch-4 sp of 10th row, last sc of 20th and 30th rows of Right and Left Sections. Pull gently. Fasten securely.
Stem: Ch 20.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Sew Stem in place.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby Smoothie®: 1 ball each 9313 Loofa A, 2136 Tide B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
gauge: 13 dc = 4" [10 cm]; 5½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE
When changing colors, work last step of last st of previous color with new color. Carry colors not in use loosely along side of work. Ch 1, 2 or 3 at beginning of rows do not count as a st.
WASHCLOTH
With A, ch 24.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch do not count as a st), dc in each ch across – 21 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, slip st in each st across, changing to B in last st
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each st across – 21 sc.
Row 4: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), turn, hdc in each st across, changing to A in last st. 
Row 5: Ch 3 (does not count as a st), turn, working in back loops only, dc in each st across.
Repeat Rows 2-5 three more times.
Border 
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn to right side ready to work around edges, working over carried yarns to hide, sc evenly spaced around, working (sc, ch 1, sc) in each corner, slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Round 2: Working through back loops only, join B in any sc with a slip st, slip st in each st around, working sc in each corner ch-1 space, slip st in first st. 
Fasten off.
FINISHIING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 936 Waves A and 501 Ocean B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
With A, ch 22.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 21 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to end.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1), turn, *skip next st, dc in next st, ch 1; repeat from * to last 2 sts, skip next st, dc in last st.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each dc and ch-1 space to end.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to end.
Repeat Rows 2-5 until piece measures 6" [15 cm] from beginning. Cut A and join B.
Edging
Round 1: With B, ch 1, sc evenly spaced around edges, working (sc, ch 2, sc) in each corner, slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, turn, [sc in each st to next ch-2 space, (sc, ch 2, sc) in ch-2 space] around, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8690 Avocado A, 8506 Ice Pop B, 8012 Licorice C, 8215 Lemon D, and 8001 Marshmallow E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Washcloth measures 9” wide by 6½" long (23 x 16.5 cm).
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 10 rows = 4” (10 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
With A, ch 30.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—28 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each dc across, working last dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 4” (10 cm); change to B in last row. Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 6½” long (16.5 cm). Fasten off.
Eye (make 2)
With C, make an adjustable ring. Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 7 hdc in ring; change to D—8 hdc. Pull on tail to close ring.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each remaining st around; change to E—16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Mouth
With D, ch 10. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, sew eyes and mouth on washcloth. Weave in all ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off  ™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Raspberry Teal (90030) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc throughout.
• Ch 10 forms loop in each corner.
Ch 6. Join with sl st to form a ring. 
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (3 sc in ring. Ch 10) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. (Ch 10. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. (Ch 10. 2 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 dc in next hdc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. (Ch 10. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 2 dc in next dc. (Ch 10. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in next dc. (Ch 10. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 2 dc in next dc. (Ch 10. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. 2 dc in next dc. (Ch 10. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. 2 dc in next dc. (Ch 10. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 10. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Leave last ch on hook.
For each corner, proceed as follows:
Pull ch-10 loop from 2nd rnd through ch-10 loop from 1st rnd.
Pull ch-10 loop from 3rd rnd through ch-10 loop from 2nd rnd.
Pull ch-10 loop from 4th rnd through ch-10 loop from 3rd rnd.
Rep in same manner for all ch-10 loops as shown in picture.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 1 dc in each of next 17 dc. 2 dc in next dc. (5 sc in ch-10 loop from 9th rnd. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. 5 sc in ch-10 loop from 9th rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Denim (90006) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
instructions:
Ch 32.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
4th and 5th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows.
6th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. *Bobble in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 3rd to 6th rows until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 5th row. Do not fasten off.
Cont as follows: Edging:  (RS). Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 17 yds/16 m
Contrast B Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast C Dark Pine (00016) 1 ball or 9 yds/8 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Black Anchor® embroidery floss
Susan Bates® Steel Yarn Needle
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 9½" [24 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Pit (Make 2) See diagram on page 2.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from ring. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Break A. Join B. 40 sc.
Join Pits: With WS of Pits tog, align sts and proceed as follows:
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working through back loops of both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around to join pieces. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 48 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 56 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 6 sc) 5 times. 2 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of the next 2 sc. Sl st in each of next 8 sc. Join. 62 sts.
Beg working in rows:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. (1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts. sl st in next sc. Turn.
2nd row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 16 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sl st in next st. Turn.
3rd row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 6. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in next st. Turn.
4th row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 6 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. (1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
Edging rnd: Join C with sl st to any sl st along bottom of Avocado. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around, having 2 sc in top dc. Join.
Face
With black embroidery floss, embroider face as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8001 Marshmallow A, 8012 Licorice B, and 8215 Lemon C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn
Sewing needle
Black thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 6½” wide x 9 long (16.5 x 23 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Head
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed. Gently pull on tail to close ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around—12 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—24 sc. 
Round 5: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sc. 
Round 6: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—36 sc. 
Round 7: Ch 1, *sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—42 sc. 
Round 8: Ch 1, *sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—48 sc. 
Round 9: Ch 1, *sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—54 sc. Do not fasten off; continue in rows.
Body
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in next 12 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice, 2 sc in next st*, sc in next 2 sts, repeat from * to * once, turn—18 sc.
Rows 3–7: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 8 and 9: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), hdc in first st, sc in next 16 sts, hdc in last st, turn. 
Rows 10 and 11: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 12 and 13: Skip first st, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—14 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to B, turn.
Edging
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each st across; working in ends of rows, 2 sc in first row, work 15 sc evenly spaced across first side; working in back loops only of head, *sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * 3 times, sc in next 6 sts; working in ends of rows, work 15 sc evenly spaced across other side to last row, 2 sc in last row; join with slip st in first sc—94 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in each st around to last 2 sts, 2 sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—98 sc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in first 14 sts, 3 hdc in next, hdc in next 18 sts, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 8 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 4 times, hdc in next 18 sts, 3 hdc in last st; join with slip st in first hdc—108 hdc. 
Fasten off.
Beak
With C, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bars, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc3tog. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Head Patch
With B, work same as Rows 1, 2, and 4 of beak.
Eye (make 2)
With black worsted weight yarn, make an adjustable ring, ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Gently pull on tail to close ring.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for placement of facial pieces. Weave in ends.
With end tail, sew beak to center of head; weave in tail. With black sewing thread and needle, sew eyes to each side of beak and head patch to center top of head.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (Solids 70.9 g/2.5 oz, Ombres 56.7 g/2 oz)
VERSION 1: Main Color (MC): (13628 Hot Orange) 1 ball
Contrast A: (00001 White) 1 ball
VERSION 2: Main Color (MC): (00089 Banana Yellow) 1 ball
Contrast A: (23741 Playtime) 1 ball
VERSION 3: Main Color (MC): (00089 Banana Yellow) 1 ball
Contrast A: (23743 Summer Splash) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc in 1st to 3rd rnds.
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in same sp as sl st. *Miss next 2 hdc. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
5th rnd: Sl st in next st and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in same ch-1 sp. *(2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in next ch-1 sp – shell made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
6th and 7th rnds: Sl st in next st and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in same ch-1 sp. *(3 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to top of ch 2 at end of 7th rnd.
8th rnd: With A, ch 2. *8 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in sp between 2 shells. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. (1 sc in next dc. Ch 1) 7 times. *(1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row below. Ch 1) 4 times. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp as last sc. (Ch 1. 1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row above) 3 times.** (1 sc in next dc. Ch 1) 8 times. Rep from * 11 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8931 Pink Grapefruit A, 8930 Watermelon B, and 8012 Licorice C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
Ecru sewing thread
Sewing needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 8 dc = 1½" (4 cm); 3 rows = 1½" (4 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Head
With A, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc,* dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 dc.
First Ear
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 6 dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each remaining st across, turn—5 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc3tog; working down side edge, slip st in end of each row to first unwritten dc of Round 6, *sc in next 4 dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * twice, sc in next 7 dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn.
2nd Ear
Note: Last 7 sts of Row 7 of first ear are Row 1 of 2nd ear.
Rows 2–6: Repeat Rows 2–6 of first ear.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc3tog, turn; working down side edge, slip st in end of each row to unwritten sts of Round 6, *sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * twice, slip st in slip st in Row 1 of first ear. Fasten off.
Snout
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around —18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around —24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for placement of all pieces.
With C, embroider a French knot for each nostril and couched stitches for smile. With sewing needle and thread, sew snout to head.
Eye (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Tie beginning and end tails together and trim. With sewing needle and thread, sew eye in place, holding knot behind eye as sewing progresses. Trim “eyelash” strands from all facial pieces.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8929 Strawberry A and 8690 Avocado B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
8 stitch markers (optional)
½ yd (½ m) black worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Strawberry measures 5½” wide x 6½” long (14 x 16.5 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: SCRUBBY Strawberry Side 1 With A, ch 9. Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st, turn—10 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn—12 sc. Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn—14 sc. Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn—16 sc. Row 7: Repeat Row 5. Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st, turn—22 sc. Row 9: Repeat Row 5. Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog, sc in next 16 sts, sc2tog, sc in last st, turn—20 sc. Row 11: Repeat Row 5. Row 12: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] twice, sc2tog, sc in last 2, turn—17 sc. Row 13: Repeat Row 5. Row 14: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog, sc in next 11 sts, sc2tog, sc in last st, turn—15 sc. Row 15: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sts, turn—13 sc. Row 16: Repeat Row 5. Row 17: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sts, turn—11 sc. Row 18: Repeat Row 5. Row 19: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog, sc in last st, turn—9 sc. Row 20: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog, turn—7 sc. Row 21: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in last 3 sts, turn—6 sc. Row 22: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 3 times. Fasten off. Side 2: Work same as Side 1; do not fasten off at end of last row. Edging Round 1: With wrong sides of Sides held together and working through both thicknesses, ch 1, turn, 3 sc in each st of Row 22; working in ends of rows, work 21 sc evenly spaced down first side; working in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in first 2 ch, skip next ch, 3 sc in next ch, skip next ch, sc in next 2 ch, skip last ch; working in ends of rows, work 19 sc evenly spaced up 2nd side; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Leaf Cap With B, ch 4. Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 hdc. Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), skip first st, hdc2tog—1 leaf. Row 3: Ch 4, hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn. Row 4: Repeat Row 2. Rows 5–16: Repeat last 2 rows 6 times—8 leaves at end of Row 16. Row 17: Ch 1, working in opposite side of foundation ch of each odd-numbered row, sc in each ch across, turning every other leaf so foundation ch are facing, turn—24 sc. Row 18: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Row 19: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 5 times, turn—18 sc. Row 20: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. FINISHING With points of leaves facing downwards and top edges even, fold leaf cap in half and wrap around strawberry. Working through all 3 thicknesses, sc in each st across top row—9 sc. Fasten off, but do not cut; use remaining length of tail to tack points of leaves in place. For seeds, with black yarn, embroider ¼” (6.35 mm) straight stitches randomly through both layers, drawing the yarn between the layers as needed to position seeds wherever desired. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily Sugar n’ Cream® The Original™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast B Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Contrast C Jute (00082) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Contrast D Wine (00015) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
Bread (Make 2 alike).
See Diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 24
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 23 sc.
2nd to 24th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
25th row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first sc. 2 tr in next sc. 1 tr in each of next 3 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 tr in each of next 3 sc. 2 tr in next sc. 3 dc in last sc. 29 sts.  Fasten off. 
Crust
See Diagram on page 3.
With RS facing, join B with sl st to top of last dc.

1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. Working down side edge, 2 sc around post of last dc at end of row. 1 sc around post of sc at end of each row to next corner. 3 sc in corner. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to next corner. 3 sc in corner. Working up side edge, 1 sc around post of sc at end of each row to last row. 2 sc around post of first dc at beg of last row. Working across top of last row, 3 sc in first dc. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Spread (Make 1 each in C and D).
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
See Diagram on page 3.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. 3 sc in last sc. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice more. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * twice more. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * twice more. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * twice more. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * twice more. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 tr in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 tr in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc.** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join. 64 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pin pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry. 
With Bread RS up and last row at top, place Spread centered over Bread with RS up. Using C or D to correspond with Spread, and starting in bottom right corner, sew 3 edges to Bread, leaving bottom edge open. 
Rep with rem Bread and Spread.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Ahoy Ombre (02019) or Seabreeze (01201) or White (00001) or Robin’s Egg (01215) or Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Optional for embroidery: Sunshine (00073) 1 ball or 13 yds/12 m
Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 3 yds/3 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Tunisian crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Optional: Large eyed blunt tapestry needle for Cross Stitch.
gauge: 14 sts and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Tunisian simple st (Tss).
instructions:
Note: Work all rows with right side of work facing.
Chain (ch) 26.
Note: Work into horizontal bumps at back of foundation chain for 1st row.
1st row: Forward pass: (Right to left). Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Draw up a loop in each remaining (rem) ch to end of chain, leaving all loops on hook. 26 stitches (sts) on hook. Do not turn.
Return pass: (Left to right). Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw through last loop on hook (edge st). *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Repeat (Rep) from * until 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn.
**2nd row: Forward pass: (Right to left). *Tunisian simple st (Tss) in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn.
Return pass: (Left to right). Yoh and draw through 1st loop on hook. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * to end of row. 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn.**
Rep from ** to ** until work from beginning measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on return pass.
Finishing row: (Right to left). *Slip stitch (sl st) in next vertical bar. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Optional: Cross Stitch Daisy: Using Chart as reference, find center of Dishcloth and cross stitch daisy on dishcloth.

materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz or Ombres/Prints 42.5 g/1.5 oz)
Main Color (MC) 1 ball
Contrast A 1 ball
Size 6 mm crochet hook (U.S. J or 10) or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With MC, ch 4, join with sl st to form a ring. 
Note:Ch 5 at beg of each rnd counts as 1 dc and ch 2 throughout.
Base rnd: Ch 5. (3 dc. Ch 2) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. With A, sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5.
1st rnd: With A, sl st in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next sp (corner made). Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 2 dc in ch-2 sp from beg of rnd. With MC, sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5.
2nd rnd:With MC, sl st in next ch. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next sp (corner made).* Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in ch-2 sp from beg of rnd. With A, sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5.
3rd rnd:With A, sl st in next ch. Ch 5. *(Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp) to corner. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner sp.* Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in ch-2 sp from beg of rnd. With MC, sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5.
4th-6th rnds:As 3rd rnd. Alt A and MC as illustrated.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball 241 Duckie A
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red B and 312 Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
LOVE YA SCRUBBY
With A, make an adjustable loop. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 11 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc. Pull gently on beginning tail to close loop.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc. Fasten off.

FACIAL FEATURES
Heart-shaped Eye (make 2)
With B, make an adjustable loop. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3, (3 dc, 3 hdc, ch 1, 3 hdc, 3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in loop—14 dc and 1 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Pull gently on beginning tail to close loop.
Mouth
With C, make an adjustable loop.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3, 5 dc in loop, turn—6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first dc, 2 dc in each remaining st across, turn—12 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * across—18 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Pull gently on beginning tail to close loop.

FINISHING 
Refer to photograph as a guide and position all pieces with right sides facing. Place eyes and mouth where desired on first scrubby and sew in place.
Weave in ends.

SMILEY FACE SCRUBBY
Work same as Love Ya Scrubby.

FACIAL FEATURES
Eye (make 2)
With C, make an adjustable loop. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 9 dc in loop; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Pull gently on beginning tail to close loop.
Smile
Insert hook in any space between Rounds 3 and 4, with yarn held on wrong side of scrubby, place C-colored slip knot on hook and draw through to right side, work 20 surface slip sts loosely between same rounds. Fasten off, drawing end tail to wrong side.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, position eyes where desired above smile and sew in place.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds; Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
Version I: Contrast A 01223 (Mod Green) 1 ball, Contrast B 01215 (Robin's Egg) 1 ball
Version II: Contrast A 02744 (Swimming Pool) 1 ball, Contrast B 00001 (White) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Large eye blunt-ended needle
gauge: 13 single crochets and 14 rows = 4 inches [10 centimeters].
instructions:
• When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
• When joining a new color, leave a tail approximately 4 inches [10 centimeters] long to ensure you are left with enough yarn to weave in your end.
With A, chain 30.
1st row: 1 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook. *Chain 1. Miss next chain. 1 single crochet in next chain. Repeat from * to end of chain. Turn. (You should have 15 single crochet and 14 chain-1 spaces at end of row).
2nd row: Chain 1. 1 single crochet in first single crochet. *1 single crochet in next chain 1 space. Chain (ch) 1. Miss next chain. Repeat from * 10 times more. 1 single crochet in next chain 1 space. 1 single crochet in last single crochet. Join B (see note). Turn. (You should have 16 single crochet and 13 chain-1 spaces at end of row).
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next chain 1 space (ch-1 sp). Repeat (rep) from * to last 2 stitches. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. (You should have 15 sc and 14 ch-1 spaces at end of row).
4th row: As 2nd row. Join A (see note). Turn.
5th row: With A, as 3rd row.
Repeat 2nd to 5th rows for pattern until work from beginning measures 8 inches [20.5 centimeters], ending with 2 rows of either color.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Fasten off by cutting working yarn approx 6 inches [15 centimeters] long and draw this end through last loop. Pull tightly to secure.
Thread yarn through a blunt tip large eye needle and make small alternating stitches along the wrong side edge of your work. After you have worked about 2 inches [5 centimeters] in one direction, turn and work backwards alternating over the spaces you just worked. Now you can safely cut the end.

materials: Lily sugar’n cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball (85 m/90 yds)
contrast B Country Red (01530) 1 ball (36 m/40 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Base and Filling (make 1 each with A and B)
Ch 4.
1st rnd: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 6 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 64 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 80 dc. Fasten off.
Lattice strips
Long strip (make 4)
**With A, ch 2, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in sc. Turn.**
Rep last row until Strip measures 8" [20.5 cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
medium strip (make 4)
Work from ** to ** as given for Long Strip.
Rep last row until Strip measures 7" [18 cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
short strip (make 4)
Work from ** to ** as given for Long Strip.
Rep last row until Strip measures 6" [15 cm], when slightly stretched. Fasten off, leaving a 5" [12.5 cm] end.
FinisHing
Place WS of Base and Filling pieces tog. Lay Strips on top and following diagram, weave Strips into ‘crust’ top, taking care to keep Strips flat. Using yarn ends at each end of Strip, sew ends of Strips in position to outer edge (working through all thicknesses to secure all pieces).
edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st through all thicknesses in any dc at outer edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 79 sc around outer edge. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next sc. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next sc. Rep from * around to last sc. Miss last sc. Join with sl st at base of ch 3. Ch 13 for hanging loop. Join with sl st in last sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz)
Main Colour (MC): 01114 (Indigo) 1 ball
Contrast A: 01628 (Hot Orange) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
With MC, ch 29.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 28 sc. Turn.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 10 ins [25.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 3 sc in last sc. Work sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in each corner. Join A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Ch 10 for hanging loop. Join with sl st to first ch. Fasten off.
Belt Loops (make 2)
With MC, ch 9.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 4 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Button: With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Sew Belt Loops and Button in position. With A, embroider waistband, fly and pockets with running st and belt loop rivets with French knots.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) 00010 (Yellow) 1 ball or 40 g/45 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
Ch 3. (See diagram on page 2).
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first 
hdc. 20 hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. *(2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc) 
7 times. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Join with 
sl st to first hdc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. 1 dtr in next 
ch. (Yoh) 4 times. Draw up a loop in next ch. (Yoh and draw up a loop 
through 2 loops on hook) 5 times – triple tr made. Miss next 5 hdc 
of 9th rnd.** 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * 11 times more, then from 
* to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball or 40 yds/36.5m
Contrast B Red (00095) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5m
Contrast C Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 7 yds/6.5m
Contrast D Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5m
Contrast E Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Sponge.
Note: A quick drying and/or an anti-microbial sponge would be best to use. Make sure your scrubber is kept in a place that allows it to dry.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] wide x 3½" [9 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st. See Diagrams on page 3.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
At the end of 9th rnd, break A. Join B.
10th rnd: With B, sl st in each sc around. Join in back loop.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sl st around. Break B. Join with C.
12th rnd: With C, working in back loops only, sl st in each sc around. Join in front loop.
13th rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 2 hdc in each sl st around. Join. Break C.
14th rnd: Join D with sl st to back loop of first sl st of 12th rnd. Working in back loops only, sl st in each sl st around. Join in front loop.
15th rnd: Working in front loops only, *Sl st in next sl st. 1 sc in next sl st. 2 hdc in next sl st. 1 dc in next sl st. 1 tr in next sl st. 1 dc in next sl st. 2 hdc in next sl st. 1 sc in next sl st. Sl st in next sl st. Rep from * around. Break D. Join with E.
16th rnd: With E, working in back loops of 14th rnd only, sl st in each sl st around. Join.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sl st around. Break E. Join with A.
18th rnd: Working in back loops only, sl st in each sc around. Join.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sl st around. Join.
20th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
21st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
Stuff scrubber with sponge cut to size.

materials: COATS® “Crème De La Crème®”: 1 ball each 101 Cream A, 500 Aqua OR 255 Tea Rose B and 118 Linen C.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: GAUGE: 17 sts = 4” in stitch pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
With A, ch 5, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: *(Ch 9, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 6 ch) to make a point, sc in ring; repeat from * 4 times more – 5 points. 
Fasten off A. Place marker for beginning of round. 
Notes: In the next round, you will be working in the stitches down one side and in the chains on the opposite side of the foundation chain of each point. When instructed to work a dc5tog, work the dc5tog over the next 2 sts of the current point, the sc between points, and the first 2 chains on the opposite side of the ch-9 foundation chain of the next point. 
Round 2: Join B in 4th dc of previous point, ch 2 (counts as dc), *dc5tog, dc in next 4 ch of foundation ch, skip next ch, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in tip of point, skip next hdc, dc in next 4 dc; repeat from * 3 times more, dc5tog, dc in next 4 ch, skip last ch, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in tip of point, skip next hdc, dc in next 3 sts.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, *dc3tog, dc in next 5 sts, skip next st, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space, skip next st, dc in next 5 sts; repeat from * 4 more times. 
Round 4: *Dc2tog, dc in next 7 sts, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space, skip next st, dc in next 7 sts; repeat from * 4 times more.
Fasten off.
Edging Round: Join C with sc in any ch-3 space, 2 sc in same space, *sc in next 9 sts, dc3tog, sc in next 9 sts, 3 sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * 3 times more, sc in next 9 sts, dc3tog, sc in next 9 sts, slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, work backwards sc in each st around, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Twists: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds) Main Color (MC) 20533 (Barnyard Twists) 2 balls
Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Contrast A 01530 (Country Red) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Large eye blunt-ended needle
gauge: 13 single crochets and 14 rows = 4 inches [10 centimeters]
instructions:
(Make 2 pieces alike)
With Main Color (MC), chain 26.
1st row: 1 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook. 1 single crochet in each chain to end of chain. Turn.  (You should have 25 single crochets at end of row.)
2nd row: Chain 1. 1 single crochet in each single crochet across row. Turn. (You should have 25 single crochets at end of row.)
Repeat last row until work from beginning measures 8 inches [20.5 centimeters].
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Fold Potholder in half. Join Color A with slip stitch at fold. Chain 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 single crochet in each stitch to corner stitch. 3 single crochet in corner stitch. 1 single crochet in each stitch to next corner stitch. 3 single crochet in corner stitch. 1 single crochet in each stitch to fold. Fasten off.
FASTEN OFF
WEAVING IN ENDS
Fasten off by cutting working yarn approx 6 inches [15 centimeters] long and draw this end through last loop. Pull tightly to secure.
Thread yarn through a blunt tip large eye needle and make small alternating stitches along the wrong side edge of your work. After you have worked about 2 inches [5 centimeters] in one direction, turn and work backwards alternating over the spaces you just worked. Now you can safely cut the end.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 501 Ocean A and 905 Cherry B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 13 hdc = 4” [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4” [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With A, ch 3, slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), 11 hdc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch-2 to join – 12 hdc. Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1 here and throughout), hdc in same st, hdc in next st, *(hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around, slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3 – 18 hdc and 6 ch-1 spaces. Place markers in each ch-1 space to mark corners. Round 3: Ch 3, hdc in first ch-1 space, hdc in each st to ch-1 space, *(hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next ch-1 space, hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3 – 30 hdc and 6 ch-1 spaces. Round 4: Ch 3, hdc in first ch-1 space, hdc in each st to next ch-1 space, *(hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next ch-1 space, hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3 – 42 hdc and 6 ch-1 spaces. Cut A. Round 5: Change to B, ch 3, hdc in first ch-1 space, hdc in each st to next ch-1 space, *(hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next ch-1 space, hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3 – 54 hdc and 6 ch-1 spaces. Rounds 6-8: Repeat Round 5, working two more hdc between corner ch-1 spaces. Cut B. Rounds 9-12: Change to A, repeat Round 5, working two more hdc between corner ch-1 spaces. Fasten off. FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Greens (90015) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st.
instructions:
Ch 4. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd:  11 dc in 4th ch from hook. (Skipped ch-3 counts as dc). Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 2 hdc. 2 hdc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). *Popcorn in next hdc. Ch 1. 1 dc in next hdc. Ch 1. Rep from * to last hdc. Popcorn in next hdc. Ch 1. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily Sugar’ n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Main Color (MC) (00004 Ecru) 1 ball
Contrast A (01130 Warm Brown) 1 ball
Contrast B (00002 Black) 1 ball
Contrast C (00010 Yellow) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red yarn for embroidery of mouth.
instructions:
With MC, ch 2. 
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc across. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 9 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep
from * to end of row. Turn. 12 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep
from * to end of row. Turn. 15 sc.
6th row: Ch 1.*1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep
from * to end of row. Turn. 18 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep
from * to end of row. Turn. 21 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 3 sts each row until there are 36 sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Do not turn. Working
along straight top edge, work 24 sc evenly across. Join A with sl
st to first sc.
Beard: 1st row: With A, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 
1 hdc in each of next 9 sc. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 5 dc in next
sc. *Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Miss next sc. 5 dc in next sc.
Rep from * once more. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in each
of next 10 sc. Break A. Join B. 
HAT
1st row: With B, ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each
of next 4 ch. 1 sc in side of next hdc. Working in back loops
only, 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. 1 sc in side of next hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next
4 ch. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 36 sc.
Rep last row 3 times more.
Shaping top: 1st row: (RS). Sl st in each of next 6 sc. Ch 1.
1 sc in each sc to last 6 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 24 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and
draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc
to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
4th and 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Rep last 3 rows 4 times more, then 3rd row once. 12 sc. Fasten
off.
Edging: Join B with sl st to bottom right edge of Hat. Ch 1.
Work 1 rnd of sc around edge of Hat, having 3 sc in each corner.
Join with sl st to first ch of bottom left Hat edge. Fasten off.
Golden Buckle
With C, ch 28. Join with sl st to first ch. Fasten off.
Sew Buckle into square shape on front of Hat as shown in
picture.
FINISHING
With B, embroider eyes. With red yarn, embroider mouth.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby Cotton™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 145 yds/133 m) Blissful Print (7942) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 5. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as a st). 11 hdc in ring. 11 hdc. Do not join here or throughout. PM for beg of rnd and move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each hdc around. 22 hdc.
3rd rnd: *1 dc in next hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 33 dc.
4th rnd: *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. 44 dc. Turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Leave rem sts unworked. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m)

Contrast A Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 14 yds/12 m or Tangerine (01699) or Tea Rose (00042) or Pretty in Pink (01136) or Orchid (01137) or Blueberry (01725) or Seabreeze (01201) or Robin’s Egg (01215) or Sage (00084) or Yellow (00010) or Jute (00082) or Light Blue (00026)
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast C Choose from list given for Contrast A 20 yds/18 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 chains or stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Choose contrast A and C as desired. 
With A, ch 54. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 24 ch. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 25 ch. Turn. 51 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 24 sc. Sc3tog – PM on last st for center. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of last 24 sc, joining B to last st. Break A. Turn. 49 sts.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to 3 center sts. Sc3tog. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row, alternating 2 rows of B and 2 rows of C until 3 sts rem. 
Next row: With C, ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop:
With WS facing, join C with sl st to corner at center of foundation chain. Ch 8. Sl st in same sp as last sl st to form ring. Turn. Ch 1. Work 20 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (Solids: 1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m; Ombres: 1.5 oz/42.5 g; 68 yds/62 m) or (Solids: 14 oz/400 g; 710 yds/650 m; Ombres: 12 oz/340 g; 608 yds/556 m)
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) or color of your choice)           3 balls
Contrast B Hot Blue (01742) or color of your choice)           3 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions: Note: Ch 2 at beg of each rnd does not count as dc. With A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 10 dc into 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each of next 10 dc. Join B with sl st to first dc. 20 dc. 3rd rnd: With B, ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 30 dc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around.
