Join with sl st to first dc. 42 sts. 5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 54 sts. 6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first dc. 66 sts. 7th rnd: With A, ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 90 sts. Make loop: Sl st in each of next 6 dc. Ch 8 for loop. Join with sl st in same sp as last sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds)
(Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz/86 m/95 yds)
(00165 Daisy Ombre) 2 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sts and 12 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 44.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 43 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc. Rep from * across to last sc, pushing tr to RS of work. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * across to last sc, pushing tr to RS of work. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures 13 ins [33 cm], ending on a RS row.
Hanging Loop: Ch 10. Join with sl st in last sc worked. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each of 8001 Marshmallow A, 8215 Lemon B, 8506 Icepop C, and 8260 Orange D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Section (make 6: 3 with A and 1 each with B, C, & D)
Leaving a long beginning tail, ch 10. Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—9 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—7 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Rows 4–7: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twice—3 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first st, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Disc
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 hdc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first hdc—6 hdc. Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for alternating arrangement of pieces. Holding right sides together and with beginning tails, whipstitch sections together. Sew disc to center of sections. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8929 Strawberry A, 8506 Icepop B, 8930 Watermelon C, 8690 Avocado D, 8215 Lemon E, and 8417 Oyster F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 5" (12.5 cm) in diameter, excluding hanging loop.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 5: 1 each with A & F, B & F, C & F, D & F, and E & F)
With first color, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop
With right side facing, join F with slip st in any st, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next 4 sts, turn, ch 8; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Chain (optional)
With F, ch 156 or to desired length. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Version 1
Contrast A and C Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 112 yds/102.5 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Version 2
Contrast A Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Contrast C Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 18 yds/16.5 m
Version 3
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Contrast C Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 18 yds/16.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Scfp = Draw up a loop around post of next sc, working from front to back. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook
gauge: 15 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
Carry color not in use across top of row and work sts around it.
To join new color, work to last loops on hook, yoh with new color to complete st and proceed with new color.
With A, ch 36.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice, joining B in last st. *With B, (1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice. 1 dc in next ch, joining A. With A, (1 sc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch) twice. 1 sc in next ch, joining B. Rep from * twice more, omitting joining B at end of row. Turn. 35 sts.
2nd row: With A, ch 3 (counts as ddc). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) twice, joining B in last st. *With B, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining A. With A, (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining B. Rep from * twice more, omitting joining B at end of row. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) twice, joining B in last st. *With B, (1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc) twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining A. With A, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining B. Rep from * twice more, joining B at end of row. Turn.
4th row: With B, ch 3 (counts as ddc). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) twice, joining A in last st. *With A, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining B. With B, (1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining A. Rep from * twice more, omitting joining A at end of row. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) twice, joining A in last st. *With A, (1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining B. With B, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining A. Rep from * twice more, omitting joining A at end of row. Turn.
6th row: As 4th row, joining A at end of row.
7th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 9" [23 cm], ending on a 3rd row of pat. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st in bottom left corner. Ch 1. Work 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 33 sc across rem loops of foundation ch. Work 3 sc in next corner. Work 33 sc up side edge. Work 3 sc in next corner. Work 1 sc in each st across top edge. Work 3 sc in next corner. Work 33 sc down side edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Work 1 scfp around each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Ch 16 for loop. Sl st back into each ch of loop. Fasten off leaving long end. Thread end onto yarn needle and join opposite end of loop into corner.
Version 2
Version 3

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 241 Duckie A and 10 Coconut B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scrubby measures 6" wide x 6½" long (15 x 16.5 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
With A, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first st—6 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—18 sc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; change to B; join with slip st in first st—24 sts.
Round 5: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice, [hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 3 times; join with slip st in first st—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice, [hdc in next 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 3 times, hdc in space between last and first st; join with slip st in first st—43 sts.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice, [hdc in next 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 3 times, 2 hdc in last st, do not join—50 sts. Place marker on first st and move up as rounds are completed.
Round 9: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 3 times, [hdc in 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts] 3 times, 2 hdc in next st, 2 sc in last st, do not join—58 sts.
Round 10: Sc in next st, 2 hdc in next 3 sts, hdc in next st, sc in next 3 sts, slip st in next 3 sts, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice, slip st in next 3 sts, sc in next st, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next 4 sts, slip st in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next 4 sts, slip st in next 7 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, slip st in last 4 sts; join with slip st in first sc—67 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 258 Orange A, 709 Bubblegum B, and 905 Cherry C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scrubby measures about 5” [12.5 cm] wide and widest and 6” [15 cm] tall, not including hanging loop.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Notes
1. Scrubby is worked in joined rounds, with same side facing at all times. Do not turn at the end of rounds
2. Yarn quantities are sufficient to make both ornaments.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete the stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color.
Special Stitches
Cl (2 treble crochet cluster) = *[Yarn over] twice, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * once more, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Bpdc (back post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from back side of work to front and to back again around the post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip the stitch “in front of” the Bpdc.
Special Technique
Join with Bpdc (join with back post double crochet) = Place slip knot on hook, yarn over, insert hook from back side of work to front and to back again around the post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip the stitch “in front of” the Bpdc.
Color Sequence for Ornament #1: Work 1 round each with A, B, A, C, C, and B.
Color Sequence for Ornament #2: Work 1 round each with C, A, C, B, A, and C.
ORNAMENT (make 2 – 1 in each color sequence)
With first color, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 11 more dc in ring changing to 2nd color in last dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first hdc, ch 1), hdc in next st, [ch 1, hdc in next st] 10 times, ch 1 and change to 3rd color; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3—12 hdc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 2hdc in next ch-1 space, [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next ch-1 space] 11 times changing to 4th color in last hdc; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2—36 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 11 times, do not change color; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—48 dc.
Fasten off.
Round 5: With right side facing, join 5th color with Bpdc around any st, Bpdc around each remaining st and change to 6th color in last st; join with slip st in top of first Bpdc—48 Bpdc.
Round 6: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next st, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 10 times, dc in next st, tr in next st, Cl in each of next 2 sts, tr in next st, dc in next st, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 10 times; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch—69 sts.
Do not fasten off.
Hanging Loop: Ch 12, slip st in same st as joining.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g/1.75 oz or Ombres/Prints 42.5 g/1.5 oz) 1 ball (Pretty Pastels)
6 mm crochet hook (U.S. J/10)
instructions:
Ch 4, join with sl st to form a ring.
Note: Ch 5 at beg of each rnd counts as 1 dc and ch 2 sp throughout. 
Base rnd: Ch 5. (3 dc. Ch 2) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. 
Rnd 1: Ss in next ch 5. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next sp (corner made). Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 2 dc in ch 2 sp from beg of rnd. Sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5.
Rnd 2: Ss in next ch. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next sp (corner made).* Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once more. 2 dc in ch 2 sp from beg of rnd. Sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. 
Rnds 3-9: Sl st in next ch. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp. * (Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp) to corner. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner sp.* Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once more. 2 dc in ch 2 sp from beg of rnd. Sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch 5.
Fasten off at end of 9th rnd.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 938 Almond A, 709 Bubblegum B, 10 Coconut C and 905 Cherry D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 7½” [19 cm] across at widest point.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
CRUST 
With A, ch 18.
Set-Up Row (Wrong Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across –15 dc. 
Row 1: Ch 2 (does not count as stitch here and throughout), turn, hdc in first st, Fpdc, *Bpdc, Fpdc; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, hdc in first st, Bpdc, *Fpdc, Bpdc; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st. 
Repeat Rows 1-2 once more, then Row 1 once. Fasten off.
PIE 
With B, ch 22.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [skip next ch, Shell in next ch, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 5 times, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc in skipped ch, sc in Shell, sc in skipped ch; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st. 
Rows 2-3: Working along straight edge only, ch 2, turn, hdc in each st to end – 21 hdc. 
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in each st to last 4 sts, [hdc2tog] twice – 17 hdc.
Row 5: Ch 2, turn, hdc2tog, *hdc in next st, hdc2tog; repeat from * to end – 11 hdc.
Row 6: Ch 2, turn, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in next 2 sts, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in last st – 7 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, turn, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in next st, hdc2tog – 4 hdc. Fasten off. 
CREAM TOP
With C, ch 14.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [skip next ch, Shell in next ch, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 3 times, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1,*sc in sc, sc in skipped ch, sc in Shell, sc in skipped ch; repeat from * to last st, sc in sc.
Row 2: Working along straight edge only, ch 2, turn, [hdc2tog] 3 times, hdc in next st, [hdc2tog] 3 times – 7 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, [hdc2tog] twice, hdc in next st, hdc2tog – 4 hdc. Fasten off.  
CHERRY
With D, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, work 10 sc in ring. Fasten off. 
STEM
With A, ch 10. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Sew lower scalloped edge of Pie along last row of Crust.
With scalloped edge as lower edge, sew Cream centered along top edge of Pie. Sew Cherry in center of top edge of Cream. Fold Stem in half and sew ends to top edge of Cream. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Country Yellow (01612) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 23 yds/21 m
Note: 1 ball of each A and B will make 5 Dishcloths
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of each rnd does not count as dc.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd:  10 dc into 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each of next 10 dc. Join B with sl st to first dc. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 30 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 42 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 54 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first dc. 66 sts.
7th rnd: With A, ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 90 sts.
Make loop:  Sl st in each of next 6 dc. Ch 8 for loop. Join with sl st in same sp as last sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Jute (00082)  1 ball (65 m/68 yds)
Contrast B Country Red (01530) 1 ball (5 m/6 yds)
Contrast C Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball (11 m/12 yds)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Head 
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
*2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from
* to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to
first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st.
*1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc.
Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last
2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.
*2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc.
Rep from * to last 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc
in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first
sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st.
*1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc.
Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last
4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
*1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc.
1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 
5 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next
sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st
to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.
1 sc in next sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 6 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 2 sc. (2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc
in each of next 2 sc) 5 times. 2 hdc in last
sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 52 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.
1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc.
1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in
next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in
next st. 2 hdc in next st. (1 dc in next st.
2 dc in next st) 7 times. 2 hdc in next st.
1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts.
Join with sl st to first sc. 65 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc.
1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in
next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 hdc in
next st. 2 hdc in next st. (1 dc in each of
next 2 sts. 2 dc in next st) 7 times. 2 hdc in 
next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in each of last 
2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 78 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc.
1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 3 times. 2 sc in
next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 hdc in
next st. 2 hdc in next st. (1 dc in each of
next 2 sts. 2 dc in next st) 8 times. 1 dc in 
each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in 
next st. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 92 sts.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last  
sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (2 sc in next 
sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 3 times. 2 sc 
in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 1 hdc 
in next st. 2 hdc in next st. (1 dc in each of 
next 3 sts. 2 dc in next st) 8 times. 1 dc in 
each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in 
next st. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 112 sts. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, 
instead of from right to left as usual, work 
1 reverse sc in each st around. Join with sl 
st to first sc. Fasten off.
Ears (make 2)
With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in 
each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working 
into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 
2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl 
st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc.  
1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc.14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc.  
1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 hdc in each of 
next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 19 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.  
1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 
1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 hdc in each 
of next 6 hdc. Join with sl st to first sc.  
Fasten off.
Antlers (make 2)
With C, ch 9.
1st row: Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at 
back of ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc 
in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 
4 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 5 sts. 
Ch 8. Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at 
back of ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc 
in each of next 6 ch. 1 sc in each of next  
5 sl sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 7 sts.  
Ch 8. Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at 
back of ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc 
in each of next 6 ch. 1 sc in each of next  
7 sl sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 5 sts.  
Ch 6. Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at 
back of ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc 
in each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next  
5 sl sts. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
Nose
With B, ch 4.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc 
in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into 
opposite side of ch, 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in 
last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last  
sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc.  
1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc.12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last  
sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next 
sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. (2 dc in 
next sc) twice. 1 hdc in next sc. 3 sc in next 
sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Nose and Ears in position as shown in 
picture. Sew Antlers in position as shown 
in picture, noting 1 Antler will be flipped 
for mirror image effect. With C, embroider 
eyes with satin stitch and mouth with 
chain stitch.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each of 10 Coconut A, 905 Cherry B, 620 Lime C, and 12 Black D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
Fabric sealant (optional)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 6" wide x 6½" long (15 x 16.5 cm), excluding leaf and stem.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Apple
With A, ch 7.
Round 1: Work 3 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 4 ch, 3 hdc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, hdc in next 4 ch; join with slip st in first hdc—14 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 4 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch— 20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—30 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 4 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch— 36 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 5 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—42 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 6 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc. Fasten off.
Round 7: Join B with sc in any st, sc in same st, sc in next 7 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc. Fasten off.
Leaf
With C, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, *sc in first st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * once, turn—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts, turn—8 sc.
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 1, sc in each st across.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next st, [sc2tog] 3 times—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Stem
With D, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—5 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, sew stem and leaf to top of apple. With D, embroider seeds ½" (1.5 cm) in length in center of apple, working 2 straight stitches in the same place for each seed. Pull beginning and end tails to the wrong side of the piece and knot. Optional: apply a drop or 2 of fabric sealant on each knot to prevent unraveling. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds). Version 1 main color (mc) Hot Blue (01742) (40 m/43 yds) or 1 ball contrast a Robin’s Egg (01215) (50 m/54 yds) or 1 ball contrast B White (00001) (17 m/19 yds) or 1 ball
Version 2 main color (mc) Mod Green (01223) (40 m/43 yds) or 1 ball contrast a Hot Green (01712) (50 m/54 yds) or 1 ball contrast B White (00001) (17 m/19 yds) or 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions: notes: • To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed with new color. • Carry yarn not in use loosely across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding. With MC, ch 36. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice. *With A. (1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next ch) twice. 1 sc in next ch. With MC. (1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next ch) twice. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * twice more. 35 sts. Turn. 2nd row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *With A. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. With MC. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. Turn. 3rd row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. *With A. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With MC. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. Turn. 4th row: As 2nd row. With A. Turn. 5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. *With B. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. With A. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. Turn. 6th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *With B. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. With A. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. Turn. 7th and 8th rows: As 5th and 6th rows, joining MC at end of 8th row. 9th row: As 3rd row. Rep 2nd to 9th rows for pat 3 times more, then rep 2nd to 4th rows once. Fasten off. edging: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. Work sc evenly around outer edge of Dishcloth, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball 7962 Calm Print
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 2.
Row 1: 3 sc in 2nd chain from hook – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 5 sc.
Rows 3-14: Repeat Row 2 for twelve more times – 29 sc on last row worked.
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc to last 2 sts, skip next sc, sc in last sc.
Rows 17-28: Repeat Row 16 for twelve more times – 3 sc remain on last row worked.
Row 29: Ch 1, turn, sc3tog. Do not fasten off.

Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, turn to work along outside edges, hdc evenly around outside edges, working (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in each corner, slip st in first hdc to join. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Beach Glass (01132) 1 ball or 67 yds [61.5 m]
Contrast A Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 6.5 yds [6 m]
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
With MC, ch 33.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 31 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 1. Skip 1 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 7 times more.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 1. Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. (Work sc evenly across to next corner. 3 sc in next corner) 3 times. Work sc evenly across last side. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in front loop only of each st, 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Work 1 sc in each sc to next corner. 3 sc in next corner) 3 times. Work 1 sc in each sc to end. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Numbers: Using photo as guide and centering the applique numbers over 5 rows, work lengths of chain with A to create 2017 numbers. Sew each number in position as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
contrast A Hot Pink (01740) (2 m/2 yds) or 1 ball
contrast B Sunshine (00073) (2 m/2 yds) or 1 ball
contrast C Tangerine (01699) (65 m/71 yds) or 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 9 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join B with sl st to front loop of any sc of 2nd rnd. Working in front loops only, *ch 3. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in same sp as first sl st. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join C with sl st to rem back loop of any sc of 2nd rnd. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 4 dc in same sp as last sl st. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in top of ch-3. Pull dropped loop through hook – beg dc-popcorn made.
Working in back loops only, ch 3. Miss next sc. *5 dc in next st. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in first dc. Pull dropped loop through hook – dc-popcorn made. Ch 3. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to beg dc-popcorn. 9 dc-popcorn.
5th rnd: Sl st in first ch-3 sp. (Beg dc-popcorn. Ch 2. Dc-popcorn) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 2. *(Dc-popcorn. Ch 2) twice in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to beg dc-popcorn. 18 dc-popcorn.
6th rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 4 (counts as tr). 4 tr in same sp as last sl st. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in top of ch-4. Pull dropped loop through hook – beg tr-popcorn made. Ch 2. 5 tr in next ch-2 sp. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in first tr. Pull dropped loop through hook – tr-popcorn made. Ch 2. Tr-popcorn in same ch-2 sp as last tr-popcorn. Ch 2. *Tr-popcorn in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (Tr-popcorn. Ch 2) twice in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to beg tr-popcorn. 27 tr-popcorn.
7th rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 4. 2 tr in same sp as last sl st. Sl st in next tr-popcorn. *Ch 4. 2 tr in next ch-2 sp. Sl st in next tr-popcorn. Rep from * around. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball 982 Zesty A
COATS® Crème de la Crème®: 1 ball 935 Taffy Stripes Ombre B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
FLOWER
With A, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Fasten off.
Round 7: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any st, ch 1, sc in same st as join, skip next st, 5 dc in next st, *skip next st, sc in next st, skip next st, 5 dc in next st; repeat from * around, skip last st; join with slip st in first sc—9 sc and 45 dc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7775 Tulip Pink A, 7760 Lemony B, and 7501 Caribbean C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 2: 1 each with A & B and B & C)
Sole
With first color, ch 13.
Round 1: Work 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first hdc), hdc in next 9 ch, 3 hdc in last ch, working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, hdc in next 9 ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as join, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 7 sts, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 7 sts, 2 hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 3 times, hdc in next 5 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 6 times, hdc in next 4 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 2 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—44 hdc. Fasten off.
Strap
With 2nd color and leaving a long tail for sewing, ch 17.
Row 1: Working in back bars only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—16 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Edging
Round 1: Join 2nd color with sc in any st, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Mark the centered point of the sole 1" (2.5 cm) from top edge. Fold strap in half and tie a strand of matching yarn around midsection. Thread ends of strand through needle, sew through marked point, and secure. With beginning and end tails, sew strap to each side edge of sole, 1½" (4 cm) from sewn center of strap.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 50 g / 1.75 oz or Ombres: 42.5 g / 1.5 oz)
Main Color (MC): (00001 White) or (13712 Hot Green) or (13742 Hot Blue) 1 ball
Contrast A: (00089 Banana), (00001 White), (13742 Hot Blue) or (23743 Summer Splash) or (00018 Lemon Swirl) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12½ ins [32 cm] each side of triangle.
instructions:
Center Triangle
With MC, ch 21.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook -sc2tog over last 2 sc made. Turn.
4th to 18th rows: As 3rd row 15 times. 4 sts at end of last row.
19th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc) twice. Turn.
20th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Fasten off.
First Triangle
1st row: With RS of work facing, join A with sl st to corner ch of foundation chain of Center Triangle. Ch 1. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
Work 2nd to 20th rows as given for Center Triangle.
Note: First Triangle should match Center Triangle.
Second Triangle
1st row: With RS of work facing, turn work so First Triangle is to the right. Join A with sl st to top corner of Center Triangle. Ch 1. Work 20 sc evenly across. Turn.
Work 2nd to 20th rows as given for Center Triangle.
Third Triangle
1st row: With RS facing, join A with sl st to rem side of Center Triangle. Ch 1. Work 20 sc evenly across. Turn.
Work 2nd to 20th rows as given for Center Triangle.
Border and Loop
With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to corner of any Triangle and work 1 rnd of sc, having 3 sc in corners. Ch 6 (loop). Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8001 Marshmallow A and 8690 Avocado B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch markers
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] work direction in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures about 6" x 6" [15 cm x 15 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 13 rows sc = 4" [10 cm]. Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 22.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—21 sc.
Rows 2-20: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. At end of Row 20, fasten off and weave in ends.

SHAMROCK
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not turn; join to work in continuous rounds. Place marker for beginning of Round.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.

1st Clover Leaf
Row 1: Sc in next 4 sc, leave remaining sts unworked; turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; turn—6 sc.
Rows 3-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, (hdc, dc, hdc) in next sc, slip st in next 2 sc, (hdc, dc, hdc) in next sc, sc in last sc—10 sts. Fasten off and weave in ends.

2nd and 3rd Clover Leaves
Join B in next unworked sc along Round 2 of Shamrock.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sc, leave remaining sts unworked; turn—4 sc. 
Rows 2-5: Repeat Rows 2-5 of First Clover Leaf.

Stem
With B, ch 9; turn.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across—8 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Attach between 1st and 3rd Clover Leaves.

FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, with B, sew Shamrock to Scrubby.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream 4-Ply Worsted Weight 100% Cotton – Solids – 2.5 oz/70.9 g; Ombres – 2 oz/56.7 g
1 ball Solids or Ombres Denim
5.00 mm crochet hook (U.S. H or 8)
instructions: Ch 41. Base row: Dc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch, * ch1, skip next ch, dc in next 3 ch, rep from * to end, turn. 39 sts. Row 1: Ch 2, * dc in next 3 sts, ch1, skip next ch1sp, rep from * to last 3 sts, dc in last 3 sts, turn. Row 2: Ch 2, * dc in first st, ch1, skip next st, dc in next st, 1 long dc (insert hook in ch1sp 2 rows below), rep from * to last 3 sts, dc in next st, ch1, skip next st, dc in last st, turn. Row 3: Ch2, dc in first st, * ch1, skip next sp, dc in next 3 sts, rep from * to last 2 sts, ch1, skip next sp, dc in last st, turn. Row 4: Ch2, * dc in first st, 1 long dc over next sp, dc in next st, ch1, skip next st, rep from * to last 3 sts, dc in next st, 1 long dc over next sp, dc in last st, turn. Rep rows 1 - 4 until work measures 11 in., [28 cm] from beg. Fasten off. EDGING: Work 1 rnd sc evenly around entire outer edge, working 3 sc in each corner, sl st in first st. Next rnd: Ch 2, dc in each st, working 3 dc in each corner st, sl st in top of turning ch. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7760 Lemony A, 7939 Tranquil Print B, and 7100 Cotton C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Scrubby measures 7" across bottom edge and 6" long (18 x 15 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 2.
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.
Rows 5–24: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 ten times—27 sc.
Row 25: Repeat Row 3. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (Solids: 1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m; Ombres: 1.5 oz/42.5 g; 68 yds/62 m) or (Solids: 14 oz/400 g; 710 yds/650 m; Ombres: 12 oz/340 g; 608 yds/556 m)
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) or color of your choice 1 ball
Contrast B Hot Pink (01740) or color of your choice 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 9 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next dc.
Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first dc. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in
next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 40 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc.
*1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join A
with sl st to top of ch 3. 50 dc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc around. Join with
sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc.
*1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join B
with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
7th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next dc. 8 tr in next
dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next dc.
8 tr in next dc. Skip last dc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Peaches & Crème Stripey® (2 oz/56.7 g; 102 yds/93 m)
Spring Blue Stripes (17008) 1 ball or 54 yds/59.5 m
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in grid pat with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Dishcloth is worked with a Grid Layer base. The Wiggles Layer is worked onto the Grid Layer to create the raised spiral effect.
Grid Layer
With larger hook, ch 25.
1st row: 1 hdc in 5th ch from hook (ch-4 counts as hdc, ch 1, skip next ch). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 23 sts.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1). *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-4. 1 hdc in 3rd ch of last ch-4. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as hdc, ch 1). *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3. 1 hdc in 2nd ch of last ch-3. Turn.
Rep 3rd row until 11 rows in total have been worked. Fasten off.
Wiggles Layer
With smaller hook, join yarn with sl st to hdc post indicated with a red arrow on Chart (see page 2). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc around same hdc post as last sl st. Work 2 dc around each ch-1 or hdc post, following arrows on Chart to create Wiggles. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 905 Cherry A and 709 Bubblegum B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 9” wide x 8½” long (23 x 21.5 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical with this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Work 5 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc), turn—6 dc.
Rows 2–10: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first dc (same as base of beginning ch-3), dc in each st across to beginning ch, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—24 dc.
Row 11: Ch 3, dc in each dc across, turn.
First Lobe
Row 12: Ch 3, dc in next 11 dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—12 dc.
Rows 13–15: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in each st to last 3 sts, dc2tog, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—6 dc.
Fasten off.
2nd Lobe
Row 12 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, skip first unworked st, join A with slip st in next unworked st, ch 3, dc in each remaining st across, turn—12 dc.
Rows 13–15: Repeat Rounds 13–15 of first lobe. Do not fasten off at end of last round.
Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sts, and opposite side of foundation ch, sc evenly spaced around, adding sc as needed to keep piece flat and working 3 sc in foundation ch (base of 6 dc of Row 1); join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with sc in center st of 3-sc group at bottom of piece, *ch 2, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, adding sc as need to keep piece flat; join with slip st in first sc. Do not turn.
Round 3: Ch 1, (sc, ch 3, sc) in each ch-2 space around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids 70.9 g/2.5 oz, Ombres 56.7 g/2 oz)

Contrast A: (00001 White) 1 ball
VERSION 2: Main Color (MC): (00073 Sunshine) 1 ball

instructions:
Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc in 1st to 3rd rnds.
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in same sp as sl st. *Miss next 2 hdc. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
5th rnd: Sl st in next st and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in same ch-1 sp. *(2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in next ch-1 sp – shell made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
6th and 7th rnds: Sl st in next st and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in same ch-1 sp. *(3 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to top of ch 2 at end of 7th rnd.
8th rnd: With A, ch 2. *8 dc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in sp between 2 shells. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. (1 sc in next dc. Ch 1) 7 times. *(1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row below. Ch 1) 4 times. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp as last sc. (Ch 1. 1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row above) 3 times.** (1 sc in next dc. Ch 1) 8 times. Rep from * 11 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) contrast A 1 ball (20 m/22 yds) Warm Brown (01130)
Lily® sugar’n cream® (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) contrast B 1 ball (8 m/9 yds) Jute (00082)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6" [15.5 cm] wide x 12" [30.5 cm] long.
instructions:
With A, ch 8. 
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 13 sc at end of 4th row.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next sc.  Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - bobble made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc.  Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 15 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in last st. Turn. 19 sts.
7th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 21 sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc.  Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn.
10th row: As 8th row.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc.  Turn.
12th to 17th rows: Rep 10th and 11th rows 3 times more.
18th row: As 8th row.
19th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc.  Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. 19 sts.
20th row: As 8th row. 
21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc.  Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc.1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 17 sts.
22nd row: As 8th row. 
23rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of the next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts.
24th row: As 8th row.
25th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Bobble in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 13 sts.
26th row: As 8th row. 
27th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc.  Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
28th row: As 8th row. 
29th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Bobble in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
30th row: As 8th row. 
31st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
32nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.  Break A. Join B. 5 sts.
33rd to 45th rows: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
46th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 4 tr in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 5 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz)
Contrast A (01130 Warm Brown) 1 ball
Contrast B (01699 Tangerine) or (00010 Yellow) or (01009 Soft Teal) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 26.
Body: 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Ch 10. Sl st in first ch - first loop made. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. Ch 10. Sl st in first ch - second loop made. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 3 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) all in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Ch 10. Sl st in first ch - third loop made. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. Ch 10. Sl st in first ch - fourth loop made. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
First Wing: 1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st to first ch-10 loop. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (7 dc. Ch 5. 10 dc) all in ch-10 loop. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-5 sp. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc2tog made. Fasten off.
Second Wing: 1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st to second ch-10 loop. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (9 dc. Ch 5. 8 dc) all in ch-10 loop. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-5 sp. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Fasten off.
Third Wing: Working into third ch-10 loop, work as given for First Wing.
Fourth Wing: Working into fourth ch-10 loop, work as given for Second Wing.
Join Wings: Right side: 1st row: Join A with sl st to first dc of First Wing. Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 8 dc. (2 sc. Ch 3. 2 sc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 13 dc. 2 sc in next dc. Sl st in Body in 6th sc from Loop. Sl st in first dc of Second Wing. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 13 dc. (2 sc. Ch 3. 2 sc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 9 dc. Sc2tog. Sl st in Body in 6th sc from Loop. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (2 sc. Ch 3. 2 sc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Leaving rem 5 sts unworked, sl st in 6th sc of next First Wing. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (2 sc. Ch 3. 2 sc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Sl st in Body in 6th sc from Loop. Fasten off.
Left side: 1st row: Join A with sl st to first dc of Third Wing. Rep from ** to ** as given for Right side.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)

measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] tall (excluding stem) x 11" [28 cm] wide.
instructions:
See Chart on page 2.
Center Section
Ch 15. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to last ch. (1 sc.  Ch 4. 1 sc) in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation chain, 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. Turn.
Note: Work in back loops only of each sc and ch-1 sp throughout.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. Skip first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to next ch-4 sp. (2 sc. Ch 4. 2 sc) in next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Right Section: 11th row: Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch and each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc.  Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
**12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
13th row: Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch and each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Skip next sc of 10th row. 1 sc in next sc of 10th row. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
14th and 15th rows: As 12th and 13th rows.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Skip next st of 10th row. 1 sc in next st of 10th row. Turn. 
ABBREVIATIONS:
MATERIALS
Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Red (00095) 1 ball or 50 yds/45 m 
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
SKILL LEVEL:  
 
|CROCHET INTERMEDIATE
SCC0512-002001M

MAPLE LEAF CROCHET DISHCLOTH   |  CROCHET   2 of 2

18th and 19th rows: As 16th and 17th rows.
20th row: As 16th row.
21st and 22nd rows: As 11th and 12th rows.
23rd to 30th rows: As 13th to 20th rows, working in skipped sc of 20th row instead of 10th row.
31st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Skip next st of 20th row. 1 sc in next st of 20th row. Fasten off.** 
Left Section: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to front loop of first sc of 10th row. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Note: Work in front loops only of each sc and ch-1 sp throughout. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Section. 
FINISHING
Thread yarn through last sc of ch-4 sp of 10th row, last sc of 20th and 30th rows of Right and Left Sections. Pull gently. Fasten securely. 
Stem: Ch 20. 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 
Sew Stem in place.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball of 987 Americana
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
POUF
Ch 17.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, dc in next 8 ch, slip st in last 4 ch, turn—16 sts.
Rows 2–24: Ch 1, slip st in first 4 slip sts, dc in next 8 dc, slip st in last 4 slip sts, turn.
Joining row: Holding Rows 1 and 24 together and working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Form a circle resembling a doughnut by flattening pouf with row ends in center of piece. With end tail, whipstitch row ends together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball 7958 Nautical Print
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm (US I-9)
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 6" wide x 6" long (15 x 15 cm).
gauge: Round 1 = 1¾" (4.5 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc now and throughout), 2 dc in ring, [ch 1, 3 dc in ring] 3 times, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc and 4 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Slip st in next 2 dc, slip st in first ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in same space, [ch 1, 3 dc] twice in each ch-1 space around, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc and 8 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Slip st in next 2 dc, slip st in first ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in same space, *(ch 1, 3 dc) in next 2 ch-1 spaces, [ch 1, 3 dc] twice in next ch-1 space; repeat from * once, ch 1, 2 sc in next ch-1 space, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—2 sc, 30 dc, and 11 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Slip st in next 2 dc, slip st in first ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in same space, [ch 1, 3 dc] twice in next ch-1 space, (ch 1, 3 dc) in next 2 ch-1 spaces, [ch 1, 3 dc] twice in next ch-1 space, (ch 1, 3 dc) in next 2 ch-1 spaces, [ch 1, 3 dc] twice in next 2 ch-1 spaces, ch 1, sc in last 2 ch-1 spaces, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—2 sc, 42 dc, 15 ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—59 sc.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream Twists (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g/109 m/120 yds) (Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g/86 m/95 yds) Main Color (MC) (20315 Summer Twists) 2 balls
Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g/Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g) Contrast A (00093 Soft Violet) 1 ball
Contrast B (01317 Hot Purple) 1 ball
Contrast C (00083 Cornflower Blue) 1 ball
Contrast D (00073 Sunshine) 1 ball
Contrast E (01712 Hot Green) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Plastic pot 3½ ins [9 cm] in diameter
Hot glue gun
measurements: Dishcloth: Approx 10 ins [25.5 cm] square. Pot Holder: Approx 11 ins [28 cm] square.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
With MC, ch 30. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 29 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 tr in next sc (push tr post to RS of work). 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.  
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc (push tr post to RS of work). Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows until work from beg measures 8 ins [20.5 cm], ending with 3rd or 5th row. Fasten off. 
Edging: 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. *Work 29 sc to next corner. 3 sc in corner. Rep from * twice more. Work 29 sc to next corner. Join with sl st in first sc. Break A. 
2nd rnd: Join C with sl st to any corner sc. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 14 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in corner sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Break C. 
3rd rnd: Join B with sl st to any corner ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in missed sc 1 row below) 15 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc.** (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in corner ch-1 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Sl st in corner ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 6 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next ch-1 sp and sc. 5 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, working 7 dc in corner ch-1 sp and ending with: miss next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next ch-1 sp and sc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. 
Pot Holder
Front and Back: (make alike).
With C, ch 41. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch end of ch. 40 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 39 times more. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: Working through both thicknesses and with Front facing, join B with sl st in bottom left corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edges to join pieces, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Pansy 
With D, ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring. 
1st rnd:Ch 1. (2 sc in ring. Ch 2) twice. (2 sc in ring. Ch 5) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Break D.
2nd rnd:Join Color 2 with sl st to first ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc. Ch 3. 1 sl st in first ch – Picot made. 2 hdc) all in same ch-2 sp. Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. (2 hdc. Picot. 2 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. [Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. (1 hdc. 9 dc. 1 hdc) all in next ch-5 sp] 3 times. Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. Fasten off.
Leaf: (make 2). With E, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 5 dc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch into rem loops, 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Make 2 Pansies: 1 With A and 1 with B. 
Sew 2 Pansies and 2 Leaves in corner of Pot Holder (see picture).

materials: Lily Sugar n’ Cream® The Original™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) White (00001) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast A Hot Purple (01317) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast B Beach Glass (01132) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
