Contrast D Black (00002) 1 ball or 2 yds/2 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 10¾" [27.5 cm] long x 6½" [16.5 cm] wide.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
Stripe Pat
With C, work 1 row.
With A, work 2 rows.
With B, work 1 row.
With C, work 2 rows.
With A, work 1 row.
With B, work 2 rows.
With C, work 1 row
With A, work 2 rows.
With B, work 1 row.
With C, work 2 rows.
With A, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
These 17 rows form Stripe Pat.
Dishcloth
(See Diagram on page 2).
With C, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 7 sc. Join A. Break C.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc and each sc to end of row. Turn. Join C. Break A.
First 3 rows of Stripe Pat complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, work as follows:
4th to 9th rows: Rep last 2 rows 3 times more. 15 sc at end of 9th row.
10th row: As 2nd row. 17 sc.
11th and 12th rows: As 3rd row.
13th to 15th rows: Rep last 3 rows once more. 19 sc at end of 15th row.
16th row: As 3rd row.
17th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc and each sc to end of row. Turn. Join MC. Break B.
End Stripe Pat.
18th row: (WS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in horizontal bar created below first hdc (below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). *1 sc in horizontal bar created below next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
19th to 21st rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc and each sc to end of row. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 17 sts.
23rd to 34th rows: Rep last 3 rows twice more, then rep 21st and 22nd rows 3 times more. 7 sts at end of 34th row.
35th row: As 22nd row. Do not turn. 5 sts.
Border:
Cont with MC as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Work 80 sc evenly around Dishcloth. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With D, embroider Bunny face and ears using Stem Stitch as shown.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8215 Lemon A, 8260 Orange B, and 8012 Licorice C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Dritz Fray Check® liquid seam sealant
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 2¾" [7 cm]. Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 8 sc in ring—8 sc. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring and close center.
Round 2: Ch 1, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), dc in same st as join, *skip next sc, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next sc; repeat from * around, skip last dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4—24 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, ch 2, slip st) in same st as join (Right Feather made), skip next ch, (slip st, ch 2, hdc, sc) in next dc (Left Feather made), *(sc, hdc, ch 2, slip st) in next dc, skip next ch,(slip st, ch 2, hdc, sc) in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—12 Right Feathers and 12 Left Feathers.
Fasten off.
Round 6 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing and holding yarn between Feathers, join A with sc (see Special Techniques) in any ch-1 space of Round 3, (ch 3, sc) in each ch-1 space around, join with slip st in first sc; turn—24 sc, 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 7 (Right Side): Ch 1, slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 4 dc in same space, 5 dc in each ch-3 space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 8: See Notes above.
First Wing
Ch 7; turn.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 5 ch, slip st in next dc; turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Sc in first 4 sc, slip st in next sc, leave last sc unworked, ch 1; turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Skip slip st, sc in next 4 sc, slip st in next dc; turn—4 sc.
Row 4: Sc in first 2 sc, slip st in next sc, leave last sc unworked, ch 1; turn—2 sc.
Row 5: Skip slip st, sc in next 2 sc, slip st in next dc (first Wing made)—2 sc.
Sc in next 9 dc.
Head
Ch 4 (counts as first tr); working from left to right, skip 3 sc to right of current st, slip st in 4th sc; working from right to left, 10 tr in same dc as last sc made (Head made)—11 tr.
Skip next 4 dc, sc in next 4 dc; slip st in next dc.
Second Wing:
Ch 3; turn.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, slip st in next dc; turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, ch 2; turn—3 sc.
Row 3: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each sc, slip st in next dc; turn—4 sc.
Row 4: Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc, ch 2; turn—5 sc.
Row 5: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each sc, sc in next dc (second Wing made)—7 sc.
Sc in each remaining 35 dc around; join with slip st in space between last and first dc—43 sc, 2 Wings, one 11-tr Head. 
Fasten off.
First Foot
With Right Side facing, join B with sc (see Special Techniques) in 13th sc from second Wing, ch 3, sc in same sc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next 2 sc—6 sc, 3 ch-3 loops. 
Fasten off.
Second Foot
With Right Side facing, skip next 5 sc, join B with sc (see Special Techniques) in next sc, ch 3, sc in same sc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next 2 sc—6 sc, 3 ch-3 loops. 
Fasten off.
Beak
With Right Side facing, join B with sc (see Special Techniques) around post of 6th tr of Head, sc around post of same tr, ch 1, turn, sc2tog. Fasten off. 
Comb
Join B with slip st (see Special Techniques) in 5th tr of Head, (ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in last ch, slip st) in same tr as join, (sl st, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in last ch, slip st) in next 2 tr—3 sections. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Carefully slide Beak down tr as far as possible. Draw beginning tail to Wrong Side between 5th and 6th tr; draw end tail to Wrong Side through top of same dc as base of tr. Tie tails together without pulling Beak to Wrong Side.
Eyelashes
Using photo as a guide, cut two 8" (20.5 cm) strands of C. With “Eyelashes” pointing up, wrap 1 strand around 4th tr of Head 3 times. Draw tails to Wrong Side and tie together, taking care not to pull so tightly on ends as to pull Eyelashes to Wrong Side. Repeat around 8th tr of Head. With needle, carefully straighten Eyelashes upward bring out fullness. Trim ends of tails close to Head.
Weave in ends. Apply sealant to all knots and ends to prevent unraveling. Apply to Eyelashes also, if desired, to seal in place.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby: 1 ball 905 Cherry OR 709 Bubblegum
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
gauge: 13 hdc = 4” [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4” [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Ch 27. Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each chain across – 26 sts. Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each st across. Repeat Row 2 until Dishcloth measures 8” [20.5 cm]. Fasten off. FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 938 Almond A, 934 Candy B, 510 Glacier D, 10 Coconut C and 905 Cherry D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 5” [13 cm] across at widest point.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
CONE (make 2)
With A, ch 4.
Set-Up Row (Wrong Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook.
Row 1: Ch 3 (does not count as a dc here and throughout), turn, 3 dc in dc – 3 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in last st – 4 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc to last dc, 2 dc to last dc – 5 dc.
Repeat Row 3 four more times – 9 dc.
Fasten off.

ICE CREAM
First Scoop
With B, ch 14.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [skip next ch, Shell in next ch, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 3 times,
turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, *sc in sc, sc in skipped ch, sc in Shell, sc in skipped ch; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st.
Rows 2-3: Working along straight edge only, ch 2 (does not count as a hdc here and throughout), turn, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in each st to end – 15 hdc.
Fasten off.

Second Scoop
With C, ch 16.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, [skip next ch, Shell in next ch, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 3 times, sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, sc in sc, *sc in next sc, sc in skipped ch, sc in Shell, sc in skipped ch; repeat from * to last 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts.
Rows 2-3: Working along straight edge only, ch 2, turn, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to end – 13 hdc.
Fasten off.

Third Scoop
With D, ch 16.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, [skip next ch, Shell in next ch, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 3 times, sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, sc in sc, *sc in next sc, sc in skipped ch, sc in Shell, sc in skipped ch; repeat from * to last 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts.
Rows 2-6: Working along straight edge only, ch 2, turn, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 2 sts, hdc2tog – 3 hdc.
Fasten off.

CHERRY
With D, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 10 sc in ring. Fasten off.

STEM
With A, ch 10. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Cone pieces together. Following photo and overlapping pieces along lower scalloped edges, sew three Scoops together. Sew Ice Cream along top edge of Cone. Sew Cherry in center of top edge of Third Scoop. Fold Stem in half and sew ends to top edge of Third Scoop. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Main Color (MC) (01712) Hot Green 1 ball
Contrast A (00002) Black 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With MC, ch 36.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 10 times more. Join A at end of last row.
Hat shaping: Next row: With A, ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. 25 sts rem.
Next row. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until 3 sts rem.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made. Fasten off.
Nose: With MC, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. Fasten off.
FINISHING: With A, embroider mouth with chain st and eyes with French knots as shown in picture. Sew on nose as shown in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) 00046 (Rose Pink) or 00042 (Tea Rose) or 00010 (Yellow) or 01222 (Country Green) or 01215 (Robin’s Egg) or 00026 (Light Blue) or 01317 (Hot Purple) 1 ball or 54 m/60 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 26. (See diagram on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Miss next 2 ch. (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in next ch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – puff st made. Ch 2. (Puff st. Ch 2. Puff st. Ch 1) in same ch as last puff st. Miss next 2 ch. *1 sc in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. [(Puff st. Ch 2) twice. Puff st. Ch 1] all in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc. Ch 2. 1 sc in center puff st of next 3 puff st group. Ch 2. 3 dc in next sc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in center puff st of next 3 puff st group. Ch 2. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Ch 2. 1 sc in center puff st of next 3 puff st group. Ch 2. 2 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). (Puff st. Ch 2. Puff st. Ch 1) all in first dc. Miss next dc and ch 2. 1 sc in next sc. *Miss next ch 2 and dc. [(Puff st. Ch 2) twice. Puff st. Ch 1] all in next dc. Miss next dc and ch 2. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. Miss next ch 2 and dc. (Puff st. Ch 2. Puff st) in top of beg ch 3. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first puff st. Ch 2. Miss next ch 2 and puff st. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 2. *1 sc in center puff st of next 3 puff st group. Ch 2. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 2. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in last puff st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Miss next ch 2 and dc. [(Puff st. Ch 2) twice. Puff st. Ch 1] all in next dc. Miss next dc and ch 2. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Turn.
6th to 13th rows: Rep 2nd to 5th rows twice more.
14th row: As 2nd row. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Red (00095) or Rose Pink (00046) or Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 70 yds/64 m
Contrast B Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 17 yds/16 m
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
With A, ch 2. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd to 14th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 28 sc at end of 14th row.
15th to 24th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
First Side: 25th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Turn. 12 sts. Leave rem sts unworked for Second Side.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
27th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
28th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
29th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
30th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 3 sts. Fasten off.
Second Side: 1st row: (RS). Skip center 2 sc of 24th row. Join yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 11 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 3 sts. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st to lower point of Heart. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. Working up side of Heart, work 1 sc in side of each row (30 sc). Work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc (across Right Top Edge of Heart). Work 1 sc in side of each of next 6 rows. Sc2tog (across skipped 2 sts). Work 1 sc in side of each of next 6 rows. Work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc (across Left Top Edge of Heart). Working down side of Heart, work 1 sc in side of each row (30 sc). Join with sl st to first sc. 82 sts.
2nd rnd (Shell border): Sl st in each of next 2 sts. (Skip next 2 sc. 7 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc) 6 times. Sl st in each of next 7 sts. (Skip next 2 sc. 7 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc) 6 times. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball 930 Marble
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 4" wide and 7" long (10 x 18 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SPECIAL STITCHES
Bpdc (back post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from back side of work to front and to back again around the post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (2 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (1 loop on hook). Skip the stitch "in front of" the Bpdc.
Fpdc (front post double crochet) = Yarn over, insert hook from front side of work to back and to front again around post of indicated stitch; yarn over and pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (2 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 2 loops (1 loop on hook).
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

NOTES
1. Scrubby is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times.
2. When instructed to work into a stitch "2 rounds below", work into the round numbered 2 less than the current row. For example, if you are working Round 14, a stitch "2 rounds below" is in Row 14 – 2 = Round 12.

SCRUBBY
Ch 17.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; taking care not to twist, join with slip st in first sc—16 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here or throughout), hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, Fpdc around first st, Bpdc around next st, *Fpdc around next st, Bpdc around next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 4: Ch 2, Bpdc around first st, Fpdc around next st, *Bpdc around next st, Fpdc around next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc.
Rounds 5-12: Repeat Rounds 3 and 4.
Round 13: (Ch 6, slip st) around post of each st around; join with slip st in first slip st.
Round 14: Ch 2, hdc in each slip st; join with slip st in first hdc.
Rounds 15–18: Repeat Rounds 13 and 14 twice.
Round 19: Repeat Round 13.
Round 20: Ch 1, sc in each slip st; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 21 and 22: Ch 1, [sc2tog] around; join with slip st in first sc—4 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Weave tail through last round, pull tightly to close and secure. Sew first and last st of Round 1 together with beginning tail. Weave in ends. Slide open end over handle of large spoon or kitchen utensil.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 936 Waves A, 10 Coconut B, and 982 Zesty C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 2: 1 each with A & B and C & B)
With first color, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here or throughout), (popcorn, ch 3) in each sc around; join with slip st in beginning ch-2 space—8 popcorns and 8 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 2, [popcorn, ch 3] twice in each ch-3 space; change to B; join with slip st in beginning ch-2 space—16 popcorns and 16 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, *3 sc in next 3 ch-3 spaces, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Red (00095), Rose Pink (00046), or Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 54 yds/49 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd to 14th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 28 sc at end of 14th row.
15th to 24th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
25th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Turn. 12 sc. Leave rem sts unworked for Second Side.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sc.
27th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sc.
28th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sc.
29th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sc.
30th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 3 sc. Fasten off.
Second Side: 1st row: (RS). Skip center 2 sc of 24th row. Join yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 11 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 3 sc. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to lower point of Heart. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work evenly in sc around outer edge of Heart to skipped sts in center. Sc2tog over skipped sts. Work evenly in sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz)
Main Colour (MC): 01116 (BlueJeans) 1 ball
Contrast A: 01628 (Hot Orange) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Marking pencil or tailor’s chalk.
instructions:
With MC, ch 31.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 30 sc. Turn.
2nd to 7th rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row (dec row): Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 8th rows twice more. 24 sts.
Next row:Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row until 4 sts rem.
Next row:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn.
Edging: 1st rnd:Ch 1. 3 sc in last st. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around, working 3 sc in each corner. Join A with sl st to first ch.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Ch 10 for hanging loop. Join with sl st to first ch.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 905 Cherry A and 12 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Dish Scrubby measures 9” x 9” (23 x 23 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Row 1: With A, Fdc 28, turn—28 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first st, dc in next 3 sts, *[dc3tog] twice, dc in next 3 sts*, [3 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * to * once, 3 dc in last st; change to B, turn.
Rows 3–10: Repeat Row 2 and change color in the following color sequence: *Work 2 rows with B, 2 rows with A; repeat from * once; change to B at end of Row 10.
Edging Round: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, *hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 4 sts, hdc in next 3 sts*, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * to * once, sc in next st, 2 sc in last st; working across ends of rows of first side, **3 sc in first row, 2 sc in next 8 rows, 3 sc in last row**; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 2 dc in first ch, dc in next ch, ***hdc in next 3 ch, sc in next 4 ch, hdc in next 3 ch***, dc in next 4 ch; repeat from *** to *** once, dc in next ch, 2 dc in last ch; working across ends of rows of other side; repeat from ** to ** once; join with slip st in first sc—104 sts.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Version 1
Contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Contrast B Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 47 yds/43 m
Contrast C Sunshine (00073) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Version 2
Contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Contrast B Seabreeze (01201) 1 ball or 47 yds/43 m
Contrast C Soft Violet (00093) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Version 3
Contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Contrast B Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 47 yds/43 m
Contrast C Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Size U.S H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color.
With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
Rep last 2 rows 9 times more. 25 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join B. Break A. PM at the end of last row.
Bottom Scoop:
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 scbl in first sc. 1 scbl in each sc to last sc. 2 scbl in last sc. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 25 sts.
Rep last row 11 times more. 3 sts. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS facing, turn work upside down. Join B with sl st to first unworked loop of marked row. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip next sc. 4 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Top Scoop:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
Fasten off.
Sew Top Scoop to Bottom Scoop as shown in photo.

pattern_name: LILY® SUGAR’N CREAM SEA SHADES DISHCLOTH
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A (01215 Robin’s Egg)
Contrast B (01742 Hot Blue)
Contrast C (01712 Hot Green)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 16.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 7th ch from hook (counts as dc, ch 2 and dc).
(Ch 2. Miss next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch) 3 times. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2).  (1 dc in next dc. Ch 2) 3 times.
1 dc in 5th ch of ch 7. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2).  (1 dc in next dc. Ch 2)
3 times. 1 dc in 3rd ch of ch 5. Turn. Fasten off  at end of 4th row.
Change working from rows to rnds:
1st rnd: With last row at top and RS facing, join B with sl st in top right
corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st.
Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-5 sp
(second corner made). Ch 1. Working down left side edge around each
dc or ch-3 sp, (3 dc in next sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next
ch-2 sp of foundation ch (third corner made). Ch 1. Working across
foundation ch, (3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc)
in next corner sp (fourth corner made). Ch 1. Working up right side edge
around each dc or ch-3 sp, (3 dc in next sp. Ch 1) twice. Ch 1. Join with
sl st to top of ch 3. Break B.
2nd rnd: Join C with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc).
(2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 2. Miss next 3 dc. 1 dc in next
ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 2. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner
ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to
top of ch 3. Break C.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc.
Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1) 4 times.
** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then
from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break A.
4th rnd: Join B with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc).
(2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 2. Miss next 3 dc. 1 dc in next
ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 2. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner
ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to
top of ch3. Break B.
5th rnd: Join C with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc.
Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 6 times.
** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then
from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 3. Break C.
6th rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc).
(2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 2. Miss next 3 dc. 1 dc in next
ch-1 sp) 7 times. Ch 2. Miss next 3 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp.
Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of
ch. Break A.
7th rnd: Join B with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 sc. Ch 2. 3 sc) in
same sp as sl st. *(3 sc in next ch-2 sp) 8 times.** (3 sc. Ch 2. 3 sc) in next
corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with
sl st to fi rst sc. Break B.

materials: Lily Sugar’ n Cream Naturals (56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds) Main Color (MC) (02046 Earth Ombre) 1 ball
Lily Sugar’ n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Contrast A (01130 Warm Brown) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 10 ins [25.5 cm] high x 9 ins [23 cm] wide.
instructions:
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 16 sc at end of last row.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
10th to 13th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 24 sc at end of last row.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Place marker at end of last row.
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 3½ ins [9 cm], ending with a WS row and joining A at end of last row.
Top shaping: 1st row: (RS). With A, ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. Ch 4. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 30 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
28 sc.
4th to 10th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn. 14 sc at end of 10th row.
Edging: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Do not turn. Work 1 sc in end of each row around, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Greens (90015) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 29.
1st row:  1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each of next 3 ch. *1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 sl st in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 28 sts.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. *1 sl st in each of next 4 sts. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th and 5th rows:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each of first 4 sts. *1 dc in each of next 4 sts. 1 sl st in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8506 Icepop A, 8001 Marshmallow B, 8260 Orange C, and 8012 Licorice D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 6" x 6" (15 x 15 cm), excluding bow.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 25.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—23 dc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout) *fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc; repeat from * across to last 2 dc, fpdc around next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, *bpdc around next dc, fpdc around next dc; repeat from * across to last 2 dc, bpdc around next dc, dc in top of beginning ch; change to B, turn. 
Rows 4–13: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 five times. 
Fasten off.
Carrot Nose
With C, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 3 ch, dc in last 3 ch, turn—9 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, hdc in next 3 hdc, sc in next 2 sc, sl st in last sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Eye (make 2) 
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Bow
With A, ch 22.
Rows 1 and 2: Repeat Rows 1 and 2 of snowman.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide to placement of all pieces.
Sew eyes in place. With D, embroider mouth with back stitches. Trim “lashes” of eyes and mouth to emphasize.
Tie a loose knot in bow and sew to side of snowman.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Black (00002) 2 balls or 200 yds/183 m
Contrast A Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast B Soft Violet (00093) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast C Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast D Seabreeze (01201) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast E Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast F Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Size U.S H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
instructions:
Notes: 
• Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to prevent stranding.
• When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout. 
DISHCLOTH (make 1 each with A, B, C, D, E, and F as Color 1; 6 dishcloths total)
See diagram on page 3. 
With Color 1, ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc into ring. Join MC with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. Do not break Color 1. 
2nd rnd: With MC, ch 3. With Color 1, 1 dcfp around ch 3 from last rnd. *With MC, 1 dc in next dc. With Color 1, 1 dcfp around same dc. Rep from * 10 times more. Join MC with sl st top of ch 3. 24 sts. 
3rd rnd: With MC, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. With Color 1, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *With MC, 2 dc in next dc. With Color 1, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * 10 times more. Join MC with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 sts. 
4th rnd: With MC, ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. With Color, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *With MC, 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. With Color 1, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * 10 times more. Join MC with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 sts. 
5th rnd: With MC, ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. With  Color 1, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. *With MC, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. With Color 1, 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * 10 times more. Join MC with sl st to top of ch 3. Break Color 1. 60 sts. 
6th rnd: With MC, ch 7 (counts as tr and ch 3). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. Working in back loops only, *1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. (1 tr. Ch 3. 1 tr) in next st for corner. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Join with sl st to 4th ch of ch 7. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in first tr. 5 sc in next ch-3 sp. *1 sc in each of next 16 sts. 5 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball
Contrast B Tangerine (01699) 1 ball
OR Contrast A Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball
Contrast B Robin's Egg (01215) 1 ball
OR Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast B Mod Green (01223) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 26.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. *1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row, joining B in last st. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row, joining A in last st. Turn.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
Last 4 rows form pat. Cont in pat until work from beg measures approx 8"  [20.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Cream (90018) or Energetic Pink (90013) or Pretty Purple (90017) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st row:  3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 7 sc.
4th row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 9 sc.
5th row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last sc. Turn. 11 sc.
Cont in same manner, working 3 sc in center sc, as established, each row, until 25 rows in total have been worked. 51 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 25 sc. (1 sc. Ch 10 for hanging loop. 1 sc) all in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 25 sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily Sugar n’ Cream® The Original™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast B Jewel Ombre (00201) 1 ball or 18 yds/17 m
Contrast C Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 34 yds/32 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Small amount of Black (00002) for embroidery
instructions:
Notes:
• When working in color block technique, wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. Start new colors at appropriate points.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Each square on chart represents one stitch.
DISHCLOTH
See Chart on page 2.
With C, ch 27.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
First 2 rows of chart complete.
Keeping cont of chart, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right rep 2nd row until 28 rows of chart are complete. Fasten off.
BORDER
With RS facing, join B with sl st to last sc.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 25 sc. 3 sc in next sc (corner). Working down side edge, 1 sc in each row to next corner. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch. 1 sc in each of next 24 ch. 3 sc in next ch. Working up side edge, 1 sc in each row to next corner. 2 sc in same sp as first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pin Dishcloth to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry. With Black yarn, embroider Eye and Mouth using Stem st as shown in picture.
STEM STITCH

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 241 Duckie A and 258 Orange B
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 yds of 312 Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scrubby measures 9” (23 cm) across widest points.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 8 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—9 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in space between first 2 sts, 2 dc in each remaining space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—18 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in space between first 2 sts, dc in next space, *2 dc in next space, dc in next space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—27 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in space between first 2 sts, dc in next 2 spaces, *2 dc in next space, dc in next 2 spaces; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in space between first 2 sts, *dc in next 2 spaces, 2 dc in next space; repeat from * to last 2 spaces, dc in next space, 2 dc in last space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch; change to B—49 dc.
Round 6: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in each space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. 
Sun Rays
Ray 1 
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in any st, sc in next 6 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—7 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last st; leave last st unworked, turn—6 sc.
Rows 3–6: Repeat Row 2—2 sc at end of Row 6.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each st, ch 4, turn, slip st in first sc made (hanging loop made)—2 sc and hanging loop. Fasten off. 
Rays 2-7
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in next unworked st, sc in next 6 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—7 sc. 
Rows 2–7: Repeat Row 2 of Ray 1—1 sc at end of Row 7. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
With right side facing, hanging loop at top, and C, embroider satin stitches for eyes and back stitches for smiling mouth. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) contrast A Ecru (00004) 1 ball (42 m/45 yds)
contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball (23 m/25 yds)
contrast C Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball (6.5 m/7 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small quantity of Hot Green (01712) to embroider eyes.
abbreviations: sc2tog = draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
note: When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, draw new color through 2 loops and proceed. Carry colors not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it.

mOTiF
cat Body: With B, ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Miss first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row and 5th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows. Join A in last sc. Break B.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sc as join. Work 3 sc down side of Cat Body. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner. 1 sc between each of next 11 sc across foundation row. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner. Work 3 sc up side of Cat Body. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 5 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts.* (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc.* (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc.* (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc.* (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 15 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc.* (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 17 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc.* (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

9th rnd: Join B with sl st in any corner ch-2 sp. Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). 1 dc in same sp. 1 dc in next sc. [*With A, 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 2 sc.* Rep from * to * until 2 sc before next corner. With A, 1 dc in next sc. (With A, 1 dc. With B, 1 dc) in next sc. With B, (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next sc] 3 times. Rep from * to * until 2 sc before first corner. With A, 1 dc in next sc. (With A, 1 dc. With B, 1 dc) in next sc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Break A.
10th rnd: With B, sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp. [*With C, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. With B, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc.* Rep from * to * until 2 dc before next corner. With C, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. With B, (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 3 times. Rep from * to * until 2 dc before first corner. With C, 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

Head
With B, ch 2.
1st row: (WS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc) twice. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (2 hdc in next sc) twice. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Sl st in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

First ear: 6th row: Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Fasten off.

second ear: With RS facing, miss next 2 sts. Join B with sl st to next st. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Sl st in last st. Fasten off.

Legs (make 4)
With B, ch 10.
Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at back of chain, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.

Tail
With B, ch 14.
Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at back of chain, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.

Finishing
Embroider eyes with green yarn and B using satin stitch. Sew legs and Tail in position as shown in photo. Using a few strands of B yarn as stuffing, sew Head in position. Embroider cat's back with straight stitches of B as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 71 g/2.5 oz, 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 57 g/2 oz, 95 yds/86 m)
Contrast A Coral Seas Ombre (02750) 1 ball or 40 yds/35 m
Contrast B Beach Glass (01132) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast C Teal (01133) 1 ball or 70 yds/65 m
Contrast D Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball or 30 yds/27 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 st markers.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
FRONT
Center Motif 
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first 
ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 12 sc into ring. 
Join with sl st to first sc
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. (3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 3 sc in 
next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with  
sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. (3 sc in 
next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc)  
3 times. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 28 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 
(3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 
6 sc) 3 times. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 36 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 
(3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 
8 sc) 3 times. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc 
in each of last 4 sc. Break A. Join D 
with sl st to first sc. 44 sc.
6th rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in same 
sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 
4 sc. (3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 10 sc) 3 times. 3 sc in next sc. 
1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with  
sl st to first sc. 52 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 
(3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 
12 sc) 3 times. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc 
in each of last 6 sc. Break D. Join C 
with sl st to first sc. 60 sc.
8th rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in same 
sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 
6 sc. (3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 14 sc) 3 times. 3 sc in next sc. 
1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Join with  
sl st to first sc. 68 sc. Fasten off. 
Place markers on 4 corner sc.
1st Triangle: 1st row: (RS). Join 
B with sl st in back loop of any 
marked corner sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in 
same sp as last sl st.  
Working in back loops only, 1 sc in 
each of next 16 sc across side of Center Motif.  
1 sc in back loop only of next 
marked sc. Turn. 18 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in both 
loops, sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 
2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 16 sts.
3rd to 6th rows: As 2nd row. Join 
A at end of last row. 8 sts.
7th and 8th rows: With A, as 2nd 
row. 4 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 
Turn. 2 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
2nd Triangle: 1st row: (RS). Join 
B with sl st in back loop of same 
corner sc at end of 1st Triangle. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.  
Working in back loops only,  1 sc in 
each of next 16 sc across side of 
Center Motif. 1 sc in back loop only 
of next marked sc. Turn. 18 sc.
2nd to 10th rows: Work as for 1st 
Triangle, substituting D for A.
3rd Triangle: 1st row: (RS). Join 
B with sl st in back loop of same 
corner sc at end of 2nd Triangle. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.  
Working in back loops only,  1 sc in 
each of next 16 sc across side of 
Center Motif. 1 sc in back loop only 
of next marked sc. Turn. 18 sc.
2nd to 10th rows: Work as for 1st 
Triangle.
4th Triangle: 1st row: (RS). Join 
B with sl st in back loop of same 
corner sc at end of 3rd Triangle. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.  
Working in back loops only,  1 sc 
in each of next 16 sc across side 
of Center Motif. 1 sc in back loop 
only of next marked sc (at beg of 
1st Triangle). Turn. 18 sc.
2nd to 10th rows: Work as for 1st 
Triangle, substituting D for A.
BACK
With C, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 3 sc in sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in 
next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc 
in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 
Turn.
5th to 19th rows: As 4th row.  
37 sc at end of 19th row.
20th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
22nd to 37th rows: As 21st row.  
3 sc at end of 37th row.
38th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Block Front and Back pieces to 
measure 7" [18 cm] square.
Join Front and Back and work 
edging: 1st rnd: With WS of Front 
and Back pieces facing each other 
and RS of Front facing, join C with 
sl st (through all thicknesses) at 
any corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. (Work 25 sc evenly across 
side to next corner. 3 sc in next 
corner) 3 times. Work 25 sc evenly 
across last side. Join with sl st to 
first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left 
to right, instead of from right to left 
as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each 
sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.  
Ch 20 for hanging loop. Join back 
into same sc as last sl st. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each of 8260 Orange A, 8690 Avocado B, 8012 Licorice C
Susan Bates Crochet Hook®: 4.0mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 16 sc and 10 rows sc = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PUMPKIN
With A, beginning at bottom Edge, ch 13.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across; turn—12 sc.
Row 2 (Right side): Ch 1 (does not count as a stitch), sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc; turn—14 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 4 sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc; turn—20 sc.
Rows 4-9: Repeat Row 2—32 sc.
Rows 10-19: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog; sc in last sc; turn—30 sc.
Rows 21-25: Repeat Row 20—20 sc.
Right Top
Row 26: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in each of next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in next sc; turn, leaving last 10 sts unworked—8 sc. 
Row 27: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each of next 4 sc, sc2tog; turn—6 sc.
Row 28: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each of next 2 sc, sc2tog; turn—4 sc. Fasten off.
Left Top
Referring to photo for placement, join A in first unworked sc at center of Row 25. 
Row 29: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in each of next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; turn—8 sc.
Row 30: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each of next 4 sc, sc2tog; turn—6 sc.
Row 31: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each of next 2 sc, sc2tog; turn—4 sc. (Do not fasten off.)
EDGE
With Right Side facing, ch 1, sc around outside edge of pumpkin, working sts into sides of Rows as needed to keep work flat, and working a slip st in the bottom of the top center “V.”  Fasten off yarn and weave in ends.
STEM
With B, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across; turn—4 sc.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn—4 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—6 sc. 
Rows 5-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn—6 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc—8 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Referring to photo for placement, sew stem to pumpkin.
EYE (make 2)
With C, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across; turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog twice; turn—2 sts. 
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 st.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Referring to photo for placement, sew eyes in place with Row 4 at the top of each.
NOSE
Make nose same as eye.
Referring to photo for placement, sew nose in place with Row 1 at the top.
MOUTH
With C, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across; turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—7 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 5 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—9 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Referring to photo for placement, sew Mouth in place.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 12 Black A, 905 Cherry B, 709 Bubblegum C, and 501 Ocean D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 10½” (26.5 cm) across widest petals.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 3 – 1 each with A & B, A & C, and A & D)
With A, ch 3.
Round 1 (right side): Work 9 hdc in 3rd chain from hook (beginning ch counts as first hdc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each hdc around; join with slip st in first hdc—20 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *hdc in next hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—30 hdc. Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, join 2nd color with sc in any hdc, sc in next 3 hdc, *Beg-Fhdc in next hdc, Fhdc 4 times, ch 3, hdc in base of each of the 5 Fhdc just made, hdc in next hdc, sc in next 4 hdc; repeat from * a round to last 2 hdc, Beg-Fhdc in next hdc, Fhdc 4 times, ch 3, hdc in base of each of the 5 Fhdc just made, hdc in last hdc; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc, 25 Fhdc, 25 hdc, and 5 ch-3 spaces. See photos on page 2.
Round 5: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc2tog, sc in next sc, hdc in next 5 Fhdc, 4 hdc in next ch-3 space, hdc in next 5 hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—15 sc and 70 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, hdc2tog, hdc in next 2 hdc, 2 dc in next 6 hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc, hdc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—15 sc, 30 hdc, and 60 dc.
Round 7: Ch 1, *sc3tog, dc in next 3 hdc, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next 6 dc, dc in next 3 dc, dc in next 3 hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 skein each 10 Coconut A, 620 Lime B, and 905 Cherry C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Colors A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 14 dc = 4" (10 cm); 7 dc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
With A, ch 4; slip st to first ch to join ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 15 dc in ring, slip st to first dc to join – 16 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, 4 dc in same st, dc in next 3 dc, *5 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * twice, slip st to first dc to join – 32 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 5 dc in next dc, *dc in next 7 dc, 5 dc in next dc; repeat from * twice, dc in last 5 dc, slip st to first dc to join – 48 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, 5 dc in next dc, *dc in next 11 dc, 5 dc in next dc; repeat from * twice, dc in last 7 sts, slip st to first dc to join – 64 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 5 dc, 5 dc in next st, *dc in next 15 dc, 5 dc in next dc; repeat from * twice, dc in last 9 dc, slip st to first dc to join – 80 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 7 dc, 5 dc in next st, *dc in next 19 dc, 5 dc in next dc; repeat from * twice, dc in last 11 dc, slip st to first dc to join – 96 dc.
Fasten off. Break A, leaving a 6" (15.2 cm) tail.
Wreath
With B, make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc + ch 1), [dc, ch 1] in ring 19 times, slip st to first dc to join round; tighten beginning yarn tail to close ring – 20 dc, 20 ch-spaces.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc + ch 1), dc in next ch-space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in each ch-space around, slip st to first dc to join round – 40 dc, 20 ch-spaces.
Fasten off. Break B, leaving a 6" (15.2 cm) tail.
Bow
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Row 1: Ch 4 (counts as tr), 2 tr in ring, ch 4 (counts as tr), slip st in ring, ch 4 (counts as tr), 2 tr in ring, ch 4 (counts as tr), slip st in ring – 8 tr.
Tighten beginning yarn tail to close adjustable ring, forming Bow.
Fasten off. Break C, leaving a 6" (15.2 cm) tail.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in Bow yarn ends. Sew Bow to Wreath using the wreath’s yarn tails (or an extra length of B), securing Bow on top center of Wreath (see photo for placement).
With an extra length of A, whipstitch Wreath to center of Dishcloth. Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar 'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Contrast B Black (00002) or Tangerine (01699) or Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 65 yds/59 m
Contrast C Rose Pink (00046) 1 ball or 4 yds/4 m
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® locking stitch marker
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Rnds are joined with sl st to first st of rnd unless otherwise indicated. 
Base 
See diagram on page 2. 
With B, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here. 
**1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 hdc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc. **
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 hdc.  
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 hdc.
Fasten off. 
Inner
With A, beg using magic loop method. 
Work from ** to ** as for Base. 60 hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 17 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in next st. 2 dc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. 2 dc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 17 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Join. Fasten off. 
Paws
With C, beg using magic loop method. 
1st row: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Turn. 
Break C. Join B. 
2nd row: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc. 2 dc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. 
Tail
With B, ch 9. 
1st row: 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 6 ch. 3 hdc in last ch. PM on central hdc. Working along opposite side of chain, 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 hdc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to marked hdc. 3 hdc in marked hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off. 
Assembly
Centre Inner over Base as shown in photo and stitch in place with yarn needle. 
Sew Paws to Bottom of Base as shown in photo. 
Sew Tail to Top of Base as shown in photo. 
Join B with sl st to any stitch at Bottom of base. Ch 1. Work evenly in sc around perimeter. Join. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8260 Orange A, 8215 Lemon B, 8930 Watermelon C, 8931 Pink Grapefruit D, and 8001 Marshmallow E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: Rounds 1–5 = 4" (10 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Square (make 2) 
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 12 dc in ring; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing and working in spaces between sts, join B with slip st in any space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in same space, 2 dc in each space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—twelve 2-dc groups. Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing and working in spaces between sts, join C with slip st in any space, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 5 dc in same space, *2 dc in next 2 spaces, 6 dc in next space (corner made); repeat from * twice, 2 dc in last 2 spaces; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—eight 2-dc groups and four 6-dc corners. Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, join D with sc in first dc of any 2-dc group, sc in each st around, working 3 sc in 3rd dc of each 6-dc corner; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc and four 3-sc groups. 
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each st around, working 3 sc in center st of each 3-sc group; join with slip st in first sc—44 sc and four 3-sc groups. Fasten off. 
Round 6: With right side facing, join E with slip st in any sc on any side edge, ch 1, hdc in same st and in each st around, working 3 hdc in center st of each 3-sc group—52 hdc and four 3-hdc groups. Fasten off, leaving a 24" (61 cm) tail on one square.
Strap
With E and leaving a 12" (30.5 cm) tail for sewing, ch 14.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—13 sc. 
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a 12" (30.5 cm) tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Hold squares with wrong sides together, taking care to match corner sts. With long tail, whipstitch edges together, tucking in short tails to minimize weaving in. 
Referring to photograph for placement, sew short edges of strap to midpoints of opposite edges of scrubby. Sew again over stitches just made to reinforce. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar‘n Cream® Stripes (2 oz / 56.7 g;  95 yds / 86 m) - 21010 (Natural Stripes) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
20 sc at end of 3rd rnd.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Ch 9. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of the next 7 ch. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * 4 times more; ending last rep with 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Miss next sc. Working in rem loops from previous rnd, 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 3 sc in next st. Working in both loops, 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 4 times more, ending last rep with 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc. 1 hdc) in next sc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. (1 hdc. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc.** Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Miss last sc. Join with sl st to top of beg ch 2.
7th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next hdc. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in next dc. 2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc3tog made. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in next hdc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® sugar ‘n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) main color (mc) White (00001) (40 m/45 yds) or 1 ball
contrast A Red (00095) (3 m/5 yds) or 1 ball
contrast B Hot Green (01712) (15 m/23 yds) or 1 ball
contrast C Warm Brown (01130) (3 m/5 yds) or 1 ball
instructions:
note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
With MC, ch 3 (See Diagram 1 on page 2).
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from 
* around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: With B, ch 1. *2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * 
around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 90 sc. Break B. 
10th rnd: *With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in same sp as sl st. Miss 
next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first sl st. 
Fasten off. 
Leaves: (make 3). 
With B, ch 10 (See Diagram 2 on page 2). 
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 
5 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working into rem loops of 
foundation ch, 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Cherries: (make 3). 
With A, ch 3 (See Diagram 3 on page 2).
1st rnd: 9 dc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. 
Sew on Leaves and Cherries as shown in picture. With C, work chain st 
embroidery for stems.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds; Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
contrast A Indigo (01114) 1 ball or 24 m/27 yds
contrast B Shaded Denim (00133) 1 ball or 22 m/24 yds
contrast C White (00001) 1 ball or 18 m/20 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
With A, ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. *1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 tr in each of next 3 tr. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join B. Break A. Turn. 
3rd row:  With B, ch 4 (counts as 1 tr now and throughout). 1 tr in each of next 2 sc. *1 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 tr. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 tr in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 4. 1 tr in each of next 2 tr. *1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 tr in each of next 3 tr. Rep from * to end of row. Join C. Break B. Turn. 
5th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times from front to back around post of sc 1 row below next sc. Yoh and draw through all 7 loops on hook - Puff St made. Miss next sc behind Puff St. *1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Puff St. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and Puff St across to end of row. Join A. Break C. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 tr in each of next 3 sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows until Dishcloth from beg measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
Fasten off.

materials: Peaches & Crème® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Dark Taupe (11013) 1 ball or 17 yds/16 m
Contrast B Rosemary (11085) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast C Forest Green (11237) 1 ball or 9 yds/8 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Black embroidery floss.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 9½" [24 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Pit (Make 2) See diagram on page 2.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from ring. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Break A. Join B. 40 sc.
Join Pits: With WS of Pits tog, align sts and proceed as follows:
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working through back loops of both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around to join pieces. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 48 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 56 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. (2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 6 sc) 5 times. 2 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of the next 2 sc. Sl st in each of next 8 sc. Join. 62 sts.
Beg working in rows:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. (1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts. sl st in next sc. Turn.
2nd row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 16 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sl st in next st. Turn.
3rd row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 6. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in next st. Turn.
4th row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 6 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. (1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next st) twice. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
Edging rnd: Join C with sl st to any sl st along bottom of Avocado. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around, having 2 sc in top dc. Join.
Face
With black embroidery floss, embroider face as shown in picture.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream 4 Ply (Solids 2.5 oz / 70.9 g / Ombres 2 oz / 56.7 g)
Main Color (MC) 1 ball Solids or Ombres
Contrast A 1 ball Solids or Ombres
6.00 mm crochet hook (U.S. J or 10)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: With MC, ch 4, join with ss. Note: Ch 5 at beg of each rnd counts as 1 dc and ch 2 sp throughout. Base rnd: Ch 5. (3 dc. Ch 2) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Ss in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Break MC. Rnd 1: With A, ss in next ch. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next sp (corner made). Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 2 dc in ch 2 sp from beg of rnd. Ss in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Break A. Rnd 2: With MC, ss in next ch. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next sp (corner made). Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in ch 2 sp from beg of rnd. Ss in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Break MC. Rnd 3: With A, ss in next ch. Ch 5. (Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next sp) to corner. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in corner sp. Rep from * to * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in ch 2 sp from beg of rnd. Ss in 3rd ch of beg ch 5. Break A. Rnds 4 - 11: As 3rd rnd alt MC with A as illustrated.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton Twists (1.5 oz/42.5 g; 68 yds/62 m) or (12 oz/340 g; 608 yds/556 m)
Color of your choice 100 yds/94 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Ch 41.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 39 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcfp in next st. 1 dcbp in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp in next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcbp in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Rep last 2 rows of Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Papaya (90014) or Greens (90015) or Spring Blue (90016) 1 ball or 30 yds/27.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch to create ring.
