1st rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each ch around. Join. 20 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each dc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 10 times. Join. 10 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and pass needle through to beg chain. Draw yarn tightly through beg ch and sew first and last rnds tog. Puff made.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 905 Cherry A and 10 Coconut B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scrubby measures about 8” [20.5 cm] diameter, not including hanging loop.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: With A, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), work 11 more dc in ring changing to B in last dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—12 dc.
Round 2: With B, ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each of remaining 11 sts changing to A in last dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—24 dc.
Round 3: With A, ch 3, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next st, 2 dc in next st] 11 times changing to B in last dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—36 dc.
Round 4: With B, ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, [2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in next st] 11 times changing to A in last dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—60 dc.
Round 5: With A, ch 3, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next st, 2 dc in next st] 29 times changing to B in last dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3—90 dc.
Round 6: With B, ch 3, dc in each st around changing to A in last st; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3.
Round 7: With A, ch 1, sc in same st as joining, skip next st, [2 sc in next st, skip next st] 44 times; join with slip st in first sc.
Hanging Loop: With A, ch 12, slip st in same st as joining; leave remaining sts unworked.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat Handicrafter Cotton (Solids: 400 g/14 oz or 50 g/1.75 oz) or (Ombres and Prints: 340 g/12 oz or 42.5 g/1.5 oz)
requires: 40 g/1.5 oz each of (#33216 Lavender Ice) as A and (#00001 White) as B
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 button
1 tea towel
measurements: Dishcloth: Approx 12 ins [30.5 cm] square. Towel Topper: Approx 6 ins [15 cm] wide x 12 ins [30.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through to complete st and proceed in new color.
DISHCLOTH 
With A, ch 37.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 36 sc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row in following color sequence:
(With A, 6 rows. With B, 2 rows) twice. With A, 6 rows. With B, 6 rows. With A, 2 rows. With B, 8 rows. With A, 2 rows. Fasten off.
TOWEL TOPPER 
With A, ch 22.
1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 21 sc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row in following color sequence:
With A, 6 rows. With B, 2 rows.
With A, 2 rows. With B, 2 rows.
With A, 8 rows. Break B. 
Tie: Next row: With A, ch 1.
Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sts. Y oh and draw through all loops on hook- sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. 11 sc.
Place marker at end of last row.  
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row for 6 ins [15 cm].
Next row:(Buttonhole row). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Ch 3. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Sew button to front of Towel Topper at marked row. Sew to tea towel.

materials: Lily® Sugar n’ Cream® Solids (70 g/2.5 oz)
MC: (00001 White) 1 ball or (70 m / 77 yrds)
A: (00002 Black) 1 ball or (4 m / 5 yrds)
B: (00095 Red) 1 ball or (4 m / 5 yrds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 11 ins [28 cm] high x 9 ins [23 cm] wide.
instructions:
With MC, ch 16.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 17 sc.
Rep last row 4 times more. 25 sc at end of last row.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 3 rows twice more. 31 sc at end of last row.
Next 5 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Rep last 3 rows twice more. 25 sc at end of last row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row twice more. 19 sts at end of last row.
Next row: Sl st in each of first 5 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last 4 sts. Turn.
Leave rem sts unworked. 11 sc rem.
Head shaping: 1st to 3rd rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 17 sc at end of 3rd row.
4th to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 3 times more. 9 sc. Do not fasten off.
Edging: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around outer edge of Snowman. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Buttons (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Eyes and Buttons to Snowman as shown in picture. Divide plys of A into 2 ply (half thickness). With 2 plys of A, embroider arms. With A embroider mouth using French Knots.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball 7760 Lemony
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Scrubby measures 5" (12.5 cm) in diameter from point to point.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Sun
Make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 7 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—7 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each st around, hdc in space between last and first st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—15 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next st, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 6 times, hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—22 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 2 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts] 6 times, hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—29 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 3 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts] 6 times, hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 hdc. Do not fasten off.
Sun Rays
Ray 1
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 3 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next st, sc2tog, turn—2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Rays 2–8 Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join yarn with sc in first unworked st, sc in next 3 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 of First Sun Ray.
Ray 9
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join yarn with sc in first unworked st, sc in last 3 sts, turn—4 sc. 
Rows 2 and 3: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 of First Sun Ray. Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Edging Round (right side): Ch 1, 2 sc in last sc made; working evenly spaced across ends of rows, work 3 sc in each side edge of rays, working 3 sc in st at top of each ray, sc in same st as first 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 92 yds/85 m)
Contrast A Coconut (00010)
Contrast B Lime (00620)
Contrast C Cherry (00905)
1 ball
1 ball
1 ball
Small amount of Contrast D Orange (00258) and Contrast E Black (00012)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scfp = Draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] across face and 8½" [21.5 cm] long, excluding hanging loop.
instructions:
Notes: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. Join all rnds with sl st to top of ch 3.
HEAD
With A, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcfp around first dc. 2 dcfp around each of next 11 dc. Join. 24 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. Skip first st. 2 dcfp around next st. (1 dcfp around next st. 2 dcfp around next st) 11 times. Join. 36 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 3. Skip first st. 1 dcfp around next st. 2 dcfp around next st. (1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dcfp around next st) 11 times. Join. 48 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 3. Skip first st. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 2 dcfp around next st. (1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 2 dcfp around next st) 11 times. Join. 60 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 3. Skip first st. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. 2 dcfp around next st. (1 dcfp around each of next 4 sts. 2 dcfp around next st) 11 times. Join. 72 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 scfp around each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
NOSE
With D, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 5 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 4 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew side edges tog to form cone. Sew nose to head as shown in picture.
EYE (make 2)
With E, ch 4. Sl st in first ch. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew eyes to head taking care to work sewing stitches near the surface so they do not show on back of head.
MOUTH
With E, embroider 7 French knots in a curve for Smile as shown in picture.
French knot 
COVER (to hide French knots on back of head): With A, ch 13. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew cover to back of Head, covering back of French knots.
HAT (make Front and Back alike)
Cuff 
With C, ch 18.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 dc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 7 times. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Top of Hat 
With B, ch 18.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 dc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. (Dc2tog) 7 times. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn. 9 sts.
5th row: Ch 3. (Dc2tog) 3 times. 1 dc in next st. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Cuff to long straight edge of Top of Hat, overlapping edges slightly. Rep for Back of Hat. Using matching yarn colors, sew side edges of Front and Back tog, leaving lower edges open. Place Hat on Head and sew in place.
HANGING LOOP
With C, ch 7. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 14 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew hanging loop to top of Hat.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds) (Ombres: 56.7g/2 oz/86 m/95 yds) Main Color (MC) (00073 Sunshine) 1 ball
Contrast A (00001 White) 1 ball
Contrast B (01712 Hot Green) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions: With MC, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 4th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. Break B. 5th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loop only of each sc, 1 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *1 hdc in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 3 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 3 times more, omitting 1 sc in each of last 2 sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc. 6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 sts. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 10 sts. Rep from * around, ending last rep with 1 dc in each of last 4 sts. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 7th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 dc in next dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around, ending last rep with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 8th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around, ending last rep with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 9th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around, ending last rep with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 10th to 12th rnds: Cont in same manner, working 1 more rep of (Ch 1. 1 dc in next dc) before and after each corner ch-2 sp. Fasten off. Note: 7 petals from 2nd rnd will alternate with 7 petals from 3rd rnd. Petals: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join A with sl st in any rem loop of 4th rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 loops. *2 sc in next loop. 1 sc in each of next 5 loops. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc. 2nd rnd: *Ch 10. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. Miss next 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first sc. 7 petals. 3rd rnd: Working behind last rnd, sl st in each of next 2 sc. *Ch 10. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. Miss next 3 sc of 1st rnd. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first sc. 7 petals. Fasten off. FINISHING: Sew petals in position as shown.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Seabreeze (01201) 1 ball or 60 yds/36.5 m
Contrast B Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast C White (00001) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Contrast D Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] wide x 7"  [18 cm] tall.
instructions:
Glass of drink
With A, ch 13.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch  to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 4th rows until 20 sc in row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 6½" [16.5 cm].
Fasten off.

Glass Edging
Join B with sl st in any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around edge of glass, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

Ice Cube (make 4)
With C, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch  to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 3 times more.
Fasten off.
Sew Ice Cubes to Glass as shown in photo.

Lime Wedge
With D, ch 3.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc  to end of row. Turn. 10 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from  * to end of row. Join C. Break D. Turn. 15 hdc. 
4th row: With C, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 20 sc.
Fasten off.
Using chain stitch, embroider segments onto Lime Wedge as shown in photo.
Sew Lime Wedge to top of Glass as shown in photo.
CHAIN STITCH

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids 400 g / 14 oz) Contrast A: (Green) 1 ball
Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Twists 340 g / 12 oz) Contrast B: (Twists) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Plastic scrubby approx 3½ ins [9 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Join A with sl st at side of Scrubby under 3 loops. 
1st rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 39 sc more around Scrubby. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 44 sc.
3rd rnd: Join B with sl st in any sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 9. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 tr in last ch. Miss next 3 sc of 2nd rnd. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 11 petals.
4th rnd: Working behind 3rd rnd, join B with sl st in any center sc of 3 missed sc from last rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 9. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 tr in last ch. Miss next 3 sc of 2nd rnd. 1 sc in next sc (center sc of 3 missed sc from 3rd rnd). Rep from * around omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Main Color (MC) Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast A Hippi Ombre (02122) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball or 3.5 yds/3 m
Sizes U.S. B/1 (2.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.

Upper Wings (make 2)
See diagram on page 2.
With larger hook and MC, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.  
1st rnd: Ch 2. 16 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd and alt rnds: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. Break MC. 
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first h dc. *1 dc in next h dc. 2 dc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 dc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. 3 tr in next dc. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of rnd. Fasten off.

Lower Wings (make 2)
See diagram on page 2.
With larger hook and MC, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 16 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc. Break MC.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 1. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of rnd. 48 sts. Fasten off.

Body and Antenna
See diagram on page 2.
With smaller hook and B, ch 35. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 32 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 32 ch. 2 sc in next ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Ch 10 for first antenna. Fasten off. Join B with sl st to last sl st. Ch 10 for second antenna. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Wings tog, with Upper Wings overlapping Lower Wings. Attach Body to Wings.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g ; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Ecru 00004                1 ball or 14 m/15 yds
Contrast A Yellow (00010)                    1 ball or 2 m/3 yds
Contrast B Sage Green (00084)           1 ball or 2 m/3 yds
Contrast C Hot Green (01712)                1 ball or 1.8 m/2 yds
Contrast D White (00001)                     1 ball or 1.8 m/2 yds
Contrast E Red (00095)                        1 ball or 1.8 m/2 yds
Contrast F Hot Pink (01740)                  1 ball or 1.8 m/2 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amounts of black yarn for embroidery of eyes.
measurements: Approx. 13" [33 cm] high x 7" [18 cm] wide.
instructions:
Stripe Pattern 
With B, work 1 row. 
With C, work 2 rows. 
With D, work 1 row. 
With E, work 1 row. 
With F, work 2 rows. 
With D, work 1 row. 
These 8 rows form Stripe Pat.
With MC, ch 2. 
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc across. 
Turn. 6 sc. 
3rd row: Ch1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in 
next sc) 3 times. Turn. 9 sc. 
4th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 12 sc. 
5th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc.
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 15 sc. 
6th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc.
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 18 sc. 
7th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 21 sc. 
Cont in this manner, inc 3 sts each row 
until there are 36 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. 
Do not turn. Working along straight 
top edge, work 24 sc evenly across. 
Join A with sl st to first sc.
Beard: 1st row: With A, ch 2. Working 
in back loops only, 1 hdc in each of 
next 9 sc. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 5 dc
in next sc.*Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc.
Miss next sc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from 
* once more. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 
1 hdc in each of next 10 sc. Break A. 
Join B.
Hat 
1st row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in side of last 
hdc worked. Working in back loops 
only, 1 sc in each of next 24 sc along 
top straight edge. 1 sc in side of next 
hdc. Join C. Turn. 
2nd row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
across. Turn. 26 sc. 

Cheeks (Make 2) 
With E, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With black yarn, embroider eyes. With E,
embroider mouth. Attach Cheeks as 
shown in picture. Attach Pompom to 
top of Hat as shown in picture.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. 
Join D. Turn. 
4th row: With D, as 2nd row. Join E. 
Turn. First 4 rows of Stripe Pat are 
complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as 
follows: 
Hat shaping: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Draw 
up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh 
and draw through all loops on hook – 
sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 
sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn. 
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st 
across. Turn.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 4 
rows 3 times more. 18 sc at end of last 
row. 
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in 
each sc to last 4 sc. (Sc2tog) twice 
over last 4 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. 
Turn. Rep last 2 rows 3 times more. 14 sc 
at end of last row. 
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
last 4 sc. (Sc2tog) twice over last 4 sc. 
Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice over first 
4 sts. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Rep 
last 2 rows once more. 6 sc. Fasten off.
Edging: Join B with sl st to bottom 
right edge of Hat. Ch 1. Work 1 sc 
around edge of Hat, having 3 sc in 
top corner. Join with sl st to first ch of 
bottom left Hat edge. Fasten off.
Pompom
With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 
Join C with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in 
next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st
to first sc. 24 sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar‘n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Main Color (MC) Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball or 35 m/38 yds
Contrast A Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 17 m/19 yds
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
•  When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color.
•  Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
FLIP FLOP
With MC, ch 7.
1st row: (WS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc at end of 3rd row.
4th to 17th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
18th row: As 2nd row. 14 sc.
19th and 20th rows: As 4th row.
21st row: As 2nd row. 16 sc.
22nd to 29th rows: As 4th row.
30th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row, placing marker on 10th sc. Turn. 15 sts.
31st row: As 4th row.
32nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 14 sts.
33rd row: As 4th row.
34th and 35th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts at end of 35th row.
36th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join A. Turn. 9 sts rem.

Edging: 1st rnd:  With A, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 36 reverse sc evenly down side. Work 6 reverse sc in rem loops of foundation ch. Work 36 reverse sc evenly up side. Work 9 reverse sc evenly across top edge. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
STRAP
With A, ch 23.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. Turn. 24 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Fasten off.
Sew Strap to Flip Flop as shown in picture, placing “peak” of Strap at marked st.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g ; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Bright Navy (00009)        1 ball
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball
Contrast B Red (00095) 1 ball
Size U.S. H or 8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] wide x 10" [25 cm] high.
instructions:
BOAT
With MC, ch 14. (See Diagram 1 on page 2). 
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 5 times. Ch 1. Miss next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 15 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 17 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 7 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 19 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 8 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 21 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 9 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 23 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 10 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 25 sts.
7th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 11 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 27 sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 12 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 29 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 13 times. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 31 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp across. Fasten off.
SAIL
With RS facing, join A with sl st to 6th sc of last row.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st.  1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
4th to 19th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 8 times more. 3 sts.
20th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Turn. 2 sts.
21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
FLAG
Join B with sl st to base of Sail at center above Boat. 
(See ‘1’ at base of red dots on Diagram 1). 
1st row: Work 1 sl st around each row to top of Sail. Ch 5. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. 4 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Turn. 2 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
LIFE PRESERVER
With B, ch 5. (See Diagram 2 on page 2). 
Join with sl st in first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
With A, sew Life Preserver to Boat as shown in picture.

materials: Peaches & Creme® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Forest Green (11237) or Aquamarine (11201) or Ecru (11006) 1 ball or 44 yds/48 m each
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS)
instructions:
Note: Cloth is worked in 2 pieces that are joined with a row of sc. Front piece is loopy texture and Back piece is plain sc.
FRONT
Ch 16.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. 1 Lp st in each sc to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 4½" [11.5 cm].
Fasten oﬀ.

BACK
Ch 16.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 4½" [11.5 cm].

Joining: With WS facing tog, join yarn with sl st in any corner. Working through both thicknesses, sc evenly around all sides having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten oﬀ.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8929 Strawberry A, 8690 Avocado B, and 8012 Licorice C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle, stitch marker, fabric sealant (optional)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc. 
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc. 
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. 
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc. 
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc. 
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc. Fasten off.
Round 10: With right side facing, join B with sc in any st, sc in next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts; repeat from * around to last 4 sts, sc in last 4 sts; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc. 
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts; repeat from * around to last 4 sts, sc in last 4 sts; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With C, embroider 2 straight stitches over any sc in Round 6, taking care to completely cover sc. On wrong side of piece, weave yarn through next 5 sts of same round and embroider 2 straight stitches over next sc. Repeat 4 times. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends. 
Optional: apply a few drops of fabric sealant to ends of tails of seeds to prevent unraveling.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) ecru (00004)  1 ball
Contrast A country red (01530) or hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast B Warm Brown (01130)  1 ball
Contrast C Sage Green (00084)  1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Apple
Note: ch 3 at beg of rnd or row counts 
as dc. 
With Mc, ch 4. Join with sl st to form 
ring.
1st rnd: ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl 
st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl 
st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl 
st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in 
next dc. 2 dc in next dc. rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
36 dc.
4th rnd: ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in 
next dc. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc 
in next dc.  rep from * around. Join with 
sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last 
sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in 
next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. rep 
from * around. Join with sl st to top of 
ch 3. 60 dc.
6th rnd: ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 
1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. (2 dc 
in next dc. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 1 
hdc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 6 dc. 
1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 
2 dc. 2 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in 
next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. 
Sl st in each of next 2 dc. 1 sc in next 
dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 
2 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in each 
of next 2 dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 1 sc in 
each of next 6 dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 
(1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc) 
4 times. 1 dc in next dc. 1 hdc in next 
dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Join A 
with sl st to first sc. 74 sts. Break Mc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as 
last sl st. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of 
next 4 sts. (2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each 
of next 5 sts) 4 times. 2 dc in next st. 
1 dc in each of next 4 sts. 1 hdc in next 
st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in 
next st. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. (2 dc 
in next st. 1 dc in each of next 5 sts) 4 
times. 2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of 
next 4 sts. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next 
st. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Hanging Loop
With 2 strands of B held tog, join with 
sl st to top of Apple. ch 12. Join with 
sl st in same sp as first sl st. Fasten off.
Leaf
With c, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc 
in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each 
of next 5 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in 
next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across 
opposite side of ch, 1 hdc in next ch. 
1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next  
5 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch.  
2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Sew Leaf to Apple near hanging Loop
FINISHING
With B, embroider seeds using Bullion 
st as seen in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g ; 120 yds/109 m) Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd or row counts as ddc.
Main Loop
Ch 52. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. *3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 12 ch. Rep from * twice more. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of last 6 ch. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 sc. *3 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * twice more. 3 dc in next sc. 1 dc in each of last 7 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. *5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 16 dc. Rep from * twice more. 5 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of last 8 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 dc. *4 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 20 dc. Rep from * twice more. 4 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of last 10 dc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Middle Loop (make 2)
Ch 59.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 28 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of last 14 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 13 sc. *2 dc in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc.** 1 dc in each of next 28 sc. Rep from * to ** once more. 1 dc in each of last 14 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 14 dc. *2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 3 dc in next dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc.** 1 dc in each of next 30 dc. Rep from * to ** once more. 1 dc in each of last 15 dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 dc. *2 sc in each of next 9 dc.** 1 sc in each of next 32 dc. Rep from * to ** once more. 1 sc in each of last 16 dc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave Middle Loops through Main Loop as shown in diagram. Sew ends of Middle Loops tog. Tack into place on WS.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz) Summer Splash (23743) 1 ball
or Playtime (23741) 1 ball
or Hot Green (13712) 1 ball
or Hot Orange (13628) 1 ball
Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 sts and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 32.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 31 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 9 ins [23 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. Ch 8. Sl st in top of last sc (loop). Fasten off.

materials: 1 ball each 10 Coconut A, 905 Cherry B, and 620 Lime C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 15 sc = 4" (10 cm); 18 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 3; join with a slip st in first ch. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc—12 sc. Drop A to wrong side to be picked up later, join B.
Round 3: With B, ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in next sc**, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—18 sc. Drop B, pick up A.
Round 4: With A, ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in each of next 2 sc**, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—24 sc. Drop A, pick up B.
Round 5: With B, ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in each of next 3 sc**, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—30 sc. Fasten off B, Join C.
Round 6: With C, ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in each of next 4 sc**, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—36 sc. Fasten off C, pick up A.
Round 7: With A, ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next sc, (hdc, 2 dc) in next sc, 2 tr in next sc, (2 dc, hdc) in next sc, skip next sc**, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—54 sts; 6 scallops. Fasten off A.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 241 Duckie A, 620 Lime B, and 12 Black C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
stitch marker (optional)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 5" wide x 6½" long (12.5 x 16.5 cm), excluding stem.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Bottom
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—36 sc.
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—42 sc.
Round 8: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—48 sc. Do not fasten off; remove marker. Continue working in turned rows.
Top
Row 1 (right side): Sc in next 7 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, sc in first unworked st; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—4 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 2 times—2 sc. Fasten off.
Leaf
With B, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last ch, turn—6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, hdc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, sc in next st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Stem
With C, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across–8 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, sew stem and leaf to top of pear. Weave in all ends.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
main color (mc) Yellow (00010) or Hot Orange (01628) or Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 40 m/44 yds
contrast a White (00001) 1 ball or 8 m/9 yds
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Length of satin ribbon 1/8" [3 mm] wide
6 stitch markers
instructions:
note: Ch 2 at beg of each rnd does not count as dc.
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 dc in ring. Join with sl st to first dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each of next 10 dc. Join with sl st to first dc. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 30 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 42 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 54 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first dc. 66 sts.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in each of next 8 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc 4 rows below. Place marker on last sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around, omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Thread satin ribbon through all marked sc. Pull tightly and tie in a bow.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds; Ombres and Prints: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
Contrast A: 02223 (Mod Ombre) or 02741 (Playtime) or 02220 (Green Dream) or 00001 (White) 1 ball
Contrast B: 01742 (Hot Blue) or 01628 (Hot Orange) or 01740 (Hot Pink) or 01712 (Hot Green) 1 ball
Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
note: Ch 5 at beg of each rnd counts as dc and ch 2.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 5. (3 dc. Ch 2) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in any ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. [Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Break B.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st in any ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. [Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Break A.
4th rnd: Join B with sl st in any ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Fasten off.
Proceed in rows as follows:
note: 
• When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through last 2 loops to complete st and proceed in new color.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. 
1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st in any ch-2 sp. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-2 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp (corner). 1 hdc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next ch-2 sp. turn. Leave rem 2 sides of Granny Square unworked. 35 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp (corner). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Join B in last st. Turn. 37 sts.
3rd row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp (corner). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 39 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to next ch-1 sp. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp (corner). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Join A in last st. Turn. 41 sts.
Cont in this manner, working 2 more rows with A and 2 more rows with B. 49 sts. Fasten off.

materials: Lily Sugar n’ Cream (Solids 70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Main Color (MC) (01130 Warm Brown) 1 ball
Contrast B (00010 Yellow) 1 ball
Contrast C (00095 Red) 1 ball
Lily Sugar n’ Cream Naturals (Ombres 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
Contrast A (02013 Terra Firma) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of 00002 (Black) for embroidery of eyes
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc at beg of rnd.
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc and in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. (2 hdc. Ch 1. 2 hdc) in same sp as sl st – shell made. *Miss next 2 hdc. Shell in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: Sl st in next hdc and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Shell in same ch-1 sp as sl st. *Shell in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Working back and forth in rows, proceed as follows:
1st row: Sl st in next hdc and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. (3 hdc. Ch 1. 3 hdc) in same ch-1 sp as sl st – Big shell made. *Big shell in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 9 times more. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd and 3rd rows: Sl st in each of next 2 hdc and ch-1 sp. Ch 2. Big shell in same ch-1 sp. *Big shell in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of 3rd row.
4th row: With WS of work facing, join A with sl st to first ch 1-sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 7 dc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in sp between 2 big shells. 8 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 dc. (1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row below. Ch 1) 5 times. 1 sc in same ch-1 sp as last sc. (Ch 1. 1 sc in sp between next 2 shells 1 row above) 4 times. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Claws (make 2)
With B, ch 15.
1st row: *Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each in each of next 5 ch. Ch 6. Rep from * once more. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
Beak (make 1).
With B, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row once more.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 3 sts rem.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Fasten off.
Waddle (make 1).
With C, ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 4 ch. Sl st in each of last 4 ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Claws in place. Sew Beak and Waddle in place. With Black, embroider eyes, using Satin St.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 709 Bubblegum, 980 Tropical, and 982 Zesty
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 13 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 15 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY (make 1 in each color)
Ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 dcs in center of ring, slip st in top of ch-3 – 12 dc. 
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each dc around, slip st in top of ch-3 – 24 dc. 
Row 3: Repeat Row 2 – 48 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, slip st in same st, [skip next st, 5 dc in next st, skip next st, slip st in next st] 11 times, skip next st, 5 dc in next st, skip next st, slip st in first slip st. 
Hanging Loop: Ch 10, slip st in last st of Row 4. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 905 Cherry A, 12 Black B, 620 Lime C, 10 Coconut D, and 241 Duckie E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 5" wide x 8" long (12.5 x 21.5 cm)
gauge: 13 sts = 4" (10 cm); 15 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Front
Note Leave long beginning and end tails for sewing.
With A, ch 17.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—16 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Rows 3–12: Repeat Row 2; change to B at end of last row.
Rows 13–16: Repeat Row 2; change to C at end of last row.
Row 17–30: Repeat Row 2. At end of Row 30, fasten off.
Back
Work same as front but do not begin and end with long tails for sewing.
Collar
With D, ch 18.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—17 sc.
Row 2: Slip st in first st, *skip next sc, scallop in next sc, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * 3 times—4 scallops. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Button (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Buckle
With B, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn; change to E at end of last row.
Border round: Ch 1, 3 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in last st; working in ends of rows of first side, work 3 sc evenly spaced down to Row 1; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows of other side, work 3 sc evenly spaced up to first sc; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, sew buckle to B-colored section and buttons to C-colored section of front.
With wrong sides held together, sew sides and top of front and back together with matching tails, leaving bottom edge open for wearer’s hand.
With end tail, sew collar to top of front.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Country Green (01222) 1 ball or 17 yds/15 m
Contrast B Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 18 yds/16 m
Contrast C Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast D Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as d\c throughout.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. (See diagram on page 2).
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: With C, ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in next dc. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook – bobble made. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Bobble in next dc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 sts.
5th rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 dc in next st. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts. 2 dc in next st. Rep from * around. Join D with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
6th rnd: With D, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc.
7th rnd: With C, ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) all in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. Skip next 5 dc. (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next dc. Rep from * around, ending with skip last 5 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
8th rnd: Join D with sl st to any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. Working in front of ch 2 and into 6th rnd, skip next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp of 7th rnd. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Join A with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to 1st sc. 84 sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 905 Cherry A, 10 Coconut B and 870 Royal C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 13 dc = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
STAR CENTER
With A, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 9 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 to join – 10 dc.
Row 2: Change to B, ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in next st, ch 1, [2 dc in next 2 sts, ch 1] 4 times – 20 dc and 5 ch-1 space.
Row 3: Turn, slip st in ch-1 space, ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), dc in same space, dc in next 4 sts, [(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space, dc in next 4 sts] 4 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 30 dc and 5 ch-1 space. Fasten off.

Shape First Star Point
Row 1: Join C to any ch-1 space, ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, dc in next ch-1 space, leave remaining sts unworked – 8 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, skip next st, dc in next 4 dc, skip next st, dc in last dc – 6 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, skip next st, dc in next 2 dc, skip next st, dc in last dc – 4 dc.
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, dc2tog, hdc in last st.
Fasten off.

Shape Second-Fifth Star Points
Join C in second ch-1 space of previous point, repeat Rows 1-4 of First Star Point.

Hanging Loop
With B, ch 10, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Row 1: Ch 1, work 10 sc in ring, slip st in first sc to join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

FINISHING
Using long tail, sew Hanging Loop to tip of any Star Point.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 510 Glacier A, 905 Cherry B, and 10 Coconut C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle, 2 yds black worsted weight yarn, sewing needle and white carpet thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Puppet measures 12” (30.5 cm) from tip of nose to end of tail.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
PUPPET
Top of Body 
Beginning at tip of nose, with A, ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 4 sc, turn—8 sc and one 3-sc group.
Rows 6–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to center st of 3-sc group, 3 sc in center st, sc in each remaining sc—14 sc and one 3-sc group.
Rows 9–25: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Piece should measure about 6½” (16.5 cm) long.
Row 26: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—15 sc.
Rows 27 and 28: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 29–31: Repeat Row 26—9 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Bottom of Body
Front Section 
Work same as Rows 1–19 of Top of Body. 
Fasten off. Piece should measure about 4½” (11.5 cm) long.
Back Section 
With A, ch 18.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—17 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6–11: Repeat Rows 26–31 of Top of Body.
Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Place Top of Body on a flat surface. Place Back Section of Bottom of Body on Top of Body, matching last row of each section. Sew side edges together. Lay Front Section of Bottom of Body on Top of Body, placing last row of Front Section against first row of Back Section (Front Section will be shorter than Top of Body). Beginning at Row 19 of Front Section and working towards front of puppet, sew edges of Rows 19–15 of Front Section to Top of Body on each side of puppet, leaving remaining rows unsewn for Mouth. Leave last row of Front Section and first row of Back Section unsewn for hand opening.
Mouth
Top  
With B, ch 4.
Rows 1–4: Work same as Rows 1–4 of Top of Body—9 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 6 and 7: Work same as Rows 6 and 7 of Top of Body—13 sc.
Rows 8–16: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Bottom 
Work same as Rows 1–11 of Top of Mouth. 
Fasten off.
Sew Row 16 of Top and Row 11 of Bottom together.
Teeth
Holding Mouth open flat with right side facing and working in ends of rows, join C with slip st in any row, *ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 4 rows; repeat from * around, easing to fit as needed; join with slip st in first slip st. Pin Mouth to Top of Body and Front Section of Bottom of Body. With carpet thread, sew in place.
Tail (make 2)
With A, ch 10.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—9 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—13 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; leave remaining 7 sc unworked, turn—8 sc.
Upper fin
Rows 6 and 7: Repeat Row 4—8 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Row 9: Repeat Row 4.
Row 10: Repeat Row 8—4 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn—2 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc2tog¬—1 sc. Fasten off.
Lower fin
Row 6: With right side of Row 5 facing, skip first unworked sc, join A with sc in next sc, sc in same sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—8 sc.
Rows 7–12: Repeat Rows 7–12 of first half. 
With wrong sides together, sew Tails together around outer edges. Holding puppet flat on its side, sew Row 1 edges to back of piece.
Top Fin (make 2) 
Beginning at bottom edge, with A, ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last st, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] twice, turn—6 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first sc, [sc2tog] twice, 2 sc in last sc—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Sew Top Fins together, then sew piece to top of puppet.
Bottom Fin
With A, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Work same as Rows 3 and 4 of Top Fin.
Row 4: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, 2 sc in last sc—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Sew Bottom Fin to Back Section of Bottom of Body.
FINISHING
With black yarn, embroider satin stitches for eyes.
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: LILY SUGAR'N CREAM TWISTS CROCHET DISHCLOTH
materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream Twists (56.7 g/2 oz) 2 balls of #20009 (Taupe Twists).
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Ch 41.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 39 dc.
Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcfp in next st. 1 dcbp in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp in next st. 1 dc in last st.
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcbp in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp in next dc. 1 dc in last dc.
Turn.
Rep last 2 rows of Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 10 ins [25.5 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 870 Royal A, 10 Coconut B, and 905 Cherry C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
2 stitch markers
sewing needle
white thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 7” (18 cm) from back to head x 6½” (16.5 cm) long.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Head
With A, ch 4.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st across to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—9 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 6: Repeat Row 5.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each st across to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—10 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each remaining st, turn—11 sc.
Rows 9 and 10: Repeat Rows 7 and 8—13 sc. Place marker on 6th st for edge of neck.

Body
Row 11: Ch 12, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, 2 sc in last ch; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—12 sc.
Row 12: Repeat Row 8—13 sc.
Rows 13 and 14: Repeat Rows 7 and 8—15 sc.
Rows 15–19: Repeat Row 5; change to B at end of Row 19. Place marker on end of Row 17.
Rows 20–23: Repeat Row 5; change to C at end of Row 23.
Rows 24–27: Repeat Row 5. Do not fasten off.

Front leg
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–4: Repeat Row 5. 
Fasten off. 

Back leg
Row 1: With wrong side of body facing, skip first 7 unworked sts, join C with sc in next st, sc in last 3 sts, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–4: Repeat Row 5. 
Fasten off. 

Holding marked sts together, sew neck seam to tilt head.

Edging
With right side facing, join A with slip st in first st of Row 11 (at back end of Donkey), [ch 15, slip st in same st as join] twice, sc in each st across to neck seam, ch 8, slip st in last st made (hanging loop made); working in ends of rows, sc in each row up first side of head, *ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch (ear made)*, skip first st of Row 1, 2 sc in opposite side of foundation ch of next st; repeat from * to * once, skip last st; working in ends of rows, sc in each row down other side of head to Row 10, 3 sc in Row 10; sc in each remaining st and end of row around, working 3 sc in outer corners of legs; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.

Star (make 3)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join—5 sc.
Round 2: *Slip st in next sc, ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook; repeat from * 4 times, join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.
With sewing needle and white thread, sew stars in place on Upper Body.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ Super Size (4 oz/113 g; 190 yds/174 m)
Contrast A Bamboo (18807) 1 ball or 65 yds/59 m
Contrast B Overcast (18042) 1 ball or 190 yds/174 m
Contrast C Ecru (18004) 2 balls or 230 yds/210 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop
instructions:
Version 1: Color 1 = A; Color 2 = C.
Version 2: Color 1 = C; Color 2 = B.
Version 3: Color 1 = B; Color 2 = C.
DISHCLOTH
Note: Dishcloth is worked corner to corner, increasing at center corner of each row.
To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed.
Carry Color 1 when not in use loosely up side of work. Join and break Color 2 throughout.
With Color 1, ch 2.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 3rd row. Join Color 2.
5th row: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to next ch-1 sp. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: With Color 2, as 3rd row. Join Color 1.
7th row: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to next ch-1 sp. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th to 10th rows: With Color 1, as 3rd row. Join Color 2 at end of 10th row.
Rep 5th to 10th rows for Stripe Pat 4 times more, then rep 5th and 6th rows once. Fasten off.
Edging: (RS). Join Color 1 with sl st in lower corner of last row worked and work 1 row of sc evenly up side of Cloth, 3 sc in top corner and sc evenly down opposite side of Cloth, ending at final row. Fasten off. Do not work across final row.
Hanging Loop: 1st rnd: (WS). Join Color 1 with sl st to corner at center of foundation chain. Ch 9. Sl st in same sp as last sl st to form ring. Turn.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Work 16 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (Solids: 1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m; Ombres: 1.5 oz/42.5 g; 68 yds/62 m) or (Solids: 14 oz/400 g; 710 yds/650 m; Ombres: 12 oz/340 g; 608 yds/556 m)
Contrast A: Hot Pink (01740) or color of your choice 1 ball
Contrast B: Creamsicle Ombre (33605) or color of your choice 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 34.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep
from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep
from * ending with 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1
sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. Join A.
5th row: With A, as 3rd row. Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from
beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending with 2 rows of either A or B. Fasten off

materials: Crème de la Crème®: Brown Version: 1 ball each 118 Linen A and 930 Brownstone B
Blue Version: 1 skein each 870 Cornflower Blue A and 995 Ocean B
Pink Version: 1 skein each 710 Pale Pink A and 970 Pretty in Pink B
Susan Bates Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 19 sc and 11 rows = 4” (10 cmin dc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HANGING LOOP
With B, ch 10 and join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 25 sc in ring, join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a 6-8” (15-20 cm) sewing length.
BODY
Note: Work in back loop only throughout Body.
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with a slip st in back loop of any sc, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), working in back loop only, dc in each of next 2 sc, 5 dc in next sc, dc in each of next 3 sc; turn – 11 dc. Place a marker in center st and move marker up as work progresses.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each dc across to marked st, 3 sc in marked center dc, sc in each dc across; turn – 13 sc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each sc across to marked st, 5 dc in marked center sc, dc in each sc across; turn – 17 dc.
Rows 4-20: Repeat Rows 2-3 (8 times); then repeat Row 2 once – 67 sc at end of last row.
STRIPING
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side facing and Hanging Loop on bottom, working in remaining loops of sts in Row 1 of Body, join B with a slip st in first dc, ch 1, sc in each dc across, loosely slip st in side of next sc row, turn – 11 sc.
Row 2 (right side): Working in remaining free loops of sts in same sc row of Body, sc in each st across, 2 slip st in side of next dc row, turn – 13 sc.
Row 3 (wrong side): Working in remaining free loops of sts in same dc row of Body, sc in each st across, slip st in side of next dc row, turn – 17 sc.
Rows 4-20: Repeat Rows 2-3 (8 times; then repeat Row 2 once – 67 sc at end of last row. Fasten off.
Row 21: With right side facing, join A with a slip st at base of first dc in Row 1 of Body, work 7 surface crochet slip sts evenly spaced across base of Row 1. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Main Color (MC) (01628) Hot Orange 1 ball
Contrast A (00002) Black 1 ball
Contrast B (01712) Hot Green 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With MC, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 10 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row 11 times more. 34 sts at end of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 11 times more.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row 11 times more, joining B at end of last row. 10 sts rem.
Next row: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. *1 dc in sc 2 rows below. Miss next sc (behind dc). 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn.
Next row: Sl st in each of first 5 sts. Ch 8. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Sl st in next st. Sl st in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With A, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows twice more, then 2nd row once. 3 sts rem.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sc. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook - sc3tog made. Fasten off.
Mouth
With A, ch 29.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Miss next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in next ch) twice. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Miss next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row once more. Fasten off.
Edging: Join MC with sl st to last row worked in MC on left side. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around sides and bottom edge. Join with sl st to last row worked in MC on right side. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew on Mouth and Eyes as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 0012 Black A, 561 Grape B, and 0010 Coconut C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Colors A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 14 dc = 4" (10 cm); 7 dc rounds = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
With A, ch 4; slip st to first ch made to join ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 15 dc into ring, sl st to join round, do not turn – 16 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, 4 dc in same st, dc in next 3 dc, *5 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * twice, slip st to first dc to join – 32 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 5 dc in next dc, *dc in next 7 dc, 5 dc in next dc; repeat from * twice, dc in next 5 dc, slip st to first dc to join – 48 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, 5 dc in next dc, *dc in next 11 dc, 5 dc in next dc; rep from * twice, dc in last 7 sts, slip st to first dc to join – 64 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 5 dc, 5 dc in next st, *dc in next 15 dc, 5 dc in next dc; repeat from * twice, dc in last 9 dc, slip st to join – 80 dc. Fasten off. Break A, leaving a 6" (15.2 cm) tail.
Border
Join B at any corner (center dc of 5-dc shell) and pull up a loop.
Edge Round: Ch 4 (counts as dc + ch 1), (dc, ch 1, dc) in same st, [ch 1, skip next dc, *dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * to next corner, (dc, ch 1, dc, ch 1, dc) in corner st,] three times, **ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from ** to first dc, slip st to join round – 48 dc, 48 ch spaces.
Fasten off. Break B, leaving a 6" (15.2 cm) tail.
Spiderweb
With C, make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc + ch 1), [dc, ch 1] 7 times in ring, slip st to first dc to join round; tighten beginning yarn tail to close adjustable ring – 8 dc, 8 ch spaces. 
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc + ch 3), [dc in next dc, ch 3] 7 times, slip st to first dct to join – 8 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 8 (counts as dc + ch 5), [dc in next dc, ch 5] 7 times, slip st to first dc to join – 8 dc, 8 ch-5 spaces.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With A and yarn needle, and with right side of dishcloth facing, sew Spiderweb to center of Dishcloth. Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8215 Lemon A, 8012 Licorice B, and 8001 Marshmallow C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
measurements: Mitt measures 9" in circumference x 8" long (23 x 20.5 cm).
gauge: six 3-dc groups = 4" (10 cm); 16 rows = 4" (10 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
MITT
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—12 hdc.
Round 2: Working in spaces between sts, 2 hdc in space between last and first st and in each remaining space around; join with slip st in first hdc—twelve 2-hdc groups.
Round 3: Working in spaces between 2-hdc groups, ch 1, 3 hdc in space beneath join and in each remaining space around; join with slip st in first hdc—twelve 3-hdc groups.
Round 4: Working in spaces between 3-hdc groups, ch 1, 3 hdc in space beneath join and in each remaining space around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Rounds 5–14: Repeat Round 4.
Fasten off. Place marker on Round 6 for placement of eyes.
Round 15: Join B with slip st in any space between 3-hdc groups, ch 1, 3 hdc in same space and in each space around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Round 16: Repeat Round 4. Fasten off.
Rounds 17 and 18: With A, repeat Rounds 15 and 16.
Rounds 19 and 20: Repeat Rounds 15 and 16.
Rounds 21 and 22: Repeat Rounds 17 and 18.
Rounds 23 and 24: Repeat Rounds 15 and 16.
Wing (make 2)
With C, ch 11.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next ch, 2 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, sc in first 3 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, sc in last 3 ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for placement of all pieces.
Eye (work twice)
Flatten mitt and determine front of piece. Leaving a 3" (7.5 cm) tail, join B with slip st in any space between 3-hdc groups of marked round, ch 1, bobble in same space. Fasten off, leaving a 3" (7.5 cm) tail.
Skip space and repeat for 2nd eye in next space.
Smile
With B, ch 13. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Curve smile under eyes where desired and sew in place.
Center wings on Round 13, 3 hdc apart. Sew in place and weave in remaining tails through each wing.
Insert hook in mitt and draw all tails to wrong side. Turn mitt inside out. Tie tails of each eye together with overhand knot.
Weave in all ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m) Black Currant (01318) or Natural Ombre (00228) or Warm Brown (01130) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 44.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 43 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 1 tr in next sc. Rep from * across to last sc, pushing tr to RS of work. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * across to last sc, pushing tr to RS of work. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm], ending on a RS row.
Hanging Loop: Ch 10. Join with sl st in last sc worked. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Tangerine (01699) 4 balls or 465 yds/426 m
Contrast B Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 56 yds/52 m
Contrast A Seabreeze (01201) 4 balls or 465 yds/426 m
Contrast B Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 56 yds/52 m
Contrast A Blueberry (01725) 4 balls or 465 yds/426 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 56 yds/52 m
Contrast A Meadow (01135) 4 balls or 465 yds/426 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 56 yds/52 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] wide x 26½" [67.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
