• For Check edging, carry color not in use across top of entire previous rnd and work sts around it. 
With A, ch 53.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
*1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 52 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 23¼" [59 cm].
Fasten off.
Edging
Join A with sl st to top right corner of Kitchen Towel. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in corner. Work 50 sc evenly across top edge. 5 sc in corner. Work 74 sc evenly down side edge. 5 sc in corner. Work 50 sc evenly across bottom edge. 
5 sc in corner. Work 74 sc evenly up side edge. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Join B with sl st to any center corner sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 4 dc in same st as last sl st. With A, 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. **With B, 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. With A, 1 dc in each of next 2 sts.** Rep from ** to ** to next center corner st. With B, 5 dc in corner st. With A, 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from ** to ** to next center corner st. With B, 5 dc in corner st. With A, 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from ** to ** to next center corner st. With B, 5 dc in corner st. With A, 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from ** to ** to end of rnd. Join with sl st to beg ch-3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc, then rep 2nd rnd once more.
4th rnd: With A, sl st in each dc around. Ch 14 for hanging loop. Join with sl st to first sl st.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® sugar'n cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds; Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
contrast A Warm Brown (01130) (8.5 m/9 yds) or 1 ball
contrast B Petunia (02420) (9.5 m/10 yds) or 1 ball
contrast C Country Red (01530) (3 m/4 yds) or 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
abbreviations: sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] high.
instructions:
cone
note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color. With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
Rep last 2 rows 9 times more. 25 sc.
next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Break A, join B. Place marker at the end of last row.
ice cream scoop
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 25 sts.
Rep last row 11 times more. 3 sts. Fasten off.
edging: With RS facing, turn work upside down. Join B with sl st to first unworked loop of marked row. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in same sp as sl st. *Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Miss next sc. 4 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
cherry
With C, ch 4. 11 sc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 4. Ch 15. Sl st in 1st dc (hanging loop made).
Sew Cherry on top of Ice Cream Scoop as shown in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Country Yellow (01612) 1 ball or 66 yds/50 m
Contrast B Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 14 yds/13 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color.
With MC, ch 17. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). *4 dc in next ch. Re-insert hook into first dc of 4-dc group and pull loop through. Ch 1 to close st – popcorn made. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * 3 times more. 14 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * 3 times more. 2 sc in last dc. Turn. 19 sts.
3rd row:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). *Popcorn in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Popcorn in next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. *Popcorn in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Turn.
6th row: As 4th row.
7th to 17th rows: Rep 3rd to 6th rows twice more, then rep 3rd to 5th rows once.
18th row:  (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Sc2tog.1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * 3 times more. Sc2tog. Turn. 14 sts.
19th row: Ch 3. *Dc2tog. Popcorn in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 10 sts.
20th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Join B. Break MC. Turn. 
Leaves: 1st row: (RS). With B, ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
3rd row: Ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
4th row: Ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
5th row: Ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
6th row: Ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off  ™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Sweet Pink (90023) 6 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Puff cluster = *(Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 7 loops on hook. Ch 1 to close Puff *.
Ch 1. Rep from * to * once more - all in indicated stitch.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st. 
Ch 67. See diagram on page 2.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 65 hdc.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. Puff Cluster in first hdc. *1 sc in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Dcfp. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. 1 dc in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Puff Cluster in last hdc. Turn. 
2nd row: Sl st in ch-1 sp of Puff Cluster. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last d, sc and Puff Cluster. 1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in ch-1 sp of Puff Cluster. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 2. Puff Cluster in Puff Cluster 2 rows below, working over first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Trfp around post of dcfp 2 rows below. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Puff Cluster in ch-1 sp 2 rows below, working over last sc. Turn. 
4th row: As 2nd row. 
5th row: Ch 2. Puff Cluster in Puff Cluster 2 rows below, working over first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Trfp around post of trfp 2 rows below. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Puff Cluster in in Puff Cluster 2 rows below, working over last sc. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows for pat until work from beg measures 28" [71 cm], ending on a 5th row. Do not fasten off. 
FINISHING
Hanging loop: 1st row: Ch 3. 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. *Ch 2. 1 dc around post of dc just made. Rep from * for 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off. Fold loop in half. Sew securely to form loop.

materials: Lily® Sugar n’ Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A (00095 Red) 1 ball
Contrast B (00001 White) 1 ball
Contrast C (00009 Bright Navy) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 11 ins [28 cm] from point to point.
instructions: With A ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 9 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 10 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). (1 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in same sp as last sl st. Miss next dc. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next dc. Miss next dc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 2. 3rd rnd: With B, sl st in next hdc. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 3 times more. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in next hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. Join C with sl st to top of ch 2. 4th rnd: With C, sl st in next hdc. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in next hdc. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * 3 times more. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. Join B with sl st to top of ch 2. 5th rnd: With B, sl st in next hdc. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 3 times more. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. Join A with sl st to top of ch 2. 6th rnd: With A, sl st in next hdc. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. *(2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * 3 times more. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Miss next 2 hdc. Join B with sl st to top of ch 2. Cont as established, working 1 more hdc before each (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) group and working 1 rnd each of B, C, B and A. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball
Contrast A Tangerine (01699) 1 ball
Contrast B Sage Green (00084) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Peach
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd or row counts as dc. With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to top of ch-3. Break MC. 60 dc.
6th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Break A. 72 sc.
Side of Peach: Join MC with sl st to 8th sc of previous rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 tr in next sc. (2 tr in next sc. 1 tr in each of next 5 sc) twice. 2 tr in next sc. 1 tr in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Break MC. Do not turn. 26 sts.
Edging: Join A with sl st to 7th sc of 6th rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Working across side of Peach: (1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. 1 sc in next sc of 6th rnd. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop: With 2 strands of B held tog, join with sl st to top of Peach. Ch 12. Join with first sl st. Fasten off.
Leaf: With B, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 5 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of ch, 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 5 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Leaf to Peach near Hanging Loop.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball or 40.5 yds/37 m
Contrast B Rose Pink (00046) 1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Carry color not in use along side of work.
Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rows.
With B, work 2 rows.
These 4 rows form Stripe Pat.
DISHCLOTH
With A, ch 26. See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Skip next 2 ch. 5 dc in next ch. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sc as ch-3. *Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in last sc. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sc as ch-3. *Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in last sc. Join A. Turn.
First 4 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows for Shell Pat and cont in Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 7½" [19 cm], ending on a 4th row.
Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as sl st. (Work sc evenly across side to next corner. 5 sc in next corner) 3 times. Work sc evenly across last side. 2 sc same sp as sl st. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz /70.9 oz; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC)  Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball
Contrast A  Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball
Contrast B  Tangerine (01699) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions: NOTES When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Carry color not in use across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding. With MC, ch 37. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 36 sc. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Beg working Chart until 28th row of Chart is complete. Break A and B. Next 2 rows: With MC only, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row . Turn. Fasten off at end of last row. Border 1st rnd: With RS facing, join A with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as sl st. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Dishcloth, working 33 sc along each side edge, and having 3 sc in each corner. Break A. Join B with sl st to first sc. 144 sc. 2nd rnd: With B, *Skip next sc. 4 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby Cotton™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 145 yds/133 m) Contrast A Cotton (7100) 1 ball
Red Heart® Scrubby Smoothie™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 153 yds/140 m) Contrast B Tan (9330) 1 ball
Contrast C Cherry (9319) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch or space. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
With A, ch 22.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 21 sts. 
2nd to 7th rows:   Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
At end of 7th row, break A. Join B. 
8th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sts. Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of last 10 sts. Turn. 
9th to 14th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
At end of 14th row, break B. Join A. Turn.
15th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
16th and 17th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
At end of 17th row. break A. Join C.
18th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
19th to 24th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off after 24th row. 
Ch 10 for hanging loop. Sl st in first ch to form hanging loop. Fasten off. 
Finishing: Join A with sl st to base of hanging loop. Ch 1. 20 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
With A, chain stitch Eyes as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8215 Lemon A, 8260 Orange B, and 8012 Licorice C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, sewing needle and ecru thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 8 dc = 1½" (4 cm); Rounds 1–3 = 3¼" (8.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Head
With A, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in same st as join, (ch 1, 2 dc) in each remaining st, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—96 dc and 48 ch-1 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in each dc and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—144 dc. Fasten off.
Mane
Round 1: Join B with sc in any unworked front loop of Round 4, *ch 4, dc in 3rd ch from hook and in next ch, skip next 2 front loops, sc in next front loop; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Top of Nose
With B, ch 5.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch. Fasten off.
Bottom of Nose
With C, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc2tog in 2nd and 3rd ch from hook, sc2tog in last 2 ch, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Eye (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph for placement of facial features. Sew all pieces with sewing needle and thread.
Nose Sew top and bottom pieces to center of head.
Eyes Sew in place on Round 2.
Mouth With C, embroider smiling mouth with back stitches under nose.
Trim “eyelash” strands from facial features to emphasize their shape. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 10 Coconut A, 215 Bamboo B, 905 Cherry C, and 715 Primrose D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Tapestry needle, sewing needle and white thread, ½ yd black worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Mitt measures 5½” (14 cm) across face x 8½” (21.5 cm) long, excluding hanging loop.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ribbed Cuff
With A, ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—7 sc.
Rows 2–16: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Beard
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc in each row across, turn—16 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc, turn—18 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat Row 3 until piece measures 3½” (9 cm) from bottom edge of ribbed cuff; change to B at end of last row.
Face
Repeat Row 3 until piece measures 4¾” (12 cm) from bottom edge of ribbed cuff; change to A at end of last row.
Repeat Row 3 three times; leaving a long beginning tail for sewing, change to C at end of last row.
Hat
Rows 1 and 2: Repeat Row 3 of beard.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—16 sc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 3 of beard.
Rows 5–12: Repeat last 2 rows 4 times—8 sc at end of Row 12.
Rows 13 and 14: Ch 1, [sc2tog] across, turn—2 sc at end of Row 14.
Fasten off.
BACK
Work same as front, omitting all color changes except C for hat.
Mustache
With A, ch 10. 
Row 1 (right side): Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, 3 dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, slip st in next ch, hdc in next ch, 3 dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, slip st in last ch. 
Fasten off.
Nose
With D, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop
With A, ch 10; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for placement of facial features. 
With sewing needle and thread, sew mustache to center of face above beard and sew nose to head above mustache. 
With black yarn, embroider satin stitch eye on each side of nose on face.
Taking care to match colors and leaving bottom edge open for wearer’s hand, sew front and back together with A-colored across side edges of cuff, beard, and face and with C-colored tails across side edges of hat.
With end tail, sew hanging loop to top point of hat. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Main Color (MC) (00001) White 1 ball
Contrast A (00002) Black 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With MC, ch 29.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 28 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 6½ ins [16.5 cm].
Top shaping: Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn. Rep last row 8 times more. 10 sts rem at end of last row. Fasten off.
Lower edging: 1st row: With WS facing, join MC with sl st to bottom left corner. Ch 1. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, work 2 sc in first ch. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: *Miss next 2 sc. 6 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * end of row. Do not fasten off.
Outer edging: Next row: Ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly along right side, across top and down left side. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2): With A, ch 8.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Sew Eyes to front of Ghost as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 709 Bubblegum A, 10 Coconut B, 905 Cherry C, 938 Almond D and 241 Duckie E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 5” [13 cm] across at widest point.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
CUPCAKE
With A, ch 18.
Set-Up Row (Wrong Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across –15 dc. 
Row 1: Ch 2 (does not count as stitch here and throughout), turn, hdc in first st, Fpdc, *Bpdc, Fpdc; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, hdc in first st, Bpdc, *Fpdc, Bpdc; repeat from * to last st, hdc in last st.
Repeat Rows 1-2 twice more, then Row 1 once. Fasten off.
FROSTING 
Edge
With B, ch 18.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [skip next ch, Shell in next ch, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 5 times, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc in skipped ch, sc in Shell, sc in skipped ch; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st. Fasten off. 
Repeat to make a second edge, do not fasten off.
Joining Row (Right Side): Holding wrong sides of Edges together with sts of last row matching up, using yarn from second Edge piece and working through both layers to join, ch 1, sc 17 sts evenly spaced across last row.
Rows 2-3: Ch 2, turn, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in each st to end – 19 hdc. 
Rows 4-5: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st to end. 
Row 6: Ch 2, turn, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 2 sts, hdc2tog – 17 hdc. 
Rows 7-8: Hdc2tog, *hdc, hdc2tog; repeat from * to end – 7 hdc.
Row 9: Hdc2tog, hdc in next st, [hdc2tog] twice. Fasten off. 
CHERRY
With C, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, work 10 sc in ring. Fasten off. 
STEM
With D, ch 10. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Fit last row of Cupcake in between lower scalloped edges of joined Frosting pieces and sew pieces together.
Sew Cherry in center of top edge of Frosting. 
Fold Stem in half and sew ends to top edge of Frosting. 
With A and E, embroider straight stitch sprinkles randomly around Frosting. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 51 yds/46 m
Contrast B Country Yellow (01612) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m
Contrast C Red (00095) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m
Contrast D Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m
Contrast E Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m
Contrast F Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 13 yds/12 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Dc3(4-7)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch or space. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 (4-7) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scfp = Draw up a loop around post of next sc, working from front to back. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 16 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Catherine Wheel Pat.
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With A, work 1 row.
With B, work 2 rows.
With C, work 2 rows.
With D, work 2 rows.
With E, work 2 rows.
With F, work 2 rows.
With E, work 2 rows.
With D, work 2 rows.
With C, work 2 rows.
With B, work 2 rows.
With A, work 1 row.
These 20 rows form Stripe Pat.
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

DISHCLOTH
See Diagram on page 2.
WIth A, ch 47
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. *Skip next 3 ch. 7 dc in next ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last 4 ch. Skip next 3 ch. 4 dc in last ch. Join B. Turn.
2nd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. *Ch 3. Dc7tog (over next 2 dc, next 3 sc and next 2 dc). Ch 3. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Ch 3. Dc4tog (over next 2 dc and last 2 sc). Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 3 dc in top of dc4tog. *Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Skip next ch-3 sp. 7 dc in top of dc7tog. Rep from * to last ch-3 and 2 sc. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join C. Turn.
4th row: With C, ch 3 (counts as first dc). Dc3tog (over next sc and next 2 dc). *Ch 3. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 3. Dc7tog (over next 2 dc, next 3 sc and next 2 dc). Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 3. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Skip next ch-3 sp. 7 dc in top of dc7tog. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp and 2 sts. Skip next ch-3 sp. 4 dc in turning ch-3. Join D. Turn.
First 5 rows of Stripe Pat are now complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 2nd to 5th rows for Catherine Wheel Pat until all 20 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Fasten off.
Border
1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 1. Work in sc evenly around, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Work 1 scfp around each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Ch 16 for hanging loop. Sl st back into each ch of loop. Fasten off leaving long end. Thread end onto yarn needle and join opposite end of loop into corner.

materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
contrast A Yellow (00010) 1 ball
contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball
contrast C Jute (00082) 1 ball
contrast D Ecru (00004) 1 ball
contrast E Mod Pink (01444) 1 ball
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6½" [16.5 cm] wide x 11" [28 cm] long.
instructions:
notes: 
•  When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
•  Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
With B, ch 2.
1st row: (WS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc) twice. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Break B. Join C. Turn. 6 sc.
4th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 7 sc. 
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 11 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
7th to 10th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 19 sc at end of 10th row. Break C. Join A.
11th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
12th row: (RS). Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. (Dcfp around post of next sc 1 row below. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc) 4 times. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 hdc. (Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc) 4 times. Turn.
14th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. (Dcfp. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc) 4 times. Turn.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 hdc. (Dcbp. 1 sc in first hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc) 3 times. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn. 22 sts.
16th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. (Dcfp. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. Dcfp. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 hdc. (Dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 4 hdc) 3 times. Dcbp. 1 sc in each of last 3 hdc. Turn.
18th to 27th rows: Rep 16th and 17th rows 5 times more.
28th row: As 16th row. Break A. Join B. Turn.
29th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Break B. Join A. Turn.
30th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Break A. Do not turn.
31st row: (RS). Join D with sl st in first sc of 30th row. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off. Do not turn.
32nd row: (RS). Join D with sl st in horizontal bar created below first hdc of previous row (bar is on WS, below loops normally worked). Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each horizontal bar of previous hdc to end of row. Fasten off. Do not turn.
33rd row: As 32nd row.
34th row: (RS). Join E with sl st in horizontal bar created below first hdc of previous row. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each horizontal bar of previous hdc to end of row. Turn.
35th to 37th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
38th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. 20 sc. Turn.
39th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. 18 sc. Fasten off.
edging: With RS facing, join B with sl st at side edge of last sc in 3rd row. Ch 1. Work 3 sc along side edge to ‘point’ of 1st row, 3 sc in point and 3 sc up side edge to beg of 3rd row. Join C. With C, work 6 sc along side of 4th to 10th rows. Join A. With A, work 25 sc up side of 11th to 20th rows. Join D. With D, work 3 sc up side of 21st to 23rd rows. Join E. With E, work 5 sc up side of 24th to 29th rows, 18 sc across top edge and 5 sc down opposite side of 29th to 24th rows. Join D. With D, work 3 sc down side of 23rd to 21st rows. Join A. With A, work 25 sc down side of 20th to 11th rows. Join C. With C, work 6 sc along side of 10th to 4th rows. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (Twists 340 g/12 oz; 556 m/608 yds)
Contrast A (42302 Tamari Twists) 12 m / 13 yds
Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (Solids 400 g/14 oz; 616 m/674 yds)
Contrast B (27300 Plum) 65 m / 72 yds
Contrast C (27610 Gold) 40 m / 44 yds
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st and in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc. Break A.
6th rnd: With B, Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 5 ch. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 18 times more. Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Sl st in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 points.
Beg working in rows:
1st row: Ch 1. *Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in side of last sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Miss next sl st and sc. Rep from * end of row. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
2nd row: (WS). Join C with sl st in any top ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from *end of row, ending with: 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd row: Sl st in first sc and ch-2 sp. Working in back loops only, (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * end of row, ending with 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Last row forms pat.
Cont in pat until work measures 10" [25.5 cm] diameter, ending with a WS row. Break C.
With RS facing, join B with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Rep last row twice more. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/ 2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball
Contrast B Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball

Size U.S. H or 8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 8. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 16 sc in ring. Join B with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. 2 tr in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 4. 32 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as tr). (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in same sp as last sl st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. *(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next tr. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Rep from * once more. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – counts as cluster. **Ch 3. (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in same sp as last tr. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next tr. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – cluster made. Rep from ** to end of rnd. Ch 3. Join C with sl st to top of first cluster.
4th rnd: With C, ch 6. Sl st in 4th ch from hook. 3 tr in same sp as sl st at end of 3rd rnd. 1 sc in top of next cluster. *Ch 6. Sl st in 4th ch from hook. 3 tr in same sp as last sc. 1 sc in top of next cluster. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to base of first cluster. Fasten off.

abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] square, excluding ears and paws.
instructions:
Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry colors not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it.
With A, ch 21. With B, ch 12. See Chart on page 3.
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. With A, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 sc.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. First 2 rows of Chart are complete.
Cont working Chart to end of Chart, working 1 sc in each sc as established, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right.
Fasten off at end of 34th row of Chart.
Paw Extensions: (See Chart).
1st row: (RS). Working in rem loops of foundation ch, join B with sl st to first B sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 5 sc.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Work 2nd Paw Extension in same manner.
Following chart, using Straight stitch with D, embroider 3 claws on each Paw.
Straight Stitch
Ears: (See Chart).
First Ear: With RS facing, join B with sl st to 6th sc at top of Dishcloth.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Second Ear: With RS facing, join C with sl st to 24th sc at top of Dishcloth.
Work as given for First Ear.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Eyes: With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc. Fasten off D.
4th rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st to back loop of any sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. Fasten off.
Using Satin stitch, with C, embroider White dot on each eye (see photo).
Following Chart as guide, sew Eyes in position, 6 rows down from top edge and spaced 5 sc apart.
Satin Stitch
Nose: With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. Fasten off. 
Following Chart as guide, sew Nose in position, 2 rows below Eyes and centered between Eyes.
Following Chart as guide, with D, embroider mouth using Stem stitch.
Whiskers: Following Chart as guide, with E, embroider whiskers using Stem stitch.
Stem Stitch

Do not join at end of rnds. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 20 sc. 3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc. 5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 50 sc. Join with sl st to next st. Fasten off. Texture Layer: Join yarn with sl st in first unworked front loop at center of Foundation Piece. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st into same st. *Sl st in unworked front loop of next st. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st into same st. Rep from * until all unworked front loops have been worked around Foundation Piece. Ch 12 for hanging loop. Join with sl st to 12th ch from hook. Fasten off.

of A, B, C, D, E and F will make 3

ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 4. 
16 tr. Fasten off.

to any tr. Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr 
in same sp. 2 tr in each tr around. 
Join with sl st to top of ch 4. 32 tr. 
Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to 
any tr. Ch 3 (counts as dc). *2 dc in 
next tr. 1 dc in next tr.  Rep from * 
to last tr. 2 dc in last tr. Join with 
sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join Color 4 with sl st to 
any dc. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 10. 1 sc) in 
same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. 
Skip next 2 dc.(1 sc. Ch 10. 1 sc) in 
next dc. Rep from * 6 times more.

Leave rem 2 dc unworked.

Skip next ch-3 sp. Sl st in next 
sc. Skip next ch-3 sp. Rep from *

in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 3. Skip

in next dc) 3 times. Skip next (dc,

abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B

measurements: Scrubby measures about 9" [23 cm] wide and 8" [20.5 cm] tall.
gauge: Rounds 1 and 2 = 3½" [9 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With 2 strands of yarn held together, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), work 11 more dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st as join, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in same st as join, sc in next 4 sts, hdc in next st, (hdc, dc) in next st, dc in next st, (dc, tr, edc) in next st, dc in next st, (dc, hdc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next 5 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, (dc, tr) in next st, 2 tr in each of next 2 sts, (tr, dc) in next st, (dc, hdc) in next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st, sc in next st, (hdc, dc) in next st, (dc, tr) in next st, 2 tr in each of next 2 sts, (tr, dc) in next st, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—50 sts.
Round 5: Ch 1, turn, skip joining slip st, slip st in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, (dc, tr) in next st, 2 tr in next st, (etr, tr) in next st, (tr, dc) in next st, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, slip st in next 5 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, (dc, tr) in next st, (tr, etr) in next st, 2 tr in next st, (tr, dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st; leave remaining sts unworked.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7230 Peachy A, 7105 Loofa B, and 7942 Blissful Print C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scrubby measures 6" wide from point to point (15 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Notes
1. Scrubby is worked in continuous (spiral) rounds, do not join until instructed.
2. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
SCRUBBY (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker in first st. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—24 sc. 
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sc. 
Round 6: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—36 sc. 
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—42 sc. 
Round 8: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—48 sc. 
Round 9: *Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—54 sc. 
Round 10: *Sc in next 8 sts, (sc, hdc, sc) in next st; repeat from * around—66 sts. 
Round 11: Sc in next 9 sts, 3 sc in next hdc, *sc in next 10 sts, 3 sc in next hdc; repeat from * around to last st; sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—78 sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Peaches & Crème® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Version 1
Contrast A Gold (11605) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Contrast B White (11005) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Contrast C Bright Orange (11628) 1 ball or 18 yds/16.5 m
Version 2
Contrast A Bright Orange (11628) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m

Contrast C Gold (11605) 1 ball or 18 yds/16.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Scfp = Draw up a loop around post of next sc, working from front to back. Yoh and draw through both loops on hook
gauge: 15 sts and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
Carry color not in use across top of 
row and work sts around it.
To join new color, work to last 
loops on hook, yoh with new color 
to complete st and proceed with 
new color.
With A, ch 36.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd 
ch from hook. (1 dc in next ch. 1 sc 
in next ch) twice, joining B in last 
st. *With B, (1 dc in next ch. 1 sc 
in next ch) twice. 1 dc in next ch, 
joining A. With A, (1 sc in next ch. 
1 dc in next ch) twice. 1 sc in next 
ch, joining B. Rep from * twice 
more, omitting joining B at end of 
row. Turn. 35 sts.
2nd row: With A, ch 3 (counts as 
dc). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next 
sc) twice, joining B in last st. *With 
B, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 
twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining A. 
With A, (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next 
dc) twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining 
A. Rep from * twice more, omitting 
joining B at end of row. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first 
dc. (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 
twice, joining B in last st. *With B, 
(1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 
twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining A. 
With A, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next 
sc) twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining B. 
Rep from * twice more, joining B at 
end of row. Turn.
4th row:  With B, ch 3 (counts as 
dc). (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next 
sc) twice, joining A in last st. *With 
A, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc) 
twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining B. 
With B, (1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next 
dc) twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining 
A. Rep from * twice more, omitting 
joining A at end of row. Turn.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first 
dc. (1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 
twice, joining A in last st. *With A, 
(1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc) 
twice. 1 dc in next sc, joining B. 
With B, (1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next 
sc) twice. 1 sc in next dc, joining A. 
Rep from * twice more, omitting 
joining A at end of row. Turn.
6th row: As 4th row, joining A at 
end of row.
7th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows for pat until 
work from beg measures approx 9" 
[23 cm], ending on a 3rd row of pat. 
Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join C with 
sl st in bottom left corner. Ch 1. 
Work 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. 
Work 33 sc across rem loops of 
foundation ch. Work 3 sc in next 
corner. Work 33 sc up side edge. 
Work 3 sc in next corner. Work 1 sc 
in each st across top edge. Work 
3 sc in next corner. Work 33 sc 
down side edge. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Work 1 scfp 
around each sc around. Join with 
sl st to first sc. Ch 16 for loop. Sl st 
back into each ch of loop. Fasten 
off leaving long end. Thread end 
onto tapestry needle and join 
opposite end of loop into corner.

abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work 2 rows below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dtrfp = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
instructions: Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. With A, ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring. See diagram on page 2. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. 2nd rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. 3rd rnd: With A, ch 3. *1 dtrfp around dc of 1st rnd. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dtrfp around dc of 1st rnd. 1 dc in last dc. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dtrfp sts. 4th rnd: With B, ch 3. *2 dc in next dtrfp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 2 dc in next dtrfp. 1 dc in last dc. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 5th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *1 dtrfp around dtrfp 2 rnds below. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dtrfp around dtrfp 2 rnds below. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dtrfp sts. 6th rnd: With B, ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dtrfp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 2 dc in next dtrfp. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join A with sl st to top of ch 3. 7th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *1 dtrfp around dtrfp 2 rnds below. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dtrfp around dtrfp 2 rnds below. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join B with sl st to top of ch 3. 8th rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as tr). 3 tr in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dtrfp. 1 sc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 7 tr in next dc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dtrfp. 1 sc in next dc. Skip last 2 dc. 3 tr in first st. Join A with sl st to top of ch 4. 9th rnd: With A, ch 15 (for loop). 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 3 tr. 1 sc in next sc. Dcfp around dtrfp 2 rnds below. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 tr. 2 sc in next tr. Rep from * 10 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Wine (00015) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m

Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

abbreviations: Dc3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
BEET
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of each rnd counts as dc.
• Join end of each rnd with sl st in 3rd ch of first ch-3.
With A, ch 8. See diagram on page 2.
**1st rnd: 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 3 dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 6 dc in last ch. Rotate work to cont working along opposite side of foundation ch: skip 1st ch (ch just worked into). 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 3 dc in last ch. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 18 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same st as last sl st. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in each of next 6 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in each of last 3 dc. Join. 30 dc.**
Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Skip first 8 dc. Re-join A with sl st in 9th dc. Ch 3. *(1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc) 6 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * once more, ending with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join. 42 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *(1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 6 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * once more, ending with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join. 54 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. *(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc) 6 times. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * once more ending with 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Join. 66 dc.
Fasten off.
Cont in rows as follows:
1st row: (RS). Skip first 15 sts. Join B with sl st in 16th st. Ch 1. Skip first st. (1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 2 sc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. (2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc) twice. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off leaving rem sts unworked. Do not Turn. 39 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Skip first 17 dc of last row. Re-join B with sl st in 18th dc. Ch 2. Skip first st. Dc3tog. Ch 2. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
LEAVES (Make 1 each in C and D)
Ch 8.
1st and 2nd rnds: Rep from ** to ** as for Beet.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. (1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc) 3 times. Fasten off, leaving rem sts unworked.
FINISHING
Overlap and sew Leaves to top of Beet as shown in photo.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 hdc.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 25 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 20 hdc.

9th rnd: With B and working in front loops only, *Sl st in next hdc. Ch 3. (1 dc. 1 tr) all in next hdc. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby™: 1 ball each 709 Bubblegum A and 982 Zesty B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]

abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
With A, ch 27.
Row 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch, *skip next 2 ch, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in next ch, sc in next 3 ch; repeat from * to last 5 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 2 ch, 2 sc in last ch.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, *skip next 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last 5 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last st.
Rows 3-4: With B, repeat Row 2.
Rows 5-6: With A, repeat Row 2.
Repeat Rows 3-6 for three more times. Cut A.
Edging
Round 1: Turn to work along outside edges, with B, ch 1, [sc evenly spaced along straight edge, 2 sc in corner, turn to work along zigzag edge, sc evenly spaced along edge, working ch st at each point, to next corner, 2 sc in corner] twice, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)

Contrast A Sage Green (00084) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" x 8" x 8" [20 x 20 x 20 cm].
instructions:
Strawberry
With MC, ch 4. Join in rnd with sl st to 
form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in 
ring. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2) twice in ring. 
Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and 
next ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
(2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl 
st. [Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 
sp] twice. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top 
of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and 
next ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
(2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl 
st. [Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. (3 
dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] twice. 
Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Join 
with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and 
next ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc).
(2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl 
st. [(Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp) twice. 
Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 
sp] twice. (Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp) 
twice. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of 
ch 3.
5th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc 
and next ch-2 sp. Ch 3 (counts as 
dc). (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as 
last sl st. [(Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-2 sp)
3 times. Ch 2. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next 
ch-2 sp] twice. (Ch 2. 3 dc in next ch-2 
sp) 3 times. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top 
of ch 3.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in each of next 2 dc. [5 dc in next  
ch-2 sp. (1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc 
in next ch-2 sp) 4 times. 1 dc in each of 
next 3 dc] twice. 5 dc in next ch-2 sp. 
(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next 
ch-2 sp) 4 times. Join with sl st to top 
of ch 3.
Fasten off.
Leafy Top
With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of 
row. 10 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1.*2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 
15 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. (1 sc. Ch 
6. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep
from * to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Miss next
sc. *(1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. 2 tr. Ch 3. Sl st in
first ch – picot made. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc.
1 sc) all in next ch-6 sp. Miss next 4 sc.
Rep from * 3 times more. (1 sc. 1 hdc.
1 dc. 2 tr.  Picot. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) all
in next ch-6 sp. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop
With 2 strands of A held tog, join 
with sl st to top of Strawberry. Ch 12. 
Join with sl st in same sp as first sl st. 
Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby® (3.5 oz/100 g; 92 yds/85 m)

instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Front and Back (make 2 alike)
See diagram on page 2.
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 sc in next hdc) twice. Sl st in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Sl st in each of next 2 hdc. (2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc) twice. Join. 26 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sl sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 dc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sl sts. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join.
Fasten off.
With WS of Front and Back of Pear tog, join A with sl st. Working through both thicknesses and in back loops only, sl st evenly around to join edges. Fasten off.
Leaf and Stem Loop

1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch.

materials: Crème de la Creme®: 1 ball of each 252 Brite Orange, 200 Sunshine, 720 Brite Pink, 910 Wood Violet, 701 Orchid Pink
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.0mm [US H-8]
Tapestry needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 4” (10 cm) across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
Ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc now and throughout), 9 dc in ring, slip st in top of ch-3 to join—10 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc between ch-3 of Round 1 and 2nd st of Round 1, dc in 2nd st of Round 1, dc between 2nd and 3rd sts of Round 1, dc in 3rd st of Round 1; continue working [dc between next pair of sts, dc in 2nd st of each pair] around, dc between last dc of Round 1 and ch-3 of Round 1, slip st in top of ch-3 of Round 2 to join—20 dc. 
Round 3: Slip st between ch-3 of Round 2 and 2nd st of Round 2, ch 3, dc in same space between sts, ch 1, skip 2 sts, 2 dc between 3rd and 4th sts of Round 2; continue working [ch 1, skip 2 sts, 2 dc between pair of sts] around, ch 1, skip last st and ch-3 of Round 2, slip st in top of ch-3 of Round 3 to join—20 dc, 10 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in first dc and ch-1 space, (ch 3, dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in same ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip 2 dc, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 8 times, ch 1, slip st in top of ch-3 to join—40 dc, 20 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in first dc and ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-1 space, *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 18 times, ch 1, slip st in top of ch-3 to join—60 dc, 20 ch-1 spaces.
Round 6: Slip st in first 2 dc and ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip 3 dc, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 8 times, ch 1, skip 3 dc, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, slip st in top of ch-3 to join—70 dc, 30 ch-1 spaces.
Round 7: Slip st in first 2 dc and ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-1 space, *ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 28 times, ch 1, slip st in top of ch-3 to join—90 dc, 30 ch-1 spaces.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same st and each dc and ch-1 space around, slip st in first sc to join; ch 1, turn—120 sc.
Round 9 (Wrong Side): Sc in first sc, *skip 2 sc, 5 dc in next sc (Shell made), skip 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * 18 times, skip 2 sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip 2 sc, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off—20 Shells, 20 sc.
FINISHING
Weave in loose ends. Block to shape.

materials: Red Heart® Scrubby Smoothie®: 1 ball each 9313 Loofa
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 13 dc = 4" [10 cm]; 5½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DISHCLOTH
Ch 25.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 24 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, working in back loops only, dc next st, *ch 2, skip 2 sts, working in both loops, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * to last 2 sts, working in back loops only, dc in last 2 sts.
Row 4: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, working in back loops only, hdc in next st, *ch 2, skip next 2 dc, working over ch-2 space and into sts in row below, dc in both loops of next 2 sts; repeat from * to last 2 sts, working in back loops only, hdc in last 2 sts.
Repeat Row 4 until piece measures 6½" [16.5 cm] from beginning.
Next Row: Ch 2, turn, working in back loops only, hdc in next st, *hdc in next 2 sts, working over ch-2 space and into sts in row below, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * to last 2 sts, working in back loops only, hdc in last 2 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in first 2 sts, sc in each st to last 2 sts, working in back loops only, sc in last 2 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays™ Sparkle (2.8 oz/80 g; 138 yds/126 m) - White Sparkle (48005) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with 
sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up loop. Yoh 
and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice 
in same sp as sl st. Yoh and draw through 
all loops on hook - beg cluster made. *Ch 
3. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw 
through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next 
sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on 
hook - cluster made. Rep from * 4 times 
more. Ch 3. Join with sl st to beg cluster. 
6 clusters.
3rd rnd: *Ch 7. Sl st to next cluster. Rep 
from * 5 times more.
4th rnd: (Beg cluster. Ch 7. Cluster) in top 
of first cluster of 2nd rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in next 
ch-7 sp. Ch 1. *(Cluster. 
Ch 7. Cluster) in top of next cluster of 2nd 
rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in next ch-7 sp. Ch 1. Rep 
from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to beg 
cluster.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Sl 
st in same ch-7 sp as last sl st. Ch 4. (1 dc. 
Ch 3. 1 tr. Ch 3. 1 dc) in same ch-7 sp as last 
sl st. Ch 4. Sl st in next cluster. 1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc.** 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 
Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** 
once. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *5 hdc in next ch-4 sp. 4 hdc 
in next ch-3 sp. 1 tr in next tr. Ch 3. Sl st in 
3rd ch from hook - picot made. 4 hdc in 
next ch-3 sp. 5 hdc in next ch-4 sp. Miss 
next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * 5 times 
more. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
7th rnd: Join yarn with sl st in any picot 
loop. Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc and ch 3). *1 dc 
in each of next 3 hdc. Picot. 1 dc in each 
of next 3 hdc. Ch 1. Miss next 6 hdc. 1 dc in 
each of next 3 hdc. Picot. 1 dc in each of 
next 3 hdc. Ch 3.** 1 dc in next picot. Picot. 
Ch 3. Rep from * 4 times more, then from 
* to ** once. Sl st in 3rd ch of ch 6. Picot. 
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70 g / 2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A Mod Blue (01111) 1 ball
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball
Contrast C Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast A Country Red (01530) 1 ball
Contrast C Hot Purple (01317) 1 ball
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast A Mod Pink (01444) 1 ball
Contrast C Tangerine (01699) 1 ball
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Carry color not in use across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding.
With B, ch 35.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next ch. Join A. *With A, 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Join B. With B, 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Join A. Rep from * across. Turn. 33 dc.
2nd row: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *Join C. With C, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Join A. With A, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Join B. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Join A. *With A, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Join B. With B, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Join A. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for Gingham Pat until work from beg measures approx 10" [25.5 cm], ending with a 2nd row of pat. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st in any corner. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. Work sc around, having 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

pattern_name: LILY SUGAR'N CREAM STRIPES DISHCLOTH TO CROCHET OR KNIT
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes (56.7 g / 2 oz) Crochet Version #21114 (Tie Dye Stripes) 1 ball
Knit Version #21143 (Country Stripes) 1 ball
OR Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes Super Size (70.9 g / 2.5 oz) Crochet Version #23114 (Tie Dye Stripes) 1 ball
Knit Version #23143 (Country Stripes) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook
OR Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge
gauge: Crochet version 12 sc and 13 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
CROCHET VERSION
Ch 37. 
1st row:(RS). 
1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1.
Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep
from * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch.
36 sts. Turn.
2nd row:Ch 1. 
1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next
ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc
in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for 10 ins [25.5 cm].
Fasten off.
KNIT VERSION
Cast on 37 sts.
Knit every row (garter st) for 
10 ins [25.5 cm]. Cast off knitwise.

materials: Lily® Sugar n' Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Papaya (90014) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work 1 row below, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
instructions:
Ch 41. 
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 39 dc. 
2nd row:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 
3rd row:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows of Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 10” [25.5 cm]. 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™: 1 ball each 7760 Lemony A, 7501 Caribbean B, 7230 Peachy C and 7503 Lavender D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
FLOWER (make 3: 1 each with A & B, A & C, and A & D)
With A, ch 4; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as first sc, ch 3), *sc in ring, ch 3; repeat from * 6 times; join with slip st in first ch of beginning ch—7 ch-3 sps. Fasten off. Note: Hold piece with right side facing and push each ch-3 toward center as Round 2 is worked.
Round 2: Inserting hook through wrong side of ch-3 spaces and then in center of ring, join 2nd color with slip st in any ch-3 space, ch 3 (counts as first sc, ch 2), sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2; repeat from * 5 times; join with slip st in base of beginning ch—6 ch-2 sps.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-2 space, (ch 3, dc, 2 tr, dc, ch 3, slip st) in same space (petal made), (slip st, ch 3, dc, 2 tr, dc, ch 3, sl st) in each ch-2 space around; join in beginning slip st—6 petals. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 24 yds/21 m
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast B Dark Pine (00016) 1 ball or 50 yds/46 m
Contrast C Black (00002) 1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
Contrast D Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Small quantity Red (00095) yarn to embroider mouth
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 12" [30.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
See Diagram on page 2.
Face: With MC, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 9 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 12 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 15 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 18 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Turn. 21 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 3 sts each row until there are 36 sc.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not turn.
Working along straight top edge, work 24 sc evenly across.
Fasten off.

Beard: 1st row: (RS). Join A with sl st to first sc. Ch 2 (does not count as st). Working around curved edge in back loops only, 1 hdc in each of next 9 sc. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 5 dc in next sc. (Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip next sc. 5 dc in next sc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 5 dc in next sc. (Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip next sc. 5 dc in next sc) twice. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 sc. Do not turn. Break A. Join B.

Hat
1st row: (RS). With B, ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in side of next hdc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. 1 sc in side of next hdc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 36 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th to 6th rows: As 3rd row 3 times more. Fasten off.
Hat shaping: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 5 sc. Join C with sl st to next (6th) sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last 6 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
4th and 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Break C. Join B at end of 5th row.
With B, rep 2nd to 5th rows 4 times more, then 3rd row once. 13 sts. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join B with sl st to bottom right edge of Hat. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around edge of Hat, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first ch of bottom left Hat edge. Fasten off.

Golden Buckle
With D, ch 28. Join with sl st to first ch. Fasten off.
Sew Buckle into square shape on front of Hat as shown in photo.

FINISHING
With C, embroider eyes as shown in photo using chain stitch. With Red, embroider mouth as shown in photo using chain stitch.
